in act. sense, to divide, distribute, διὰ παῦρα δασάσκετο (Ionic for ἐδάσατο), Il.; διεδάσαντο τὴν ληΐην Hdt.; ἐς φυλὰς διεδάσαντο distributed them among the tribes, Hdt.

div1.head: διαδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to shew clearly, shew plainly, Hdt.; c. part., διαδεξάτω κηδόμενος let him shew that he cares, Hdt.:—Pass., διαδεικνύσθω ἐὼν πολέμιος let him be declared the kingʼs enemy, Hdt.
intr. in forms διέδεξε, ὡς διέδεξε, it was clear, manifest, Hdt.

div1.head: διαδέκτωρ
div1.sense: as adj., πλοῦτος δ. inherited wealth, Eur.

div1.head: διαδέξιος
div1.sense: of good omen, Hdt.

div1.head: διαδέρκομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to see through, οὐδʼ ἂν νῶϊ διαδράκοι would not see us through (the cloud), Il.

div1.head: διάδετος
div1.sense: bound fast, χαλινοὶ διάδετοι γενύων ἱππείων bits firm bound through the horseʼs mouth, Aesch.

div1.head: διαδέχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
to receive one from another, Lat. excipere, δ. λόγον to take up the word, i. e. to speak next, Plat.; so διαδέχεσθαι alone, Hdt.
διαδέχεσθαί τινι to succeed one, Xen.
absol. to relieve one another, τοῖς ἵπποις with fresh horses, Xen.:—part. perf. pass. διαδεδεγμένος, η, ον, in succession, in turns, Soph.; so, διαδεξάμενος Hdt.

div1.head: διαδέω
div1.sense: to bind round, τὸ πλοῖον Hdt.:— Pass., διαδεδεμένος fast-bound, Plat.

div1.head: διαδηλέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to do great harm to, tear to pieces, Od., Theocr.

div1.head: διάδηλος
div1.sense: distinguishable among others, Thuc.

div1.head: διαδηλόω
div1.sense: to make manifest, Plut.

div1.head: διάδημα
div1.sense: a band or fillet: esp. the band round the τιάρα of the Persian king, Xen.

div1.head: διαδηματοφόρος
div1.sense: wearing a diadem, Plut.

div1.head: διαδιδράσκω
div1.sense: to run off, get away, escape, Hdt.; διαδεδρακότες shirkers, Ar.
c. acc. to run away from, escape from, Hdt.

div1.head: διαδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give from hand to hand, to pass on, hand over, Lat. tradere, λαμπάδια διαδώσουσιν ἀλλήλοις Plat.:—Pass., of reports, to be spread abroad, Xen.
to distribute, τινί τι Xen.
δ. κόρας to cast oneʼs eyes around, Eur.

div1.head: διαδικάζω
div1.sense: to give judgment in a case, Plat.: c. acc. rei, to decide, Xen.
Mid. to go to law, τινι with another, Plat.; διαδικάσασθαι τὰ πρὸς ἐμέ to have a matter settled by arbitration, Dem.
to submit oneself to trial, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: διαδικαιόω
div1.sense: to hold a thing to be right, Thuc.

div1.head: διαδικασία
div1.sense: a suit brought to decide who (of several persons) was entitled to any right or privilege, Oratt.:—metaph., δ. τῷ βήματι πρὸς τὸ στρατήγιον a dispute between the orators and the war-office, Aeschin.

div1.head: διαδίκασμα
div1.sense: the object of litigation in a διαδικασία, Lys.

div1.head: διαδιφρεύω
div1.sense: to drive horses as in a chariot-race, Eur.

div1.head: διαδοκιμάζω
div1.sense: to test closely, Xen.

div1.head: διάδοσις
div1.sense: a distribution, largess, Dem., etc.

div1.head: διαδοχή
div1.sense: a taking from another, Dem.
succession, ἄλλος παρʼ ἄλλου διαδοχαῖς by successions or reliefs, Aesch.; ἐκ διαδοχῆς ἀλλήλοις in turns, Lat. vicissim, Dem.; κατὰ διαδοχήν Thuc.
in military sense, a relief, relay, Xen.

div1.head: διάδοχος
div1.sense: succeeding a person in a thing:
c. dat. pers. et gen. rei, δ. Μεγαβάζῳ τῆς στρατηγίης his successor in the command, Hdt.; θνητοῖς διάδοχοι μοχθημάτων succeeding them in, i. e. relieving them from, toils, Aesch.
c. gen. rei only, δ. τῆς ναυαρχίας succeeding to the command, Thuc.
c. gen. pers. only, φέγγος ὕπνου δ. sleepʼs successor, light, Soph.
c. dat. pers. only, δ. Κλεάνδρῳ Xen.; so, κακὸν κακῷ δ. Eur.; and in a quasi-act. sense, διάδοχος κακῶν κακοῖς bringing a succession of evils after evils, Eur.
absol., διάδοχοι ἐφοίτων they went to work in relays or gangs, Hdt., Thuc.: neut. pl. as adv. in succession, Eur.

div1.head: διαδρασιπολίτης
div1.sense: a citizen who shirks all state burdens, Ar.

div1.head: διαδρηπετεύω
div1.etym: a correction for διεπρήστευσε, which has no meaning.
div1.sense: to run off, go over to, Hdt.

div1.head: διαδρομή
div1.sense: a running about through a city, Aesch.
a foray, Plut.
a passage through, Xen.: an aqueduct, Plut.

div1.head: διάδρομος
div1.sense: running through or about, wandering, Aesch.; λέχος δ. stray, lawless love, Eur.

div1.head: διαδύνω
div1.sense: to slip through a hole or gap, Thuc., Xen.: absol. to slip through, slip away, Hdt., Ar.
c. acc. to evade, shirk, Dem.

div1.head: διάδυσις
div1.sense: a passage through: in pl. evasions, τινος from a thing, Dem.

div1.head: διαδωρέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to distribute in presents, Xen.

div1.head: διαείδω
div1.sense: to discern, distinguish, ἣν ἀρετὴν διαείσεται will discern, test his manhood, Il.:—Pass. to be discerned, Il.

div1.head: διαείδω
div1.sense: to contend in singing, τινί with one, Theocr.

div1.head: διαέριος
div1.sense: high in air, transcendental, Luc.

div1.head: διαζάω
div1.sense: to live through, pass, τὸν βίον Eur.:—then, absol., like Lat. degere, Ar., Xen.
c. part., like διαβιόω, to live by doing so and so, ποιηφαγέοντες διέζωον they supported life by eating grass, Hdt.; also, δ. ἀπό τινος to live off or by a thing, Soph.

div1.head: διαζεύγνυμι
div1.sense: to separate, usu. mid.-pass. to be disjoined, separated, parted, τινος from one, Aeschin.; ἀπό τινος Xen.

div1.head: διάζευξις
div1.sense: a disjoining, parting, Plat.

div1.head: διάζωμα
div1.sense: a girdle, drawers, Lat. subligaculum, Thuc.
an isthmus, Plut.

div1.head: διαζώννυμι
div1.sense: to gird round the middle:—Mid. to gird oneself with, ἐσθῆτα, Luc.:— Pass., διεζωσμένοι wearing drawers, Thuc.
metaph. to engirdle, encompass, Plut.

div1.head: διάημι
div1.sense: to blow through trees, etc., c. acc., Od., Hes.

div1.head: διαθεάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to look through, examine, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: διαθειόω
div1.sense: to fumigate thoroughly, Od.

div1.head: διαθερμαίνω
div1.sense: to warm through, Plat., etc.:— Pass. to be heated, by drinking, Dem.

div1.head: διάθερμος
div1.sense: heated through: of a hot temperament, Arist.

div1.head: διάθεσις
div1.sense: a disposition, arrangement, Plat.
the composition in a work of art, as opp. to εὕρεσις, Plat.
a disposition of property, = διαθήκη, Plat.
a disposing of, selling, sale, Plut.
a manʼs disposition, Plat.

div1.head: διαθέτης
div1.sense: an arranger, Hdt.

div1.head: διαθέω
div1.sense: to run about, Thuc., etc.; of reports, of panic fear, Xen.
to run a race, τινί with or against another, Plat.:—c. acc. cogn., δ. τὴν λαμπάσο̄α to run the torch-race, Plut.

div1.head: διαθήκη
div1.sense: a disposition of property by will, a will, testament, Ar., Oratt.
an arrangement between two parties, covenant, Ar., NTest.

div1.head: διαθορυβέω
div1.sense: to confound utterly, τινα Thuc.: absol. to make a great noise, Plut.

div1.head: διαθρέω
div1.sense: to look closely into, examine closely, Ar.

div1.head: διαθροέω
div1.sense: to spread a report, give out, Thuc.

div1.head: διαθρυλέω
div1.sense: mostly in Pass. to be commonly reported, διετεθρύλητο ὡς . . Xen.
to be talked deaf, διαθρυλούμενος ὑπό σου Xen.

div1.head: διαθρύπτω
div1.sense: to break in sunder, break in pieces, shiver, Luc.:—Pass., τριχθά τε καὶ τετραχθὰ διατρυφὲν τὸ ξίφος Il.; ἀσπίδες διατεθρυμμέναι Xen.
metaph., like Lat. frangere, to break down by profligate living and indulgence, to enervate, pamper, make weak and womanish, Plat., Xen.: —Pass. to be enervated, pampered, Aesch., Xen.
Mid. to give oneself airs, of a prude, Theocr.; of a singer, διαθρύπτεται ἤδη is beginning her airs, Theocr.

div1.head: διαιθριάζω
div1.sense: to become quite clear and fine, ἐδόκει διαιθριάζειν it seemed likely to be fine, Xen.

div1.head: δίαιθρος
div1.sense: quite clear and fine, Plut.

div1.head: δίαιμος
div1.sense: blood-stained, Eur.; δίαιμον ἀναπτύειν to spit blood, Plut.

div1.head: διαίνω
div1.sense: to wet, moisten, Il.:— Mid., διαίνεσθαι ὄσσε to wet oneʼs eyes, Aesch.; absol. to weep, Aesch.

div1.head: διαίρεσις
div1.sense: a dividing, division, of money, Hdt.; of spoil, Xen.; ἐν διαιρέσει ψήφων in the reckoning of the votes on either side, Aesch.

div1.head: διαιρετέος
div1.sense: to be divided, Plat.
διαιρετέον, one must divide, Plat.

div1.head: διαιρετικός
div1.sense: divisible, Plat.

div1.head: διαιρετός
div1.sense: divided, separated, Xen.: distributed, Soph.
distinguishable, Thuc.

div1.head: διαιρέω
div1.sense: to take one from another, to cleave in twain, to divide into parts, Il., Hdt.; δ. λαγόν to cut it open, Hdt.; δ. πυλίδα to break it open, Thuc.; δ. τὴν ὀροφήν to tear it away, Thuc.; δ. τοῦ τείχους to take down part of the wall, make a breach in it, Thuc.; τὸ διῃρημένον the breach, Thuc.

to divide, δύο μοίρας Λυδῶν the Lydians into two parts, Hdt.; so, δ. τριχῆ Plat.; εἰς δύο Dem.:—Mid. to divide for themselves, ναῦς Thuc.: but also to divide among themselves, Hes., Hdt.:—Pass., διῃρημένοι κατʼ ἀναπαύλας divided into relays, Thuc.
to divide into component parts, Plat.
to distinguish, Ar.
to determine, decide, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
to say distinctly, to define, interpret, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: διαίρω
div1.sense: to raise up, lift up, τὸν αὐχένα Xen.
to separate, remove, Plut.:—Mid., διαράμενος (sc. τὰ σκέλη) taking long strides, Theophr.
δ. τὸ στόμα to open oneʼs mouth, Dem.

div1.head: διαισθάνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to perceive distinctly, distinguish perfectly, τι Plat.

div1.head: διαΐσσω
div1.sense: to rush or dart through or across, Hdt.:c. acc., ὄρη διᾴσσει Soph.; of sound, ἀχὼ διῇξεν μυχόν Aesch.; and c. gen., σπασμὸς διῇξε πλευρῶν Soph.

div1.head: διαϊστόω
div1.sense: to make an end of, τινά Soph.

div1.head: δίαιτα
div1.sense: a way of living, mode of life, Hdt., Soph., etc.; δ. ποιεῖσθαι to pass oneʼs life, Hdt.
a dwelling, abode, room, Ar.
at Athens, arbitration, Soph., Ar., Oratt.

div1.head: διαιτάω
div1.sense: to feed in a certain way, to diet, δ. τοὺς νοσοῦντας Plut.
Mid. and Pass. to lead a certain course of life, to live, Hdt., Soph.; δ. νόμιμα to live in the observance of laws, Thuc.
to be arbiter or umpire (διαιτητής), Dem., etc.
c. acc. rei, to determine, decide, Theocr.

div1.head: διαίτημα
div1.sense: mostly in pl. rules of life, a mode or course of life, esp. in regard of diet, Xen.: generally, institutions, customs, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: διαιτητήριον
div1.sense: in pl. the dwelling rooms of a house, Xen.

div1.head: διαιτητής
div1.sense: an arbitrator, umpire, Lat. arbiter, Hdt., Plat., etc.

div1.head: διακαής
div1.sense: burnt through, very hot, Luc.

div1.head: διακαθαίρω
div1.sense: to cleanse or purge thoroughly, Plat.

div1.head: διακάθαρσις
div1.sense: a thorough cleansing, Plat.

div1.head: διακαθέζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to sit each in his own seat, Plut.

div1.head: διακαθίζω
div1.sense: to make to sit apart, set apart, Xen.

div1.head: διακαίω
div1.sense: to burn through, heat to excess, Hdt.:—metaph. to inflame, excite, Plut.

div1.head: διακαλύπτω
div1.sense: to reveal to view, Dem.

div1.head: διακανάσσω
div1.sense: only in aor1, μῶν τὸν λάρυγγα διεκάναξέ σου; has aught run gurgling through thy throat? Eur.

div1.head: διακαραδοκέω
div1.sense: to expect anxiously, Plut.

div1.head: διακαρτερέω
div1.sense: to endure to the end, last out, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: διακατελέγχομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to confute thoroughly, τινι NTest.

div1.head: διακαυνιάζω
div1.sense: to determine by lot, Ar.

div1.head: διακεάζω
div1.sense: to cleave asunder, Od.

div1.head: διάκειμαι
div1.sense: serving as Pass. to διατίθημι, to be in a certain state, to be disposed or affected so and so, Hdt., etc.: often, like ἔχω, with an adv., ὁρᾶτε ὡς δ. ὑπὸ τῆς νόσου how I am affected by the disease, Thuc.; κακῶς, μοχθηρῶς, φαύλως δ. to be in sorry plight, Plat.: εὖ or κακῶς δ. τινι to be well or ill disposed towards him, Oratt.; ἐπιφθόνως δ. τινι to be envied by him, ὑπόπτως τινι δ. to be suspected by him, Thuc.

of things, to be settled, fixed, or ordered, ὥς οἱ διέκειτο so was it ordered him, Hes.; τὰ διακείμενα certain conditions, settled terms, Hdt.; of a gift, ἄμεινον διακείσεται it will be better disposed of, Xen.

div1.head: διακείρω
div1.sense: to cut in pieces: metaph., διακέρσαι ἐμὸν ἔπος to make it null, frustrate it, Il.:—Pass., σκευάρια διακεκαρμένος shorn of his trappings, Ar.

div1.head: διακέλευμα
div1.sense: an exhortation, command, Plat.

div1.head: διακελεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to exhort, give orders, direct, δ. τινι ποιεῖν τι etc., Hdt., etc.; also, δ. τινί τι (sc. ποιεῖν) , Plat.; δ. τινι alone, Plat.
to encourage one another, Hdt.; δ. ἀλλήλοις Xen.; δ. ἑαυτῷ Xen.

div1.head: διακελευσμός
div1.sense: an exhortation, cheering on, Thuc.

div1.head: διακενῆς
div1.sense: διὰ, κενῆς, adv. for διὰ κενῆς πράξεως, in vain, idly, to no purpose, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: διάκενος
div1.sense: quite empty or hollow; τὸ δ. the gap, vacuum, Thuc.
thin, lank, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: διακερματίζομαι
div1.sense: to get changed into small coin, Ar.

div1.head: διακηρυκεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to negotiate by herald, πρός τινα Thuc.

div1.head: διακηρύσσω
div1.sense: to proclaim by herald, ἐν διακεκηρυγμένοις in declared war, Plut.
to sell by auction, Plut.

div1.head: διακινδυνεύω
div1.sense: to run all risks, make a desperate attempt, hazard all, Thuc.; πρός τινα Thuc.; ὑπέρ or πρός τινος Lys., Xen.; περί τινος Dem.:—Pass. of the attempt, to be risked, hazarded, Dem.

div1.head: διακινέω
div1.sense: to move thoroughly:—Pass. to be put in motion, Hdt.
to throw into disorder, confound, τὰ πεπραγμένα Thuc.
to sift thoroughly, scrutinise, Ar.

div1.head: διακίχρημι
div1.sense: to lend to various persons:—Pass., διακεχρημένον τάλαντον Dem.

div1.head: διακλάω
div1.sense: to break in twain, Il.
in Pass., = διαθρύπτομαι: perf. pass. διακεκλασμένος enervated, Luc.

div1.head: διακλέπτω
div1.sense: to steal at different times, Dem.; τὸ διακλαπέν the quantity stolen [ by the soldiers] and dispersed, Thuc.
to keep alive by stealth, τινά Hdt.
to keep back by stealth, τὴν ἀλήθειαν Dem.

div1.head: διακληρόω
div1.sense: to assign by lot, allot, Aesch.
to choose by lot, Xen.:—Mid. to cast lots, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: διακλίνω
div1.sense: to turn away, retreat, Polyb.

div1.head: διάκλισις
div1.sense: a retreat, Plut.

div1.head: διακλύζω
div1.sense: to wash, wash out, Eur.

div1.head: διακνίζω
div1.sense: to pull to pieces, Anth.

div1.head: διακολλάω
div1.sense: to glue together, Luc.

div1.head: διακναίω
div1.sense: to scrape to nothing, ὄψιν δ. to grind out his eye, Eur.:—Pass. to be shivered, Aesch.
to wear out, wear away, Eur.:—Pass. to be worn out, destroyed, Aesch., Eur.; τὸ χρῶμα διακεκναισμένος having lost all oneʼs colour, Ar.

div1.head: διακομιδή
div1.sense: a carrying over, τινὸς εἰς τόπον Thuc.

div1.head: διακομίζω
div1.sense: to carry over or across, Hdt., Thuc.:—Mid. to carry over what is oneʼs own, Hdt.: —Pass. to be carried over, to pass over, cross, Thuc.

div1.head: διακονέω
div1.sense: to minister, serve, do service, absol., Eur.; τινι to a person, Dem.; δ. πρός τι to be serviceable towards, Plat.:—Mid. to minister to oneʼs own needs, Soph.; αὑτῶι διακονεῖσθαι Ar.
to be a deacon, NTest.
c. acc. rei, to furnish, supply, Lat. ministrare, τί τινι Hdt.:—Pass. to be supplied, Dem.

div1.head: διακόνημα
div1.sense: servantsʼ business, service, Plat.

div1.head: διακονία
div1.sense: the office of a διάκονος, service, Thuc., Plat.
attendance on a duty, ministration, Dem.; ἡ δ. ἡ καθημερινή ministering to daily wants, NTest.; ἡ δ. τοῦ λόγου the ministry of the word, NTest.

div1.head: διακονικός
div1.sense: serviceable, Ar., etc.; comp. -ώτερος, Plat.

div1.head: διάκονος
div1.etym: Akin to διάκτορος· both perh. from διώκω.
div1.sense: a servant, waiting-man, Lat. minister, Hdt., etc.: a messenger, Aesch., Soph.:—as fem., Dem.
a minister of the church, a deacon, NTest.: as fem. a deaconess, NTest.

div1.head: διακοντίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to contend with others at throwing the javelin, Xen.

div1.head: διακοπή
div1.sense: a gash, cleft, Plut.;

div1.head: διακόπτω
div1.sense: to cut in two, cut through, Thuc.
to break through the enemyʼs line, τὴν τάξιν Xen.: then, to break through the line, Xen.

div1.head: διακορκορυγέω
div1.sense: to rumble through, τὴν γαστέρα Ar.

div1.head: διάκορος
div1.sense: satiated, glutted, τινός with a thing, Hdt.

div1.head: διακόσιοι
div1.sense: two hundred, Lat. ducenti: sg. with n. of multitude, ἵππος διακοσία two hundred horse, Thuc.

div1.head: διακοσμέω
div1.sense: to divide and marshal, muster in array, Il., Thuc.:—Pass., εἴπερ ἐς δεκάδας διακοσμηθεῖμεν Ἀχαιοί (Epic for -είημεν, 1st pl. aor1 opt.) Il.
generally, to regulate, set in order, Hdt., etc.: Mid., μέγαρον διεκοσμήσαντο got it set in order, Od.

div1.head: διακόσμησις
div1.sense: a setting in order, regulating, Plat.

div1.head: διάκοσμος
div1.sense: battle-order, Thuc.

div1.head: διακούω
div1.sense: to hear through, hear out or to the end, τί Xen.:— to hear or learn from another, τί τινος Plat.
c. gen. pers. to be a hearer of, Plut.

div1.head: διακράζω
div1.sense: to scream continually, Ar.
δ. τινί to match another at screaming, Ar.

div1.head: διακρατέω
div1.sense: to hold fast, hold oneʼs own, Plut.

div1.head: διακρέκω
div1.sense: to strike the strings of the lyre, Anth.

div1.head: διακρηνόω
div1.sense: to make to flow, Theocr.

div1.head: διακριβόω
div1.sense: to examine or discuss minutely or with precision, τι Xen.:—Pass. to be brought to perfection, Arist.

div1.head: διακριβωτέος
div1.sense: one must discuss minutely, Plut.

div1.head: διακριδόν
div1.sense: eminently, above all, Lat. eximie, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: διακρίνω
div1.sense: to separate one from another, Il.: to part combatants, and in Pass. to be parted, Hom.; so in fut. mid. διακρινέεσθαι, Od.; also, διακριθῆναι ἀπʼ ἀλλήλων Thuc.; διακρίνεσθαι πρός . . to part and join different parties, Thuc.
Pass. to be dissolved into elemental parts, Plat.
to distinguish, Lat. discernere, τὸ σῆμα Od.; οὐδένα διακρίνων making no distinction of persons, Hdt.: —Pass., διεκέκριτο οὐδέν no distinction was made, Thuc.

to settle, decide, of judges, Hdt., Theocr.:—Mid., νεῖκος δ. to get it decided, Hes.: —Pass. to come to a decision, Il.; περί τινος Plat.: — to contend with one, τινι NTest.; μάχῃ διακρινθῆναι πρός τινα Hdt.
Pass. to doubt, hesitate, NTest.

div1.head: Διάκριοι
div1.sense: the mountaineers, one of the three Attic parties after Solon., Ar.

div1.head: διάκρισις
div1.sense: separation, dissolution, Emped.
a decision, judgment, Xen.

div1.head: διακριτέος
div1.sense: one must decide, Thuc.

div1.head: διάκριτος
div1.sense: separated: choice, excellent, Theocr.

div1.head: διάκρουσις
div1.sense: a putting off, Dem.

div1.head: διακρούω
div1.sense: to prove by knocking or ringing, as one does an earthen vessel, Plat.

in Mid. to drive from oneself, get rid of, elude, τινα or τι Hdt., Dem.: to evade his creditor by delays, of a debtor, Dem.: absol. to practise evasions, Dem.:—Pass., διακρουσθῆναι τῆς τιμωρίας to escape from punishment, Dem.

div1.head: διακτορία
div1.sense: the office of a διάκτορος, service, Anth.

div1.head: διάκτορος
div1.sense: epith. of Hermes, the Messenger or Minister of Zeus, Hom.

div1.head: διακυβεύω
div1.sense: to play at dice with, πρός τινα Plut.

div1.head: διακυκάω
div1.sense: to mix one with another, jumble, Dem.

div1.head: διακυμαίνω
div1.sense: to raise into waves, Luc.

div1.head: διακύπτω
div1.sense: to stoop and creep through a narrow place, Hdt.
to stoop so as to peep in, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: διακώλυσις
div1.sense: a hindering, Plat.

div1.head: διακωλυτέος
div1.sense: one must hinder, Plat.

div1.head: διακωλυτής
div1.sense: a hinderer, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: διακωλύω
div1.sense: to hinder, prevent, τινὰ μὴ ποιεῖν τι Hdt.; or without μή, Eur., Plat.; δ. τινά Thuc.; δ. φόνον Soph.:—Pass., ἃ διεκωλύθη (sc. ποιεῖν) which he was prevented from doing, Dem.

div1.head: διακωμῳδέω
div1.sense: to satirise, Plat.

div1.head: διαλαγχάνω
div1.sense: to divide or part by lot, Hdt., Aesch., Xen.; δῶμα σιδήρῳ δ. Eur.:— to tear in pieces, Eur.

div1.head: διαλακέω
div1.sense: to crack asunder, burst, Ar.

div1.head: διαλακτίζω
div1.sense: to kick away, spurn, Theocr.

div1.head: διαλαλέω
div1.sense: to talk over a thing with another, τί τινι Eur.:—Pass. to be much talked of, NTest.

div1.head: διαλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to take or receive severally, i. e. each for himself, each his share, Xen., etc.
to grasp or lay hold of separately, διαλαβόντες τὰς χεῖρας καὶ τοὺς πόδας Hdt.:—generally, to seize, arrest, τινά Hdt.
as a gymnastic term, to seize by the middle, Ar.: metaph. of the soul, διειλημμένη ὑπὸ τοῦ σωματοειδοῦς Plat.

to divide, τὸν ποταμὸν ἐς τριηκοσίας διώρυχας δ. Hdt.:—Pass., ποταμὸς διαλελαμμένος πενταχοῦ divided into five channels, Hdt.; θώρακες διειλημμένοι τὸ βάρος breast-plates having their weight distributed, Xen.
to mark at intervals, Decret. ap. Dem.
to cut off, intercept, Thuc.
to mark off, distinguish:— Pass. χρώμασι διειλημμένη, marked with various colours, Plat.
to distinguish in thought, Plat.: to state distinctly, ap. Dem.

div1.head: διαλάμπω
div1.sense: to shine through, to dawn, Ar.

div1.head: διαλανθάνω
div1.sense: to escape notice, διαλαθὼν εἰσέρχεται Thuc.: c. acc. pers. to escape the notice of, Xen.

div1.head: διαλγής
div1.sense: grievous, Aesch.
suffering great pain, Plut.

div1.head: διαλέγω
div1.sense: to pick out one from another, to pick out, Hdt., Xen.

Dep. δια-λέγομαι· fut. -λέξομαι and -λεχθήσομαι· aor1 δι-ελεξάμην and διελέχθην· perf. διείλεγμαι· 3rd sg. plup. διείλεκτο:— to converse with, hold converse with, τινί Il., etc.; πρός τινα Plat.; δ. τί τινι or πρός τινα to discuss a question with another, Xen.; δ. τινι μὴ ποιεῖν to argue with one against doing, Thuc.:—absol. to discourse, argue, Plat., Xen.
to use a dialect or language, Hdt.

div1.head: διάλειμμα
div1.sense: an interval, Plat.; ἐκ διαλειμμάτων at intervals, Plut.

div1.head: διαλείπω
div1.sense: to leave an interval between:— Pass., διελέλειπτο a gap had been left, Hdt.
of Time, διαλιπὼν ἡμέρην having left an interval of a day, Hdt.; ἀκαρῆ διαλιπών having waited an instant, Ar.; διαλιπών absol. after a time, Thuc.
intr. to stand at intervals, δύο πλέθρα ἀπʼ ἀλλήλων δ. Thuc.
c. part. to cease doing a thing, Xen.
of Time, διαλιπόντων ἐτῶν τριῶν after an interval of three years, Thuc.

div1.head: διαλείχω
div1.sense: to lick clean, Ar.

div1.head: διαλεκτέος
div1.sense: one must discourse, Plat.

div1.head: διαλεκτικός
div1.sense: skilled in logical argument, Plat.:— ἡ διαλεκτική (sc. τέχνη) the art of discussion, dialectic, Plat.: adv. -κῶς, logically, Plat.

div1.head: διάλεκτος
div1.sense: discourse: discussion, debate, arguing, Plat.
language: the language of a country, dialect: a local word or phrase, Plut.
a way of speaking, enunciation, Dem.

div1.head: διάλεξις
div1.sense: discourse, arguing, Ar.

div1.head: διαλεπτολογέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to discourse subtly, chop logic, τινι with one, Ar.

div1.head: διαληπτέος
div1.sense: one must distinguish, Plat.

div1.head: διαλλαγή
div1.sense: interchange, exchange, Eur.
a change from enmity to friendship, a reconciliation, truce, Hdt., Ar.; in pl., Eur.; διαλλαγαὶ πρός τινα Dem.

div1.head: διάλλαγμα
div1.sense: a substitute, changeling, Eur.

div1.head: διαλλακτήρ
div1.sense: a mediator, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: διαλλάσσω
div1.sense: Mid. to change one with another, interchange, Hdt.: absol. to make an exchange, Xen.
Act. to exchange, i. e.,
to give in exchange, τί τινι Eur.; τι ἀντί τινος Plat.
to take in exchange, Plat.; δ. τὴν χώραν to change one land for another, i. e. to pass through a land, Xen.
simply, to change, τοὺς ναυάρχους Xen.

to change enmity for friendship, to reconcile one to another, τινά τινι Thuc.; τινὰ πρός τινα Ar.; or c. acc. pl. only, Eur., etc.: absol. to make friends, Plat.:—Pass. to be reconciled, to be made friends, Aesch., etc.
intr., c. dat. pers. et acc. rei, to differ from one in a thing, διαλλάσσειν οὐδὲν τοῖσι ἑτέροισι Hdt.: absol., τὸ διαλλάσσον the difference, Thuc.
Pass. to be different, Lat. distare, Thuc.

div1.head: διάλλομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to leap across, τάφρον Xen.

div1.head: διαλογίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to balance accounts, πρός τινα Dem.
to take full account of, to stop to consider, Dem.: to distinguish between, Aeschin.
to converse, debate, argue, περί τινος Xen.

div1.head: διαλογισμός
div1.sense: a balancing of accounts, Dem.

div1.head: διάλογος
div1.sense: a conversation, dialogue, Plat.

div1.head: διαλοιδορέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to rail furiously at, τινι Hdt.; διαλοιδορηθείς Dem.

div1.head: διαλυμαίνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to maltreat shamefully, undo utterly, Hdt., Eur.
to cheat grossly, Ar.
to falsify, corrupt, Ar.
no Act. occurs, but perf. part. διαλελυμασμένος is used in pass. sense, Hdt.; aor1 διελυμάνθην Eur.

div1.head: διάλυσις
div1.sense: a loosing one from another, separating, parting, τῆς ψυχῆς καὶ τοῦ σώματος Plat.; δ. τοῦ σώματος its dissolution, Plat.; ἡ δ. τῆς γεφύρας the breaking down the bridge, Thuc.: the disbanding, of troops, Xen.; ἡ δ. τῆς ἀγορᾶς the time of its breaking up, Hdt.; τὴν δ. ἐποιήσαντο broke off the action, Thuc.; δ. γάμου a divorce, Plut.
an ending, cessation, κακῶν Eur.; πολέμου Thuc.: absol. a cessation of hostilities, peace, Dem.

div1.head: διαλυτέος
div1.sense: one must dissolve, φιλίαν Arist.

div1.head: διαλυτής
div1.sense: a dissolver, breaker-up, Thuc.

div1.head: διαλυτός
div1.sense: capable of dissolution, Plat.

div1.head: διαλύω
div1.sense: to loose one from another, to part asunder, undo, Hdt.: to dissolve an assembly, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; τὴν σκηνὴν εἰς κοίτην δ. to break up the party and go to bed, Xen.; δ. τὴν στρατιάν to disband it, Thuc.:—Pass., of an assembly, to break up, Hdt., etc.: of a man, to die, Xen.
to dissolve into its elements, to break up, Plat.
to put an end to friendship, break off a truce, Thuc., etc.:—so in Mid., διαλύσασθαι ξεινίην Hdt.
to put an end to enmity, Thuc.; and in Mid., Dem., etc.
c. acc. pers. to reconcile, τινὰ πρός τινα Dem.; οὐ γὰρ ἦν ὁ διαλύσων Thuc.:—Pass. and Mid., διαλύεσθαι νείκους to be parted from quarrel, i. e. to be reconciled, Eur., Xen., etc.
generally, to put an end to, do away with, διαβολήν Thuc.; so in Mid., Thuc., etc.
to solve a difficulty, Plat.
δ. τιμάς to pay the full value, discharge a debt, Hdt., etc.: c. acc. pers. to pay him off, Dem.
absol. to slacken oneʼs hold, undo, Theocr.

div1.head: διαλφιτόω
div1.sense: to fill full of barley meal, Ar.

div1.head: διαμαθύνω
div1.sense: to grind to powder, utterly destroy, Aesch.

div1.head: διαμαντεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to determine by an oracle, τι Plat.

div1.head: διαμαρτάνω
div1.sense: to go astray from, τῆς ὁδοῦ Thuc.: to fail of obtaining, τινός Thuc., Dem.
absol. to fail utterly, Plat.

div1.head: διαμαρτία
div1.sense: a total mistake, Plut.; δ. τῶν ἡμερῶν a wrong reckoning of the days, Thuc.

div1.head: διαμαρτυρέω
div1.sense: as Attic law-term, to use a διαμαρτυρία (q. v.), Dem.
c. inf. to affirm by a διαμαρτυρία that a thing is, c. acc. et inf., Dem.: Pass., τὰ διαμαρτυρηθέντα things so affirmed, Isocr.

div1.head: διαμαρτυρία
div1.sense: as Attic law-term, evidence given to prevent a case from coming to trial, Dem., etc.

div1.head: διαμαρτύρομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to protest solemnly, Lat. obtestari, Dem.; δ. μή . . , c. inf., Dem.:— δ. τινι μὴ ποιεῖν to protest against his doing, Aeschin.
generally, to protest, asseverate, Plat.
absol. to beg earnestly, conjure, Xen.

div1.head: διαμάσσω
div1.sense: to knead thoroughly, knead well, Ar.

div1.head: διαμαστιγόω
div1.sense: to scourge severely, Plat.

div1.head: διαμαστροπεύω
div1.sense: to pander, δ. τὴν ἡγεμονίαν γάμοις to bargain away the empire by a marriage, Plut.

div1.head: διαμαχητέος
div1.sense: one must deny absolutely, Plat.

div1.head: διαμάχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to fight or strive with, struggle against, τινι or πρός τινι Hdt., etc.; πρός τι Dem.; δ. μὴ μεταγνῶναι ὑμᾶς I resist to the uttermost your change of opinion, Thuc.; δ. τὸ μὴ θανεῖν Eur.
to fight one with another, Eur.
to fight it out, contend obstinately, Lat. depugnare, Ar.
to exert oneself greatly, ὅπως τι γένηται Plat.
in argument, to contend or maintain that . . , δ. τι μὴ εἶναι Thuc.; or without μή, Plat.

div1.head: διαμάω
div1.sense: to cut through, Il., Eur.
to scrape away, Eur.; Mid., διαμᾶσθαι τὸν κάχληκα to get the gravel scraped away, Thuc.

div1.head: διαμεθίημι
div1.sense: to let go, give up, leave off, Eur.

div1.head: διαμείβω
div1.sense: to exchange, τι πρός τι one thing with another, Plat.; so in Mid., διαμείβεσθαί τί τινος or ἀντί τινος, Solon, Plat.:— διαμεῖψαι Ἀσίαν Εὐρώπης to take Asia in exchange for Europe, i.e. to pass into Asia, Eur.
δ. ὁδόν to finish a journey, Aesch.; so in Mid., Aesch.
in Mid., also, to alter, Hdt.

div1.head: διαμειρακιεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to strive hotly with, τινί Plut.

div1.head: διάμειψις
div1.sense: an exchange, Plut.

div1.head: διαμελαίνω
div1.sense: to make quite black, Plut.

div1.head: διαμελεϊστί
div1.sense: limb by limb, limb-meal, Od.

div1.head: διαμέλλησις
div1.sense: a being on the point to do, πολλὴ δ. φυλακῆς long postponement of precautionary measures, Thuc.

div1.head: διαμέλλω
div1.sense: to be always going to do, i.e. to delay continually, Thuc.

div1.head: διαμέμφομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to blame greatly, Thuc.

div1.head: διαμένω
div1.sense: to remain by, stand by, τινί Xen.:— to persevere, ἔν τινι Plat.; ἐπί τινι Xen.:—absol. to stand firm, Dem.:—c. part., δ. λέγων to continue speaking, Dem.

div1.head: διαμερίζω
div1.sense: to distribute, Plat.
to divide: Mid. to divide or part among themselves, NTest.

div1.head: διαμερισμός
div1.sense: division, dissension, NTest.

div1.head: διαμετρέω
div1.sense: to measure through, out or off, χῶρον δ. to measure lists for combat, Il.:—Pass., ἡμέρα διαμεμετρημένη measured by the clepsydra, Dem.
to measure out in portions, distribute, Xen., etc.:—Mid. to have measured out to one, receive as oneʼs share, Orac. ap. Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: διαμετρητός
div1.sense: measured out or off, Il.

div1.head: διάμετρον
div1.sense: a measured allowance, rations, Plut.

div1.head: διάμετρος
div1.sense: sc. γραμμή the diameter or diagonal of a parallelogram, Plat.; κατὰ διάμετρον diametrically, Plat.; so, ἐκ διαμέτρου Luc.
a rule for drawing the diameter, Ar.

div1.head: διαμηχανάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to bring about, contrive, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: διαμικρολογέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to deal meanly, πρός τινα Plut.

div1.head: διαμιλλάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to contend hotly, strive earnestly, τινι or πρός τινα Plat.; περί τινος Plat.

div1.head: διαμιμνῄσκομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to keep in memory, Xen.

div1.head: διαμισέω
div1.sense: to hate bitterly, Arist., Plut.

div1.head: διαμιστύλλω
div1.sense: to cut up piecemeal, Hdt.

div1.head: διαμνημονεύω
div1.sense: to call to mind, remember, Hdt.; c. gen., Plat.; c. acc., Xen., etc.
to record, mention, Thuc.: Pass., διαμνημονεύεται ἔχειν he is mentioned as having, Xen.

div1.head: διαμοιράω
div1.sense: to divide, rend asunder, Eur.; so in Mid., Eur.
in Mid., also, to portion out, distribute, Od.

div1.head: διαμπάξ
div1.sense: right through, through and through, c. gen., Aesch., Eur.; also c. acc., Xen.

div1.head: διαμπερές
div1.sense: of Place, through and through, right through, clean through, c. gen., Il., Soph.:—c. acc., Il., Aesch.
absol. without break, continuously, Hom.
of Time, throughout, for ever, Hom.; διαμπερὲς αἰεί for ever and aye, Il.

div1.head: διαμυδαλέος
div1.sense: drenching, Aesch.

div1.head: διαμυθολογέω
div1.sense: to communicate by word, to express in speech, Aesch.: to converse, Plat.

div1.head: διαμυλλαίνω
div1.sense: to make mouths (in scorn), Ar.

div1.head: διαμφίδιος
div1.sense: utterly different, Aesch.

div1.head: διαμφισβητέω
div1.sense: to dispute or disagree, πρός τινα περί τινος Dem.:—Pass., τὰ διαμφισβητούμενα the points at issue, Dem.

div1.head: διαμφισβήτησις
div1.sense: a disputing, dispute, Plut.

div1.head: διαναγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to read through, Isocr.

div1.head: διαναπαύω
div1.sense: allow to rest awhile, Plat.

div1.head: διανάσσω
div1.sense: to stop chinks: to caulk ships, Strab.

div1.head: διαναυμαχέω
div1.sense: to maintain a sea-fight, Hdt.

div1.head: διανάω
div1.sense: to flow through, percolate, Plut.

div1.head: διάνδιχα
div1.sense: two ways, διάνδιχα μερμηρίζειν to halt between two opinions, Il.; διάνδιχα δῶκε gave one of two things, Il.; δ. ἔαξα broke it in twain, Theocr.

div1.head: διανέμησις
div1.sense: a distribution, Plut.

div1.head: διανεμητέος
div1.sense: one must distribute, Xen.

div1.head: διανεμητικός
div1.sense: distributive, Plat.

div1.head: διανεμόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to flutter in the wind, Luc., Anth.

div1.head: διανέμω
div1.sense: to distribute, apportion, τί τινι Ar., Plat.:—Mid. to divide among themselves, Plat., Arist.:—Pass., aor1 inf. διανεμηθῆναι to be spread abroad, NTest.

div1.head: διανέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to go through, Anth.

div1.head: διανέω
div1.sense: to swim across, ἐς Σαλαμῖνα Hdt.
c. acc. to swim through, Plat.

div1.head: διανθίζω
div1.sense: to adorn with flowers, Luc.:—Pass. to be variegated, Plut.

div1.head: διανίστημι
div1.sense: Act. to awaken, rouse; Pass. with aor2 and perf. act. to stand aloof from, depart from, τινος Thuc.

div1.head: διανοέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.: to be minded, intend, purpose to do, c. inf., Hdt., etc.
to think over or of, Lat. meditari, τι Hdt.: c. acc. et inf. to think or suppose that, Plat.
with adv. to be minded or disposed so and so, καλῶς, κακῶς δ. Plat.

div1.head: διανόημα
div1.sense: a thought, notion, Plat.

div1.head: διανοητικός
div1.sense: of or for thinking, intellectual, Plat., Arist.

div1.head: διάνοια
div1.sense: a thought, intention, purpose, Hdt., Attic; διάνοιαν ἔχειν διανοεῖσθαι, c. inf., Thuc.
a thought, notion, opinion, Lat. cogitatum, Hdt., Plat.
intelligence, understanding, Plat.
the thought or meaning of a word or passage, Plat.; τῇ διανοίᾳ as regards the sense, Dem.

div1.head: διανοίγω
div1.sense: to open, Plat
to open and explain, τὰς γραφάς NTest.

div1.head: διανομεύς
div1.sense: a distributer, Plut.

div1.head: διανομή
div1.sense: a distribution, Aesch., Plat.

div1.head: διανταῖος
div1.sense: extending throughout, right through, διανταία πληγή a home- thrust, Aesch.; so, διανταίαν οὐτᾶν Aesch.; δ. βέλος Aesch.; ὀδύνα Eur.:—metaph., μοῖρα δ. destiny that strikes home, Aesch.

div1.head: διαντλέω
div1.sense: to drain out, exhaust: metaph., like Lat. exhaurire, to drink even to the dregs, endure to the end, Eur.

div1.head: διανυκτερεύω
div1.sense: to pass the night, Xen.

div1.head: διανύω
div1.sense: to bring quite to an end, accomplish, finish, κέλευθον, ὁδόν h. Hom., etc.;—hence (ὁδόν omitted), διὰ πόντον ἀνύσσας having finished oneʼs course over the sea, Hes.:—c. part. to finish doing a thing, Od., Eur.

div1.head: διαξιφίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to fight to the death, Ar.

div1.head: διαπαιδαγωγέω
div1.sense: to attend children: generally, to entertain, amuse, Plut.; δ. τὸν καιρόν, Lat. fallere tempus, Plut.

div1.head: διαπαιδεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to go through a course of education, Xen.

div1.head: διαπαλαίω
div1.sense: to continue wrestling, go on wrestling, Ar.

div1.head: διαπάλη
div1.sense: a hard struggle, Plut.

div1.head: διαπάλλω
div1.sense: to distribute by lot, Aesch.

div1.head: διαπαλύνω
div1.sense: to shiver, shatter, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: διαπαπταίνω
div1.sense: to look timidly round, Plut.

div1.head: διαπαρατριβή
div1.sense: violent contention, NTest.

div1.head: διαπαρθενεύω
div1.sense: to deflower a maiden, Hdt.

div1.head: διαπασσαλεύω
div1.sense: to stretch out by nailing the extremities, as in crucifixion, Hdt.: to stretch out a hide for tanning, Ar.

div1.head: διαπάσσω
div1.sense: to sprinkle, δ. τοῦ ψήγήατος ἐς τὰς τρίχας to sprinkle some dust on the hair, Hdt.

div1.head: διαπαύω
div1.sense: to make to cease:— Mid. to rest between times, pause, Plat.:—Pass. to cease to exist, Xen.

div1.head: διαπειλέω
div1.sense: to threaten violently, Hdt.:—so in Mid., Aeschin.

div1.head: διαπεινάω
div1.sense: to hunger one against the other, to have a starving-match, διαπεινᾶμες (Doric 1st pl.), with a play on διαπίνομεν, Ar.

div1.head: διά

trans.i: through c. gen. through, by means of c. acc.

div1.sense: through.
WITH GEN.:
of Place or Space:

of motion in a line, through, right through, διὰ μὲν ἀσπίδος ἦλθε ἔγχος Il.; διʼ ἠέρος αἰθέρʼ ἵκανεν quite through the lower air even to the ether, Il.; διὰ πάντων ἐλθεῖν to go through all in succession, Xen.
of motion through a space, but not in a line, all through, over, διὰ πεδίοιο Il.; διʼ ἄστεος Od.
of Intervals of Space, διὰ δέκα ἐπάλξεων at every 10th battlement, Thuc.; διὰ πέντε σταδίων at a distance of 5 stades, Hdt.
of Time:
throughout, during, διὰ παντὸς τοῦ χρόνου Hdt.; διʼ ἡμέρης all day long, Hdt.; διὰ παντός continually, Aesch.; διʼ ὀλίγου for a short time, Thuc.
of the interval between two points of Time, διὰ χρόνου πολλοῦ or διὰ πολλοῦ χρ. after a long time, Hdt.; διὰ χρόνου after a time, Soph.; χρόνος διὰ χρόνου time after time, Soph.
of successive Intervals, διὰ τρίτης ἡμέρης every other day, Hdt.; διʼ ἐνιαυτοῦ every year, Xen.
Causal, through, by
of the Agent, διʼ ἀγγέλων by the mouth of messengers, Hdt.; διʼ ἑρμηνέως λέγειν Xen.
of the Instrument or Means, διὰ χειρῶν Soph.; διὰ χειρὸς ἔχειν in hand, Soph.
of the Manner or Way, παίω διʼ ὀργῆς through passion, in passion, Soph.; διὰ σπουδῆς in haste, hastily, Eur.

to express conditions or states, διʼ ἡσυχίης εἶναι to be in a state of quiet, to be tranquil, Hdt.; διὰ πολέμου ἰέναι τινί to be at war with one, Xen.; διʼ ἀπεχθείας ἐλθεῖν τινι to be hated by him, Aesch.; διʼ οἴκτου ἔχειν τινά to feel pity for one, Eur., etc.
WITH ACC.:
of Place, in same sense as διά c. gen.:
through, ἓξ διὰ πτύχας ἦλθε χαλκός Il.
throughout, over, ὤικεον διʼ ἄκριας Od.; διʼ αἰθέρα Soph.
of Time, διὰ νύκτα Il.; διὰ ὕπνον during sleep, Mosch.
Causal:

of Persons, through, by aid of, by means of, νικῆσαι διὰ Ἀθήνην Od.; διά σε by thy fault or service, Soph.: through, by reason of, αὐτὸς διʼ αὑτόν for his own sake, Plat.; διὰ τὴν ἐκείνου μέλλησιν Thuc.
of things, which express the Cause, Reason, or Purpose, διʼ ἐμὴν ἰότητα because of my will, Il.; διʼ ἀχθηδόνα for the sake of vexing, Thuc.; διὰ τοῦτο, διὰ ταῦτα therefore; etc.
WITHOUT CASE as Adv. throughout, Hom.
IN COMPOS.:
through, right through, as in διαβαίνω.

in different directions, as in διαπέμπω:— of separation, asunder, as in Lat. dis-, as in διασκεδάννυμι:— at variance, as in διαφωνέω; or of mutual relation, one with another, as in διαγωνίζομαι, διᾴδω.
of preeminence, as in διαπρέπω, διαφέρω.
completion, to the end, utterly, as in διαμάχομαι (cf. Lat. decertare).
to add strength, throughly, out and out, as in διαγαληνίζω.
of mixture, between, partly, as in διάλευκος.

div1.head: διάπειρα
div1.sense: an experiment, trial, Hdt.

div1.head: διαπειράομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to make trial or proof of, to have experience of a thing, c. gen., Hdt.; c. acc., Thuc.

div1.head: διαπείρω
div1.sense: to drive through, τι διά τινος Eur.

div1.head: διαπέμπω
div1.sense: to send off in different directions, send to and fro, send about or round, Hdt., Thuc.
to send over or across, Ar., Thuc.: to transmit, ἐπιστολήν Thuc.; so in Mid., Thuc.

div1.head: διαπενθέω
div1.sense: to mourn through, ἐνιαυτόν Plut.

div1.head: διαπεραίνω
div1.sense: to bring to a conclusion, discuss thoroughly, Eur.; διαπέραινέ μοι tell me all, Eur.:— Mid., διαπεράνασθαι κρίσιν to get a question decided, Eur.

div1.head: διαπεραιόω
div1.sense: to take across, ferry over, Plut.: —Pass. to go across, Thuc.:— διεπεραιώθη ξίφη swords were unsheathed, Soph.

div1.head: διαπεράω
div1.sense: to go over or across, ῥοάς, οἶδμα Eur.; δ. πόλιν to pass through it, Ar.; also, διαπερᾶν Μολοσσίαν to reign through all Molossia, Eur.
to pass through, pierce, Eur.
trans. to carry over, Luc.

div1.head: διαπέρθω
div1.sense: to destroy utterly, sack, lay waste, of cities, Hom.

div1.head: διαπέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to slip away one by one, Dem.

div1.head: διαπέτομαι
div1.sense: to fly through, Il., Eur.: c. acc., Eur., Ar.; διὰ τῆς πόλεως Ar.
to fly away, vanish, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: διαπήγνυμι
div1.sense: to fix thoroughly:— Mid., δ. σχεδίας to get rafts put together, Luc.

div1.head: διαπηδάω
div1.sense: to leap across, τάφρον Ar., Xen.:—absol. to take a leap, Xen.

div1.head: διαπιαίνω
div1.sense: to make very fat, Theocr.

div1.head: διαπίμπλημι
div1.sense: to fill up, mid-pass. to be quite full of, τινός Thuc.

div1.head: διαπίνω
div1.sense: to drink one against another, challenge at drinking, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: διαπιπράσκω
div1.sense: to sell off, Plut.

div1.head: διαπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall away, slip away, escape, Xen.
of reports and rumours, to spread abroad, Xen.
to fall asunder, crumble in pieces, Plat.
to fail utterly, go quite wrong, Ar., Aeschin.

div1.head: διαπιστεύω
div1.sense: to entrust to one in confidence, τί τινι Aeschin.: Pass. to have a thing entrusted to one, Dem.

div1.head: διαπιστέω
div1.sense: to distrust utterly, τινι Dem.

div1.head: διαπλάσσω
div1.sense: to form completely, mould, Plut., etc.

div1.head: διαπλατύνω
div1.sense: to make very wide, dilate, Xen.

div1.head: διαπλέκω
div1.sense: to interweave, to weave together, plait, Hdt.
metaph., δ. τὸν βίον, Lat. pertexere vitam, to finish the web of oneʼs life, Hdt.: then, simply, to pass life, live, Ar.

div1.head: διαπλέω
div1.sense: to sail across, Thuc.; εἰς Αἴγιναν Ar.: metaph., δ. βίον to make lifeʼs voyage, Plat.

div1.head: διαπληκτίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to spar with, skirmish with, τινι Plut., Luc.

div1.head: διαπλήσσω
div1.sense: to break or cleave in pieces, Il.

div1.head: διάπλοος
div1.sense: as adj. sailing continually, διάπλουν καθίστασαν λεών they kept them at the oar, Aesch.
as Subst., a voyage across, passage, πρὸς τόπον Thuc.
room for sailing through, passage, δυοῖν νεοῖν for two ships abreast, Thuc.

div1.head: διαπνέω
div1.sense: to blow through: — Pass., αὔραις διαπνεῖσθαι Xen.
to breathe between times, get breath, Plut.
intr. to disperse in vapour, Plat.

div1.head: διαποικίλλω
div1.sense: to variegate, adorn, Plut.

div1.head: διαπολεμέω
div1.sense: to carry the war through, end the war, Lat. debellare, Hdt.; δ. τινι to fight it out with one, Xen.:—Pass., διαπεπολεμήσεται πόλεμος the war will be at an end, Thuc.
to carry on the war, continue it, Thuc.
to spend some time at war, Plut.

div1.head: διαπολέμησις
div1.sense: a finishing of the war, Thuc.

div1.head: διαπολιορκέω
div1.sense: to besiege continually, to blockade, Thuc.

div1.head: διαπολιτεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to be a political rival, Aeschin.

div1.head: διαπομπεύω
div1.sense: to carry the procession to an end, Luc.

div1.head: διαπομπή
div1.sense: a sending to and fro, interchange of messages, negotiation, Thuc.

div1.head: διαπονέω
div1.sense: to work out with labour, Lat. elaboro, Plat., etc.:—Mid. to get worked out, Plat., Xen.: —Pass. to be managed, governed, Aesch.
Pass. also, to be much grieved, NTest.
intr. to work hard, toil constantly, Xen., Arist.; οἱ διαπονούμενοι the hardworking, hardy, Xen.

div1.head: διαπόνημα
div1.sense: hard labour, exercise, Plat.

div1.head: διάπονος
div1.sense: of persons, exercised, Plut.; τι Plut.
of things, toilsome:— adv. -νως, with toil, Plut.

div1.head: διαπόντιος
div1.sense: beyond sea, Lat. transmarinus, Aesch., Thuc.

div1.head: διαπορεύω
div1.sense: to carry over, set across, Xen.
Pass., with fut. mid. and aor1 pass. διεπορεύθην, to pass across, ἐς Εὔβοιαν Hdt.: c. acc. cogn. to go through, βίον Plat.

div1.head: διαπορέω
div1.sense: to be quite at a loss, Plat.:—so in Mid., with aor. and perf. pass., Plat.
to raise an ἀπορία, start a difficulty, Arist.:—so in Mid., Plat.: —Pass. to be matter of doubt or question, Plat., Arist.

div1.head: διαπορθέω
div1.sense: Il., Thuc.:—Pass. to be utterly ruined, Trag.

div1.head: διαπορθμεύω
div1.sense: to carry over or across a river or strait, Hdt.: to carry a message from one to another, Hdt.
metaph. to translate, interpret, Plat.
δ. ποταμόν, of ferry-boats, to ply across a river, Hdt.

div1.head: διαποστέλλω
div1.sense: to send off in different directions, dispatch, Dem.

div1.head: διαπραγματεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to examine thoroughly, Plat.
to gain by trading, NTest.

div1.head: διάπραξις
div1.sense: dispatch of business, Plat.

div1.head: διαπράσσω
div1.sense: to pass over, c. gen., διέπρησσον πεδίοιο they made their way over the plain, Il.; also, δ. κέλευθον to finish a journey, Od.:—also of Time, c. part., ἤματα διέπρησσον πολεμίζων went through days in fighting, Il.; διαπρήξαιμι λέγων should finish speaking, Od.

to bring about, accomplish, effect, settle, Hdt.; δ. τί τινι to get a thing done for a man, Hdt.: —so in Mid., Hdt.; perf. pass. in mid. sense, Plat., etc.:—strictly in sense of Mid., to effect for oneself, gain oneʼs point, Hdt., Xen.: c. inf. to manage that, Xen.
to make an end of, destroy, slay, Lat. conficere, in part. perf. pass. διαπεπραγμένος, Trag.

div1.head: διαπρεπής
div1.sense: eminent, distinguished, illustrious, Thuc.; τινί or τι in a thing, Eur.; τὸ δ. magnificence, Thuc.

div1.head: διαπρέπω
div1.sense: to appear prominent or conspicuous, to strike the eye, Hhymn.; διαπρέπον κακόν Aesch.
to be eminent above others, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: διαπρεσβεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to send embassies to different places, Xen.

div1.head: διαπρίω
div1.sense: to saw quite through, saw asunder, Ar.:—metaph., διεπρίοντο ταῖς καρδίαις were cut to the heart, NTest.
δ. τοὺς ὀδόντας to gnash the teeth, Luc.

div1.head: διαπρό
div1.sense: right through, c. gen., Hom.

div1.head: διαπρύσιος
div1.sense: going through, piercing: neut. as adv., πρὼν πεδίοιο διαπρύσιον τετυχηκώς a hill running far into the plain, Il.
of sound, piercing, thrilling, ἤϋσεν διαπρύσιον he gave a piercing cry, Il.
later as adj., of sound, δ. ὄτοβος Soph.; κέλαδος Eur.
metaph., δ. κεραϊστής a manifest thief, Hhymn.

div1.head: διαπταίω
div1.sense: to stutter much, Luc.

div1.head: διαπτοέω
div1.sense: to scare away, startle and strike with panic, fear, Od., Eur.

div1.head: διαπτύσσω
div1.sense: to open and spread out, to unfold, disclose, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: διαπτυχή
div1.sense: a fold, folding leaf, Eur.

div1.head: διαπτύω
div1.sense: to spit upon, τινά Dem.

div1.head: διαπυκτεύω
div1.sense: to spar, fight with, τινί Xen.

div1.head: διαπυνθάνομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to search out by questioning, to find out, τι Plat.; τί τινος something from one, Plut.

div1.head: διάπυρος
div1.sense: red-hot, Anaxag. ap. Xen., Eur.
metaph. hot, fiery, Plat.

div1.head: διαπυρόομαι
div1.sense: to set on fire, Eur., in Mid.

div1.head: διαπυρσεύω
div1.sense: to throw a light over, c. acc., Plut.

div1.head: διαπωλέω
div1.sense: to sell publicly, Xen.

div1.head: διαράσσω
div1.sense: to strike through, Hes.

div1.head: διαβαδίζω
div1.sense: to go across, Thuc.
to walk to and fro, Luc.

div1.head: διάργεμος
div1.sense: fleckt with white, Babr.

div1.head: διαρθρόω
div1.sense: to divide by joints, to articulate, Plat.:—Pass., perf. part. διηρθρωμένος well-jointed, well-knit, Plat.
to endue with articulate speech, Luc.; Mid., φωνὴν διηρθρώσατο invented articulate speech, Plat.
to complete in detail, Arist.

div1.head: διαριθμέω
div1.sense: to reckon up one by one, enumerate, Eur.
to draw distinctions, distinguish, Plat.: —Pass. to be distinguished, Aeschin.

div1.head: διαρκέω
div1.sense: to have full strength, be quite sufficient, Xen., etc.; δ. πρός τινα to be a match for, Luc.
in point of Time, to hold out, endure, last, Aesch.; c. part., δ. πολιορκούμενος Xen.
to supply nourishment, τινί Plut.

div1.head: διαρκής
div1.sense: quite sufficient, Thuc.
lasting, Dem.:—adv. -κῶς, Sup. διαρκέστατα in complete competence, Xen.

div1.head: διαρμόζω
div1.sense: to distribute in various places, dispose, Eur.

div1.head: διαρπάζω
div1.sense: to tear in pieces, Il.: to efface, τὰ ἴχνη Xen.
to spoil, plunder, πόλιν Hdt.
to seize as plunder, χρήματα Hdt.

div1.head: διαρραίνω
div1.sense: Act.to sprinkle; mid-pass. to flow all ways, Soph.

div1.head: διαρραίω
div1.sense: to dash in pieces, destroy, Hom.:— Pass., c. fut. mid., to be destroyed, perish, Il.; διαρραισθέντας Aesch.

div1.head: διαρρέω
div1.sense: to flow through, Hdt.
to slip through, τῶν χειρῶν Luc.
of a vessel, to leak, Luc.
of a report, to spread abroad, Plut.
χείλη διερρυηκότα gaping lips, Ar.
to fall away like water, die or waste away, χάρις διαρρεῖ Soph.; of one diseased, Ar.; of money, Dem.

div1.head: διαρρήγνυμι
div1.sense: to break through, cleave asunder, Il. (in Mid.), Hdt., Soph.:—Pass. to burst, with eating, Xen.; with passion, Ar.; διαρραγείης, as a curse, "split you!" Ar.:—perf. διέρρωγα, in same sense, Plat.

div1.head: διαρρήδην
div1.sense: expressly, distinctly, explicitly, Lat. nominatim, Hhymn., Attic

div1.head: διάρριμμα
div1.sense: a casting about, Xen.

div1.head: διαρρίπτω
div1.sense: to cast or shoot through, Od.
to cast or throw about, a dog, to wag the tail, Xen.
to throw about, as nuts or money among a crowd, Ar.
intr. to plunge, Xen.

div1.head: διάρριψις
div1.sense: a scattering, Xen.

div1.head: διαρροή
div1.sense: that through which something flows, a pipe, πνεύματος διαρροαί the wind- pipe, Eur.

div1.head: διαρροθέω
div1.sense: to roar through, διαρροθῆσαι κάκην τινί to inspire fear by clamour, Aesch.

div1.head: διάρροια
div1.sense: diarrhoea, Thuc.

div1.head: διαρροιζέω
div1.sense: to whizz through, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: διαρρύδαν
div1.sense: flowing away, vanishing, Trag.

div1.head: διάρρυτος
div1.sense: intersected by streams, Strab.

div1.head: διαρρώξ
div1.sense: rent asunder, Eur.

div1.head: διαρταμέω
div1.sense: to cut limb from limb, Aesch.

div1.head: διαρτάω
div1.sense: to suspend, interrupt, Plut.
to separate, Plut.

div1.head: διασαίνω
div1.sense: to fawn upon, Xen.

div1.head: διασαίρω
div1.sense: grinning like a dog, sneering, Plut.

div1.head: διασαλεύω
div1.sense: to shake violently: to reduce to anarchy, Luc.; διασεσαλευμένος unsteady, Luc.

div1.head: διασαφέω
div1.sense: to make quite clear, shew plainly, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: διασαφηνίζω
div1.sense: to make quite clear, Xen.

div1.head: διάσειστος
div1.sense: shaken about, Aeschin.

div1.head: διασείω
div1.sense: to shake violently, τι Plat., δ.τῇ οὐρᾷ to wag with the tail, i. e. to keep wagging the tail, Xen.
to confound, throw into confusion, Hdt.
to extort money from a person, NTest.

div1.head: διασεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to dart through, rush across, c. gen., Il.; c. acc., δ. λαὸν Ἀχαιῶν Il.

div1.head: διασημαίνω
div1.sense: to mark out, point out clearly, Hdt., Xen.
absol. to beckon, τῇ χειρί Arist.

div1.head: διάσημος
div1.sense: clear, distinct: neut. pl. as adv., διάσημα θρηνεῖ Soph.
conspicuous, Plut.

div1.head: διασήπω
div1.sense: Act., cause to putrefy, decay; mid. to putrefy, decay, Luc.

div1.head: Διάσια
div1.sense: the festival of Zeus μειλίχιος, Ar.

div1.head: διασίζω
div1.sense: to hiss or whistle violently, Arist.

div1.head: διασιωπάω
div1.sense: to remain silent, Eur., Xen.
trans. to pass over in silence, Eur.

div1.head: διασκανδικίζω
div1.sense: properly, to dose with chervil (σκάνδιξ) : in Com. for διευριπιδίζω, to come Euripides over one (his mother was a herb-seller), Ar.

div1.head: διασκάπτω
div1.sense: to dig through, c. gen., Plut.

div1.head: διασκεδάννυμι
div1.sense: to scatter abroad, scatter to the winds, disperse, Lat. dissipare, Od., Soph.
to disband an army, Hdt.: Pass. to be dispersed, aor. 1 and perf. part. διασκεδασθέντες, διεσκεδασμένοι Hdt.

div1.head: διασκευάζω
div1.sense: to get quite ready, equip, Luc.:—Pass., perf. part. διεσκευασμένοι dressed, Plut.: —Mid. to prepare for oneself, provide, Thuc.: to equip oneself, Xen.
Mid., διασκευασάμενος τὴν οὐσίαν having disposed of oneʼs property, Dem.

div1.head: διασκευωρέω
div1.sense: Mid. to set all in order, Plat.

div1.head: διασκέω
div1.sense: to deck out, Luc.

div1.head: διασκηνέω
div1.sense: to disperse and retire each to his quarters (σκηναί) , to take up oneʼs quarters, Xen.
to leave a comradeʼs tent, Xen.

div1.head: διασκηνητέος
div1.sense: one must take up oneʼs quarters, Xen.

div1.head: διασκηρίπτω
div1.sense: to prop on each side, to prop up, Anth.

div1.head: διασκιρτάω
div1.sense: to leap about or away, Plut.

div1.head: διασκοπέω
div1.sense: to look at in different ways, to examine or consider well, Hdt., Eur., etc.; also in Mid., διασκοπεῖσθαι πρός τι Thuc.
absol. to keep watching, Xen.

div1.head: διασκοπιάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to watch as from a σκοπιά, to spy out, Il.:— to discern, distinguish, Il.

div1.head: διασκορπίζω
div1.sense: to scatter abroad, NTest.

div1.head: διασκώπτω
div1.sense: Mid. to jest one with another, pass jokes to and fro, Xen.

div1.head: διασμάω
div1.sense: to wipe or rinse out, Hdt.

div1.head: διασμήχω
div1.sense: to rub well, Ar.

div1.head: διασμιλεύω
div1.sense: to polish off with the chisel: metaph., Anth.

div1.head: διασοφίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to quibble like a sophist, Ar.

div1.head: διασπαθάω
div1.sense: to squander away, Plut.

div1.head: διασπαρακτός
div1.sense: torn to pieces, Eur.

div1.head: διασπαράσσω
div1.sense: to rend in sunder or in pieces, Aesch.

div1.head: διάσπασμα
div1.sense: a gap, Plut.

div1.head: διασπάω
div1.sense: to tear asunder, part forcibly, Lat. divellere, Hdt., Eur., etc.; δ. τὸ σταύρωμα to tear down the palisade, Xen.: —Pass., perf. part. διεσπασμένος torn asunder, Hdt., Dem.
in military sense, to separate part of an army from the rest, Xen.:—Pass., στράτευμα διεσπασμένον scattered and in disorder, Thuc.;—of soldiers, also, to be distributed in quarters, Xen.
metaph. to distract, throw into disorder, Xen.

div1.head: διασπείρω
div1.sense: to scatter abroad, throw about, of money, Hdt.; δ. λόγον Xen.: to squander, Soph.:—Pass. to be scattered abroad, aor2 διεσπάρην [ᾰ], Soph.; of soldiers, Thuc.

div1.head: διασπορά
div1.sense: dispersion; collectively, = οἱ διεσπαρμένοι, NTest.

div1.head: διασπουδάζω
div1.sense: to do zealously: Pass. to be anxiously done or looked to, τί μάλιστα διεσπούδαστο; Dem., who also uses διεσπούδασται in act. sense.

div1.head: διασταθμάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to order by rule, regulate, Eur.

div1.head: διαστασιάζω
div1.sense: to form into separate factions, Arist.

div1.head: διάστασις
div1.sense: a standing aloof, separation, Hdt.
difference, Plat.:—in Thuc. it has a causal sense, an attempt to set some against others.
divorce, Plut.

div1.head: διαστατικός
div1.sense: separative, causing discord, Plut.

div1.head: διασταυρόω
div1.sense: to fortify with a palisade: Mid. διασταυρώσασθαι τὸν ἰσθμόν to have it fortified, Thuc.

div1.head: διαστείχω
div1.sense: to go through or across, c. acc., Eur.
to go oneʼs way, Theocr.

div1.head: διαστέλλω
div1.sense: to put asunder, tear open, Plut.
to distinguish, define, τὰ λεγόμενα Plat.; so to determine, Plat.
to give express orders, in Mid., NTest.

div1.head: διάστενος
div1.sense: very narrow, Galen.

div1.head: διάστερος
div1.sense: starred, δ. λίθοις Luc.

div1.head: διάστημα
div1.sense: an interval, Plat.

div1.head: διαστηρίζω
div1.sense: to make firm, Anth.

div1.head: διαστίλβω
div1.sense: to gleam through, Ar., Anth.

div1.head: διαστοιβάζω
div1.sense: to stuff in between, Hdt.

div1.head: διαστοιχίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to arrange for oneself regularly, regulate exactly, ἀρχήν Aesch.

div1.head: διαστολή
div1.sense: a notch or nick, Plut.

div1.head: διαστρατηγέω
div1.sense: to serve as a general, assume his duties, Plut.
trans. to conduct a war to its close, Plut.

div1.head: διαστρέφω
div1.sense: to turn different ways, to twist about, distort, Xen.:—Pass. to be distorted, Plat.: of persons, to have oneʼs eyes distorted, to get a squint, Ar.
metaph. to distort, pervert, Dem.

div1.head: διαστροφή
div1.sense: distortion, Arist.

div1.head: διάστροφος
div1.sense: twisted, distorted, Hdt., Trag.

div1.head: διασύρω
div1.sense: to tear in pieces: metaph. to pull to pieces, i.e. to disparage, ridicule, Dem.

div1.head: διασφαιρίζω
div1.sense: to throw about like a ball, Eur.

div1.head: διασφακτήρ
div1.sense: murderous, Anth.

div1.head: διασφάλλω
div1.sense: to overturn utterly, Luc.— Pass. to be disappointed of, τινός Aeschin.

div1.head: διασφάξ
div1.sense: any opening made by violence, a cleft, rocky gorge, Hdt.

div1.head: διασφενδονάω
div1.sense: to scatter as by a sling:— Pass. to fly in pieces, Xen.

div1.head: διασφηκόομαι
div1.sense: Pass.: to be made like a wasp, be pinched in at the waist, Ar.

div1.head: διασχηματίζω
div1.sense: to form completely: Pass. to be so formed, Plat.

div1.head: διασχίζω
div1.sense: to cleave or rend asunder, Od., Plat., etc.:—Pass. to be cloven asunder, Il.; of soldiers, to be separated, Xen.

div1.head: διασῴζω
div1.sense: to preserve through a danger, Hdt., Eur.:—Pass. to come safe through, arrive in safety, Thuc., Xen.: to recover from illness, Xen.
of things, to preserve, maintain, Eur., Xen.: to keep in mind, Xen.:—Mid. to retain, Thuc.

div1.head: διαταγεύω
div1.sense: to arrange, Xen.

div1.head: διαταγή
div1.sense: an ordinance, NTest.

div1.head: διάταξις
div1.sense: disposition, arrangement, of troops, Hdt., Dem.; of topics, Luc.

div1.head: διαταράσσω
div1.sense: to throw into great confusion, confound utterly, Xen.

div1.head: διάτασις
div1.sense: tension, Plat., etc.

div1.head: διατάσσω
div1.sense: to appoint or ordain severally, dispose, Hes., Hdt.:—absol. to make arrangements, Xen.:—Mid. to arrange for oneself, get things arranged, Plat.:—Pass. to be appointed, c. inf., Hdt.
to draw up an army, set in array, Hdt.: also to draw up separately, Hdt.:—Mid., διαταξάμενοι posted in battle-order, Ar., Xen.; so in perf. pass. διατετάχθαι, Hdt.
Mid. to order by will, Anth.

div1.head: διαταφρεύω
div1.sense: to fortify by a ditch, Polyb.

div1.head: διατείνω
div1.sense: to stretch to the uttermost, τόξον Hdt.: to stretch out, τὰς χεῖρας Xen.
intr. to extend, continue, Arist.
Mid. and Pass. to exert oneself, Xen., etc.; διατεινάμενος at full speed, Xen.; with all oneʼs force, Theocr.; διατείνεσθαι πρός τι to exert oneself for a purpose, Xen.
to maintain earnestly, contend for, τι Dem.
in strict sense of Mid. to stretch out for oneself, δ. τὰ βέλεα to have their lances poised, Hdt.; δ. τὸ τόξον to have oneʼs bow strung, Hdt.

div1.head: διατειχίζω
div1.sense: to cut off and fortify by a wall, Ar.
to divide as by a wall, Xen.

div1.head: διατείχισμα
div1.sense: a place walled off and fortified, Thuc.

div1.head: διατεκμαίρομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to mark out, Lat. designare, Hes.

div1.head: διατελευτάω
div1.sense: to bring to fulfilment, Il.

div1.head: διατελέω
div1.sense: to bring quite to an end, accomplish, Eur., Xen.

absol., mostly with a part. added, to continue being or doing so and so, Hdt., Plat.:—but the part. is sometimes omitted, δ. πρόθυμος to continue zealous, Thuc.: also simply to continue, go on, persevere, Plat.: to live on, Plat.

div1.head: διατελής
div1.sense: continuous, incessant, Soph., Plat.

div1.head: διατέμνω
div1.sense: to cut through, cut in twain, dissever, Il., Hdt.; δίχα δ. Plat.:—metaph. to disunite, Aeschin.
to cut up, Hdt.:—Pass., διατμηθῆναι λέπαδνα to be cut into strips, Ar.

div1.head: διατετραίνω
div1.sense: to bore through, make a hole in, τι Hdt.

div1.head: διατήκω
div1.sense: to melt, soften by heat, Ar.
Pass., with perf. -τέτηκα, to melt away, thaw, Xen.

div1.head: διατηρέω
div1.sense: to watch closely, observe, Plat., etc.
to keep faithfully, maintain, Dem., Arist.
δ. ἑαυτὸν ἔκ τινος to keep oneself from . . , NTest.

div1.head: διάτιλμα
div1.sense: a portion plucked off, Anth.

div1.head: διατιμάω
div1.sense: to continue to dishonour, Aesch.

div1.head: διατινάσσω
div1.sense: to shake asunder, shake to pieces, Od., Eur.:—fut. mid. in pass. sense, Eur.
to shake violently, Eur.

div1.head: διατμήγω
div1.sense: to cut in twain, διατμήξας having cut [the Trojan host] in twain, Il.; λαῖτμα διέτμαγον I clove the wave, Od.; ὦλκα δ., of ploughing, Mosch.:—Pass., διέτμαγεν (3rd pl. aor2 for -μάγησαν) they parted, Hom.: they were scattered abroad, Il.

div1.head: διατί
div1.sense: Lat. quamobrem? wherefore

div1.head: διατίθημι
div1.sense: to place separately, arrange each in their own places, dispose, τὸ μὲν ἐπὶ δεξιά, τὸ δʼ ἐπʼ ἀριστερά Hdt.; so Xen., etc.

to manage well or ill, with an adv., κράτιστα διατιθέναι τὰ τοῦ πολέμου Thuc.; of persons, δ. τινὰ ἀνηκέστως to treat him barbarously, Hdt., :—Pass., οὐ ῥᾳδίως διετέθη he was not very gently treated or handled, Thuc.
οὕτω διατιθέναι τινά to dispose one so or so, Plat., etc.
to recite, Plat.
Mid. to arrange as one likes, to dispose of, τὴν θυγατέρα Xen., etc.
to dispose of oneʼs property, devise it by will, Plat.: ὁ διαθέμενος the devisor, testator, NTest.
to set out for sale, dispose of merchandise, Hdt., Xen.
to arrange mutually, δ. διαθήκην τινί to make a covenant with one, Ar., NTest.; πρός τινα Ar.; ἔριν δ. ἀλλήλοις to settle a quarrel with one, Xen.

div1.head: διατομή
div1.sense: a severance, Aesch.

div1.head: διατοξεύσιμος
div1.sense: that can be shot across, δ. χώρα a place within arrow-shot, Plut.

div1.head: διάτορος
div1.sense: piercing, galling, Aesch.; δ. φόβος thrilling fear, Aesch.; of a trumpet, Aesch.
pass. pierced, bored through, Soph.

div1.head: διατρέπω
div1.sense: to turn away from a thing:—Pass. with fut. mid., aor2 mid. -ετραπόμην and pass. -ετράπην [ᾰ], to be turned from oneʼs purpose, to be perplexed, Dem.

div1.head: διατρέφω
div1.sense: to sustain continually, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: διατρέχω
div1.sense: to run across or over the sea, Od.
metaph. to run through, τὸν βίον, τὸν λόγον Plat.
absol. to run about, Lat. discurrere, Ar., Theocr.
δ. μέχρι to penetrate to, Plut.

div1.head: διατρέω
div1.sense: to flee all ways, Il.

div1.head: διατριβή
div1.sense: a way of spending time: hence, a pastime (pass-time), amusement, Ar., Dem.
serious employment, study, Ar., Plat.,
a way of life, living, δ. ἐν ἀγορᾷ Ar.
in bad sense, a waste of time, delay, Eur.; in pl., Thuc.

div1.head: διατρίβω
div1.sense: to rub between, rub hard, rub away, consume, waste, Hom.:—Pass., διατριβῆναι to perish utterly, Hdt.
δ. χρόνον, Lat. terere tempus, to spend time, Hdt., Xen.: Pass., ἐνιαυτὸς διετρίβη Thuc.

absol. (without χρόνον) , to waste time, pass it away, οὐ μὴ διατρίψεις; i. e. make no more delay, Ar.; δ. ἐν γυμνασίοις to pass all oneʼs time there, Ar.; δ. μετʼ ἀλλήλων to go on talking, Ar.: —hence, to employ oneself on or in a thing, ἔν or ἐπί τινι Plat.; περί τι Plat.; c. part., δ. μελετῶν Xen.
also absol. to lose time, delay, Il., Ar., etc.: c. gen., δ. ὁδοῖο to lose time on the way, Od.
to put off by delay, to thwart, hinder a thing, Hom.; δ. Ἀχαιοὺς ὃν γάμον put them off in the matter of her wedding, Od.

div1.head: διατριπτέος
div1.sense: one must spend time, Arist.

div1.head: διάτριχα
div1.sense: in three divisions, three ways, Il.

div1.head: διάτροπος
div1.sense: various in dispositions, Eur.

div1.head: διατροφή
div1.sense: sustenance, support, Xen.

div1.head: διατροχάζω
div1.sense: of a horse, to trot, Xen.

div1.head: διατρύγιος
div1.sense: bearing grapes in succession, Od.

div1.head: διατρώγω
div1.sense: to gnaw through, τὸ δίκτυον Ar.

div1.head: διατυπόω
div1.sense: to form perfectly; δ. νόμους to give them a lasting form, Luc.: metaph. to imagine, Luc.

div1.head: διατύπωσις
div1.sense: configuration, Plut.

div1.head: διαυγάζω
div1.sense: to shine through:— διαυγάζει ἡμέρα day dawns, NTest.

div1.head: διαυγής
div1.sense: transparent, Anth.

div1.head: διαυλοδρόμης
div1.sense: a runner in the δίαυλος, Pind.

div1.head: δίαυλος
div1.sense: a double pipe:— in the race, a double course, in which the runner ran to the furthest point of the στάδιον, turned the post (καμπτήρ) , and ran back by the other side, Pind., Soph., Eur.:—metaph., κάμψαι διαύλου θάτερον κῶλον to run the backward course, retrace oneʼs steps, Aesch.; also, δίαυλοι κυμάτων ebb and flow, Eur.; δισσούς ἂν ἔβαν διαύλους they would twice return, Eur.
a strait, Eur.

div1.head: διαφαγεῖν
div1.sense: to eat through, Hdt.

div1.head: διαφαίνω
div1.sense: to shew through, let a thing be seen through, Theocr.
Pass., aor2 -εφάνην [ᾰ], to appear or shew through, νεκύων δ. χῶρος shewed clear of dead bodies, Il.; of things seen through a transparent substance, Hdt.
to glow, to be red-hot, Od.
metaph. to be proved, shew itself, Thuc.: to be conspicuous among others, Thuc.
absol. in Act. to shew light through, to dawn, ἡμέρα, ἠὼς διέφαινε Hdt.: metaph. to shine through, Xen.

div1.head: διαφάνεια
div1.sense: transparency, Plat.

div1.head: διαφανής
div1.sense: seen through, transparent, Ar., Plat.
red-hot, Hdt.
metaph. transparent, manifest, distinct, Soph., Plat.:—adv. -νῶς, Thuc., etc.
famous, illustrious, Plat.

div1.head: διαφαύσκω
div1.sense: to shew light through, to dawn, Hdt.

div1.head: διαφερόντως
div1.sense: differently from, at odds with, διαφερόντως ἤ . . , Plat.; c. gen., διαφερόντως τῶν ἄλλων above all others, Plat.
absol. eminently, especially, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: διαφέρω
div1.sense: to carry over or across, δ. ναῦς τὸν Ἰσθμόν Thuc.: to carry from one to another, κηρύγματα Eur.:—metaph., γλῶσσαν διοίσει will put the tongue in motion, will speak, Soph.
of Time, δ. τὸν αἰῶνα, τὸν βίον to go through life, Hdt., Eur.; absol., ἄπαις διοίσει Eur.: —in Mid., διοίσεται will pass his life, Soph.; σκοπούμενος διοίσει Xen.
to bear through, bear to the end, σκῆπτρα Eur., etc.
to bear to the end, go through with, πόλεμον Hdt., Thuc.:— to endure, support, sustain, Lat. perferre, Soph., Eur.
to carry different ways, to toss or cast about, Eur.
to spread abroad, Dem.
to tear asunder, Lat. differre, Aesch., Eur.
δ. τὴν ψῆφον to give oneʼs vote a different way, i. e. against another, Hdt.: also simply, to give each man his vote, Eur., Thuc.
intr. to differ, make a difference, Pind., Eur.: c. gen. to be different from, Eur., Ar.

impers. διαφέρει, it makes a difference, πλεῖστον δ., Lat. multum interest, βραχὺ δ. it makes little difference, Eur.; οὐδὲν διαφέρει Plat.;—c. dat. pers., διαφέρει μοι it makes a difference to me, Plat.; αὐτῷ ἰδίᾳ τι δ. he has some private interest at stake, Thuc.
τὸ δ., τὰ διαφέροντα, the difference, the odds, Thuc., etc.; but τὰ δ. also simply points of difference, Thuc.
to be different from a man, i. e. to surpass, excel him, c. gen., Thuc., Plat.:—in a compar. sense, διέφερεν ἀλέξασθαι ἤ . . it was better to defend oneself than . . , Xen.
to prevail, of a belief, Thuc.
Pass. to differ, be at variance, περί τινος Hdt.; τινὶ περί τινος Thuc.: οὐ διαφέρομαι, οὔ μοι διαφέρει, Dem.

div1.head: διαφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee through, get away from, escape, τινά or τι Hdt., Plat.:—absol. to escape, Hdt., Thuc.; διαφεύγει οὐδὲ νῦν it is not now too late, Dem.
to escape one, escape oneʼs notice or memory, Plat., etc.

div1.head: διάφευξις
div1.sense: an escaping, means of escape, Thuc.

div1.head: διαφημίζω
div1.sense: to spread abroad, NTest.

div1.head: διαφθείρω
div1.sense: to destroy utterly, Il., Hdt., Attic: to make away with, kill, destroy, ruin, Soph., etc.; δ. χέρα to weaken, slacken oneʼs hand, Eur.: to disable a ship, Hdt.:—absol. to forget, Eur.
in moral sense, to corrupt, ruin, Aesch., Plat., etc.:— esp. to corrupt by bribes, Hdt., Dem.: to seduce, Lys.
οὐδὲν διαφθείρας τοῦ χρώματος having changed nothing of his colour, Plat.

Pass. to be destroyed, crippled, disabled, Hdt.; τὴν ἀκοὴν διεφθαρμένος deaf, Hdt.: τὰ σκέλεα δ. with their legs broken, Hdt.; τὰ ὄμματα δ. blind, Plat.; τὰς φρένας Eur.; τὸ φρενῶν διαφθαρέν loss of oneʼs mind, Eur.
perf. διέφθορα is intr. in Hom., to have lost oneʼs wits;— but in Attic trans., Soph., Eur.

div1.head: διαφθορά
div1.sense: destruction, ruin, blight, death. Hdt., Attic
in moral sense, corruption, τῶν νέων Xen.
in pass. sense, ἰχθύσιν διαφθ. a prey for fishes, Soph.; πολεμίοις δ. Eur.

div1.head: διαφθορεύς
div1.sense: a corrupter, τῶν νόμων Plat.:—as fem. in Eur.

div1.head: διαφίημι
div1.sense: to dismiss, disband, Xen.

div1.head: διαφιλονεικέω
div1.sense: to dispute earnestly, Plut.

div1.head: διαφιλοτιμέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to strive emulously, Plut.

div1.head: διαφλέγω
div1.sense: to burn through, Plut.:—metaph. to inflame, Plut.

div1.head: διαφοιβάζω
div1.sense: to drive mad: Pass., perf. inf. διαπεφοιβάσθαι Soph.

div1.head: διαφοιτάω
div1.sense: to wander or roam continually, Hdt., Ar.:—of reports, to get abroad, Plut.

div1.head: διαφορά
div1.sense: difference, distinction, Thuc.
variance, disagreement, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: διαφορέω
div1.sense: to spread abroad, Od.
to carry away, carry off, Thuc.; esp. as plunder, Hdt.
to plunder, οἶκον, πόλιν Hdt.:—Pass., διαφορεῖσθαι ὑπό τινος Dem.
to tear in pieces, Eur.:—Pass., Hdt.
to carry across from one place to another, Thuc.

div1.head: διαφόρησις
div1.sense: a plundering, Plut.

div1.head: διάφορος
div1.sense: different, unlike, Hdt., Plat., etc.
differing or disagreeing with another, c. dat., Eur.; in hostile sense, at variance with, τινι Hdt., Plat.; c. gen., δ. τινος oneʼs adversary, Dem.
distinguished, remarkable, Plut.
making a difference to one, advantageous, profitable, Thuc.
as Subst., διάφορον, ου, τό,
a difference, Hdt., Eur., Dem.
what concerns one, a matter of importance, Thuc., Dem.
a difference, disagreement, Dem.
in reference to money-matters, oneʼs balance, expenditure, Dem.
adv. -ρως, with a difference,variously, Thuc.:— δ. ἔχειν to differ, Plat.
excellently, Dem.

div1.head: διαφορότης
div1.sense: difference, Plat.

div1.head: διάφραγμα
div1.sense: a partition-wall, barrier, Thuc.
the midriff, diaphragm (Homerʼs φρένες) , Plat.

div1.head: διαφράγνυμι
div1.sense: to barricade, Plut.

div1.head: διαφράζω
div1.sense: to speak distinctly, tell plainly, Hom.

div1.head: διαφρέω
div1.sense: to let through, let pass, Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: διαφυγή
div1.sense: a refuge, means of escape, τινος from a thing, Plat.

div1.head: διαφυή
div1.sense: any natural break, a joint, suture, division, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: διαφυλακτέος
div1.sense: to be watched, preserved, Xen.

div1.head: διαφυλάσσω
div1.sense: to watch closely, guard carefully, Hdt., etc.; Mid. to guard for oneself, Eur.
to observe closely, τὰ μέτρα Hdt.
to observe, maintain, τοὺς νόμους Plat.; δ. τὸ μή, c. inf., to guard against being . . , Plat.

div1.head: διαφύομαι
div1.sense: of time, to intervene, Hdt.
to be closely connected with, τινος Plut.

div1.head: διαφυσάω
div1.sense: to blow in different directions, disperse, Plat.
to blow through, Luc.

div1.head: διαφύσσω
div1.sense: to draw off liquids continually: Pass., of wine, Od.
to draw away, tear away, πολλὸν διήφυσε σαρκὸς ὀδόντι Od.

div1.head: διαφωνέω
div1.sense: to be dissonant, Plat.:—generally, to disagree, Plat.; τινι with one, Plat.

div1.head: διάφωνος
div1.sense: discordant, Luc.

div1.head: διαφωτίζω
div1.sense: to clear completely, Plut.

div1.head: διαχάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to withdraw, Xen.

div1.head: διαχαλάω
div1.sense: to loosen, unbar, Eur.
to make supple by exercise, Xen.

div1.head: διαχάσκω
div1.sense: to gape wide, yawn, Ar.

div1.head: διαχειμάζω
div1.sense: to pass the winter, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: διαχειρίζω
div1.sense: to have in hand, conduct, manage, administer, Oratt.:—Pass., Xen.

div1.head: διαχείρισις
div1.sense: management, administration, Thuc.

div1.head: διαχειροτονέω
div1.sense: to choose between two persons or things by show of hands, to elect, Dem.; so in Mid., Xen.

div1.head: διαχειροτονία
div1.sense: election, Dem., Aeschin.

div1.head: διαχέω
div1.sense: to pour different ways, to disperse, Hdt.:— to cut up a victim, Hom.
to dissolve, break up, destroy, Xen.
metaph. to confound, τὰ βεβουλευμένα Hdt.
Pass. to be poured from one vessel into another, Hdt.
to run through, spread about, Thuc.
to be dissolved, fall away, of a corpse, Hdt.: to disperse, of soldiers, Xen.
metaph. to be or become diffuse or dissipated, Plat.

div1.head: διαχόω
div1.sense: διαχοῦν τὸ χῶμα to complete the mound, Hdt., διαχώννυμι later in Strab.

div1.head: διαχράομαι
div1.sense: Dep., c. dat. rei, to use constantly or habitually, Hdt.; τῇ ἀληθείῃ δ. to speak the truth, Hdt.; δ. ἀρετῇ to practise virtue, Hdt.
like Lat. utor, of passive states, to meet with, suffer under, συμφορῇ, αὐχμῷ Hdt.
c. acc. pers. to use up, consume, destroy, Hdt., Thuc.
Pass., perf. -κέχρημαι, to be lent out to different persons, Dem.

div1.head: διάχρυσος
div1.sense: interwoven with gold, Dem.

div1.head: διάχυσις
div1.sense: diffusion, Plat.; δ. λαμβάνειν to be spread out, Plut.
merriment, Plut.

div1.head: διαχωρέω
div1.sense: to go through, pass through: impers., κάτω διεχώρει αὐτοῖς they were suffering from diarrhoea, Xen.
of coins, to be current, Luc.

div1.head: διαχωρίζω
div1.sense: to separate, Xen.

div1.head: διαχώρισμα
div1.sense: a cleft, division, Luc.

div1.head: διαψαίρω
div1.sense: mostly in pres., to brush or blow away, Ar.

div1.head: διαψεύδω
div1.sense: to deceive utterly, Dem.:— Pass. to be deceived, mistaken, Dem.; δ. τινος to be cheated of, deceived in a person or thing, Xen., Dem.; περί τι or τινι Arist.

div1.head: διαψηφίζω
div1.sense: act. put to a vote; mid. to vote in order with ballots (ψῆφοι, calculi), Thuc.
to decide by vote, Dem.

div1.head: διαψήφισις
div1.sense: a voting by ballot, Xen.

div1.head: διαψήχω
div1.sense: to cause to crumble away, Plut.

div1.head: διαψιθυρίζω
div1.sense: to whisper among themselves, Luc.

div1.head: διαψύχω
div1.sense: to cool, refresh:—to dry and clean, ναῦς Thuc.; of misers bringing out their hoards, Xen.

div1.head: δίβαμος
div1.sense: on two legs, Eur.

div1.head: διβολία
div1.sense: a double-edged lance, halbert, Plut.

div1.head: δίβολος
div1.sense: two-pointed, Eur., Anth.

div1.head: δίγληνος
div1.sense: with two eye-balls, Theocr.

div1.head: δίγλωσσος
div1.sense: speaking two languages, Lat. bilinguis, Thuc.
as Subst., δίγλωσσος, ὁ, an interpreter, Plut.

div1.head: δίγονος
div1.sense: twice-born, of Bacchus, Anth.
twin: double, Eur.

div1.head: δίδαγμα
div1.sense: a lesson, Ar.

div1.head: διδακτέος
div1.sense: one must teach, Plat.

div1.head: διδακτικός
div1.sense: apt at teaching, NTest.

div1.head: διδακτός
div1.sense: of things, taught, learnt, Soph.
that can or ought to be taught or learnt, Pind., Soph., etc.
of persons, taught, instructed, τινός in a thing, NTest.

div1.head: δίδαξις
div1.sense: teaching, instruction, Eur.

div1.head: διδασκαλεῖον
div1.sense: a teaching-place, school, Thuc., Plat., etc.

div1.head: διδασκαλία
div1.sense: teaching, instruction, education, Lat. disciplina, Xen., Plat., etc.; διδασκαλίαν ποιεῖσθαι or παρέχειν to serve as a lesson to one, Thuc.
the rehearsing of a dramatic chorus, Plat.: also, the drama itself, Plut.

div1.head: διδασκαλικός
div1.sense: fit for teaching, capable of giving instruction, instructive, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: διδασκάλιον
div1.sense: a thing taught, a science, art, lesson, Hdt., Xen.
in pl. a teacherʼs fee, Plut.

div1.head: διδάσκαλος
div1.sense: a teacher, master, Hhymn., Aesch., etc.: εἰς διδασκάλου (sc. οἶκον) φοιτᾶν to go to school, Plat.; διδασκάλων or ἐκ διδασκάλων ἀπαλλαγῆναι to leave school, Plat.; ἐν διδασκάλων at school, Plat.
a dramatic poet was called διδάσκαλος because he taught the actors, Ar.

div1.head: διδάσκω
div1.sense: to teach (i. e. instruct) a person, or teach a thing, Hom., etc.: c. dupl. acc., σε . . ἱπποσύνας ἐδίδαξαν they taught thee riding, Il.; to teach one a thing, Hom., etc.; also, δ. τινὰ περί τινος Ar.:—c. acc. pers. et inf. to teach one to be so and so, Od.; c. inf. only, δίδαξε βάλλειν taught him how to shoot, Il.;—also with inf. omitted, διδάσκειν τινὰ ἱππέα sc. εἶναι to train one as a horseman, Plat.; so, δ. τινὰ σοφόν, κακόν Eur.:— Mid. to teach oneself, learn, Soph.: but the usual sense of the Mid. is to have another taught, of a father, to have his son taught, Plat., etc.:—Pass. to be taught, to learn, c. gen., διδασκόμενος πολέμοιο trained in war, Il.; also c. acc., Il., etc.; c. inf., δεδιδαγμένος εἶναι Hdt.; διδάσκεται λέγειν ἀκοῦσαί θʼ Eur.
διδάσκειν is used of dramatic Poets, who originally taught the actors their parts, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: δίδημι
div1.etym: Epic redupl. form of δέω, as τίθημι of *θέω
div1.sense: to bind, fetter, Hom.

div1.head: δίδραχμος
div1.sense: worth two drachms: with pay of two drachms a day, Thuc.
as Subst. δί-δραχμον, ου, τό, a double-drachm or half-shekel, paid to the temple-treasury at Jerusalem, NTest.

div1.head: διδυμάνωρ
div1.sense: touching both the men, Aesch.

div1.head: διδυμητόκος
div1.sense: bearing twins, Theocr., Anth.

div1.head: διδυμάων
div1.etym: only in dual nom. and pl. dat.
div1.sense: twin-brothers, twins, Il.

div1.head: διδυμογενής
div1.sense: twin-born, Eur.

div1.head: δίδυμος
div1.sense: double, twofold, twain, Hom., Attic; διδύμη ἅλς, i. e. the Pontus and Bosporus, Soph.
twin, Soph., Eur.:—as Subst., δίδυμοι twins, Il., Hdt.; also δίδυμα, τά, Hdt.

div1.head: διεγγυάω
div1.sense: of persons, in Act. to give bail for another, and in Mid. to take bail for him, Isocr.:— Pass. to be bailed by any one, Thuc.

div1.head: δίδωμι
div1.etym: Redupl. from Root !δο, Lat. do, dare.
div1.sense: Orig. sense, to give, τί τινι Hom., etc.; in pres. and imperf. to be ready to give, to offer, Hom.
of the gods, to grant, κῦδος, νίκην, and of evils, δ. ἄλγεα, ἄτας, κήδεα Hom.; later, εὖ διδόναι τινί to provide well for . . , Soph., Eur.
to offer to the gods, Hom., etc.
with an inf. added, δῶκε τεύχεα θεράποντι φορῆναι gave him the arms to carry, Il.; διδοῖ πιεῖν gives to drink, Hdt., etc.

Prose phrases, δ. ὅρκον, opp. to λαμβάνειν, to tender an oath; δ. χάριν, χαρίζεσθαι, as ὀργῆι χάριν δούς having indulged his anger, Soph.;— λόγον τινὶ δ. to give one leave to speak, Xen.; but, δ. λόγον ἑαυτῶι to deliberate, Hdt.
c. acc. pers. to give over, deliver up, Hom., etc.
of parents, to give their daughter to wife, Hom.
in Attic, διδόναι τινά τινι to grant any one to entreaties, pardon him, Xen.:— διδόναι τινί τι to forgive one a thing, remit its punishment, Eur., Dem.
διδόναι ἑαυτόν τινι to give oneself up, Hdt., etc.
δ.δίκην, v. δίκη IV. 3.
in vows and prayers, c. acc. pers. et inf. to grant, allow, bring about that, Hom., Trag.
seemingly intr. to give oneself up, devote oneself, τινί Eur.

div1.head: διεγγύησις
div1.sense: a giving of bail, Dem.

div1.head: διεῖδον
div1.etym: aor2 with no pres. in use, διοράω being used instead
div1.sense: to see thoroughly, discern, Ar., Plat.; διιδεῖν περί τινος Plat.

div1.head: διειλημμένως
div1.sense: distinctly, Xen.

div1.head: δίειμι
div1.sense: to go to and fro, roam about, Ar.; of a report, to spread, Plut.
c. acc. to go through, go through a thing, to narrate, describe, discuss, Plat.

div1.head: διεῖπον
div1.sense: to say through, tell fully or distinctly, Hom., Soph.: to interpret a riddle, Soph.
to speak one with another, converse, διαειπέμεν ἀλλήλοισιν Od.

div1.head: διείργω
div1.sense: to keep asunder, separate, Il., Hdt., Thuc.
seemingly intr., to lie between, Xen.

div1.head: διείρομαι
div1.sense: to question closely, Hom., Plat.

div1.head: διειρύω
div1.sense: to draw across, τὰς νέας τὸν ἰσθμόν Hdt.

div1.head: διείρω
div1.sense: to pass or draw through, Xen.

div1.head: διειρωνόξενος
div1.sense: dissembling with oneʼs guests, Ar.

div1.head: διέκδυσις
div1.sense: an evasion, Plut.

div1.head: διεκθέω
div1.sense: to run through, Plut.

div1.head: διεκπαίω
div1.sense: to break or burst through, Luc.

div1.head: διεκπεραίνω
div1.sense: to go through with, Xen.

div1.head: διεκπεράω
div1.sense: to pass out through, pass quite through, c. acc., Hdt.:— to cross over, Aesch.
to pass by, overlook, Ar.

div1.head: διεκπλέω
div1.sense: to sail out through, c. acc., Hdt.: absol. to sail out, Hdt.
