in naval tactics, to break the enemyʼs line by sailing through it, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: διέκπλοος
div1.sense: a sailing across or through, passing across or through, Hdt.
a breaking the enemyʼs line in a sea-fight, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: διέκ
div1.sense: prep. through and out of, c. gen., Hom.

div1.head: διεκδύομαι
div1.sense: to slip out through, c. acc., Plut.

div1.head: διέκροος
div1.sense: a passage for the stream to escape, Hdt.

div1.head: διεκφεύγω
div1.sense: to escape completely, Plut.

div1.head: διεκχέω
div1.etym: strengthd. for ἐκχέω Aretae. Cur. M. Ac. 2.5.

div1.head: διέλασις
div1.sense: a driving through: a charge or exercise of cavalry, Xen.

div1.head: διελαύνω
div1.sense: to drive through or across, c. gen., τάφροιο διήλασεν ἵππους Il.
to thrust through, λαπάρης διήλασεν ἔγχος Il.
δ. τινὰ λόγχῃ to thrust one through with a lance, Plut., Luc.
intr. (sub. ἵππον) to ride through, charge through, Xen.

div1.head: διελέγχω
div1.sense: to refute utterly, Plat.

div1.head: διέλκω
div1.sense: to draw asunder, widen, Plat.
to pull through a thing, c. gen., Ar.
to keep on drinking, Ar.

div1.head: διεμπολάω
div1.sense: to sell to different buyers, or sell in lots, Lat. divendere, Eur., Ar.:—metaph. to sell, betray, τινά Soph.

div1.head: διεμφαίνω
div1.sense: to shew through, Luc.

div1.head: δίεμαι
div1.etym: as if from an Act. δίημι δίω
div1.sense: to flee, speed, πεδίοιο over the plain, Il.; δίεσθαι to hasten away, Il.
to fear, c. inf., Aesch.

div1.head: διενεκτέος
div1.sense: one must excel, Luc.

div1.head: διενιαυτίζω
div1.sense: to live out the year, Hdt.

div1.head: διεντέρευμα
div1.sense: a looking through entrails, Comic word for sharp-sightedness, Ar.

div1.head: διεξαΐσσω
div1.sense: to rush forth, Theocr.

div1.head: διέξειμι
div1.sense: to go out through, pass through, Il., Hdt.
to go through in detail, recount in full, relate circumstantially, Hdt., Plat., etc.; δ. περί τινος to go through by way of examining, Eur.

div1.head: διεξελαύνω
div1.sense: to drive, ride, march through, absol., Hdt.; c. acc. loci, δ. τὰς πύλας Hdt.

div1.head: διεξελέγχω
div1.sense: to refute utterly, Luc.

div1.head: διεξελίσσω
div1.sense: to unroll, untie, Hdt.

div1.head: διεξερέομαι
div1.sense: to learn by close questioning a person, τινά τι Il.

div1.head: διεξέρχομαι
div1.sense: to go through, pass through, τὸ χωρίον Hdt.
to go through, go completely through, πάντας φίλους Eur., etc.: c. part., δ. πωλέων to be done selling, Hdt.
to go through in succession, διὰ πάντων δ. τῶν παίδων, i. e. killing them one after another, Hdt.; διὰ πασῶν τῶν ζημιῶν, i. e. trying one after another, Thuc.
to go through in detail, recount in full, Hdt., etc.
intr. to be past, gone by, of time, Hdt.
to be gone through, related fully, Dem.

div1.head: διεξίημι
div1.sense: to let pass through, Hdt.
intr. (sub. αὑτόν) , of a river, to empty itself, Thuc.

div1.head: διεξοδικός
div1.sense: detailed, Plut.

div1.head: διέξοδος
div1.sense: a way out through, an outlet, passage, channel, Hdt.; διέξοδοι ὁδῶν passage-ways, Hdt.
a pathway, orbit, of the sun, Hdt., etc.
an issue, event, Hdt.
a detailed narrative, description, Plat.

div1.head: διεξυφαίνω
div1.sense: to finish the web, Plut.

div1.head: διεορτάζω
div1.sense: to keep the feast throughout, Thuc.

div1.head: διέπω
div1.sense: to manage an affair, order, arrange, Il.; δ. τὰ πρήγματα Hdt.

div1.head: διεργάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to make an end of, kill, destroy, Lat. conficere, Hdt., Soph.:—plup. in pass. sense, διέργαστο τὰ πράγματα, actum erat de rebus, Hdt.; so in aor1 διεργασθεῖτʼ ἄν Eur.

div1.head: διερείδω
div1.sense: Mostly mid. to lean upon, τινι Eur.

div1.head: διερέσσω
div1.sense: to row about, χερσὶ δ. to swim, Od.
c. acc., δ. τὰς χέρας to swing them about, Eur.

div1.head: διερευνάω
div1.sense: to search through, examine closely, Plat.: also in Mid., Plat.

div1.head: διερευνητής
div1.sense: a scout or vidette, Xen.

div1.head: διερίζω
div1.sense: to strive with one another:— Mid. to contend with, τινί Plut.

div1.head: διερμηνευτής
div1.sense: an interpreter, NTest.

div1.head: διερμηνεύω
div1.sense: to interpret, expound, NTest.

div1.head: διερός
div1.sense: fresh, active, nimble, of men, Od.; διερῷ ποδί with nimble foot, Od.

after Hom. = liquidus, wet, liquid, Aesch.; of birds, which float through the air, Ar.; δ. μέλεα of the nightingaleʼsnotes, Lat. liquidae voces, Ar.; δ. πώγων of one drowned in the sea, Anth. (The sense of liquid is not in Hom.: his usage seems to connect it with δί-ω, to run, flee.)

div1.head: διέρπω
div1.sense: to creep or pass through, πῦρ δ., of the ordeal of fire, Soph.

div1.head: διερύκω
div1.sense: to keep off, to hinder, Plut.

div1.head: διέρχομαι
div1.etym: fut. διελεύσομαι, but δίειμι is Attic fut.,διῄειν imperf.
div1.sense: Dep. to go through, pass through, absol. or c. gen., Il., Soph.:—c. acc., also, Il., Thuc., etc.
to pass through, complete, Hdt., Plat., etc.
of reports, βάξις διῆλθʼ Ἀχαιούς Soph.; absol., λόγος διῆλθε went abroad, spread, Thuc., Xen.
of pain, to shoot through one, Soph.; of passion, Soph.; ἐμὲ διῆλθέ τι a thought shot through me, Eur.
to go through in detail, tell all through, Aesch., Thuc.
intr. of Time, to pass, elapse, Hdt., Dem.; so, σπονδῶν διελθουσῶν Thuc.; but, διελθὼν ἐς βραχὺν χρόνον having waited, Eur.

div1.head: διερῶ
div1.etym: διερῶ serving as fut., διείρηκα as perf., of διαγορεύω
div1.sense: to say fully, distinctly, expressly, Plat., Dem.:—Pass., aor1 διερρήθην, perf. διείρημαι, Plat.

div1.head: διερωτάω
div1.sense: to cross-question, τινα Plat.
to ask constantly or continually, Dem.

div1.head: διεσθίω
div1.sense: to eat through, δ. τὴν μήτραν, of young vipers, Hdt.

div1.head: διεσκεμμένως
div1.sense: prudently, Xen.

div1.head: διετήσιος
div1.sense: lasting through the year, Lat. perennis, Thuc.

div1.head: διετής
div1.sense: of or lasting two years, Hdt.:— διετές, Lat. biennium, ἐπὶ διετὲς ἡβᾶν to be two years past puberty, Aeschin.

div1.head: διετία
div1.sense: a space of two years, NTest.

div1.head: διευθύνω
div1.sense: to set right, amend, Luc.

div1.head: διευκρινέω
div1.sense: to separate accurately, arrange carefully, Xen.

div1.head: διευλαβέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to take good heed to, beware of, be on oneʼs guard against, c. acc. or gen., Plat.

div1.head: διευλαβητέος
div1.sense: one must take heed to, Plat.

div1.head: διευνάω
div1.sense: to lay asleep, τὸν βίοτον Eur.

div1.head: διευσχημονέω
div1.sense: to preserve decorum, Plut.

div1.head: διευτυχέω
div1.sense: to continue prosperous, Dem.

div1.head: διέχω
div1.sense: trans. to keep apart or separate, Lat. distinere, Hdt., Plut.
to keep off, Plut.
intr. to go through, hold its way, of arrows and lances, Il.:— to extend or reach, Hdt.
to stand apart, be separated or distant, Theogn., Thuc.; διέχοντες ἤεσαν they marched with spaces between man and man, Thuc.; σταδίους ὡς πεντήκοντα διέχει is about 50 stades wide, Xen.
of Time, to intervene, Soph.
to differ, Arist.

div1.head: διεψευσμένως
div1.sense: altogether falsely, Strab.

div1.head: δίζημαι
div1.etym: Prob. redupl. from the same Root as ζητέω.
div1.sense: Dep.
to seek out, look for, τινά Il.

to seek for, seek after a thing, Od.; ἐέδνοισιν διζήμενος seeking to win her by gifts, Od.; δ. τὸ μαντήϊον to seek out, seek the meaning of, Hdt.; ἀγγέλους δ. εἰ . . to inquire of them whether . . , Hdt.:—c. inf. to seek, desire to do, Hdt.; c. acc. et inf. to demand or require that, Hdt.

div1.head: δίζυξ
div1.sense: double-yoked, ἵπποι Il.: double, Anth.

div1.head: δίζω
div1.sense: to be in doubt, at a loss, Il., Orac. ap. Hdt. (Prob. from the same Root as δίς;— but)
Mid. δίζομαι, δίζημαι, Theocr., Bion.

div1.head: δίζωος
div1.sense: with two lives, Sisyphus, who returned from Hades, Anth.

div1.head: διηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to set out in detail, describe in full, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: διήγησις
div1.sense: narrative, statement, Plat.

div1.head: διηθέω
div1.sense: to strain through, filter, Lat. percolare, Plat.
to wash out, cleanse, purge, Hdt.
intr., of the liquid, to percolate, Hdt.

div1.head: διήκω
div1.sense: to extend or reach from one place to another, Hdt., Thuc.
c. acc. to go through, pervade, Aesch., Soph.
to pass over, Aesch.

div1.head: διημερεύω
div1.sense: to stay through the day, pass the day, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: διηνεκής
div1.sense: continuous, unbroken, Lat. continuus, Od.; νώτοισι διηνεκέεσσι with slices cut the whole length of the chine, Il.:—adv. διηνεκέως, continuously, from beginning to end, Lat. uno tenore, Od.: also distinctly, positively, Od., Hes.

div1.head: διήνεμος
div1.sense: blown through, wind-swept, Soph.

div1.head: διηπειρόω
div1.sense: to make dry land of, Anth.

div1.head: διήρης
div1.sense: double, μελάθρων διῆρες an upper story, upper room, Eur.

div1.head: διηχέω
div1.sense: to transmit the sound of, τι Plut.

div1.head: διθάλασσος
div1.sense: between two seas, where two seas meet, NTest.

div1.head: δίθηκτος
div1.sense: two-edged, ξίφος Aesch.

div1.head: δίθρονος
div1.sense: two-throned, Ἀχαιῶν δ. κράτος the two-throned might of the Achaeans, i. e. the brother-kings, Aesch.

div1.head: Διθυραμβογενής
div1.sense: Bacchus-born, Anth.

div1.head: διθυραμβοδιδάσκαλος
div1.sense: the dithyrambic poet who taught his own chorus, Ar.

div1.head: διθύραμβος
div1.sense: the dithyramb; a kind of lyric poetry, Hdt., Ar., etc.: its proper subject was the birth of Bacchus, Plat.

div1.head: δίθυρος
div1.sense: with two doors, Plut.: with two leaves, of tablets, Luc.

div1.head: δίθυρσον
div1.sense: a double thyrsus, Anth.

div1.head: διΐημι
div1.sense: to drive or thrust through a thing, c. gen., Od., Eur.; also c. dupl. acc., λόγχην δ. στέρνα Eur.
to let people go through a country, give them a passage through, Xen., Dem.:— c. gen., ξυμφορὰς τοῦ σοῦ διῆκας στόματος didst let them pass through thy mouth, gavest utterance to them, Soph.
to send apart, to dismiss, disband, Xen.
to dissolve: in Mid., διέμενος ὄξει having diluted it with vinegar, Ar.

div1.head: διιθύνω
div1.sense: to direct by steering, Anth.

div1.head: διϊκνέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to go through, penetrate, Plut.:— to reach, with missiles, Thuc.
in speaking, to go through, recount, Il.

div1.head: Δίϊος
div1.sense: of Zeus, Plat.

div1.head: Διιπετής
div1.sense: fallen from Zeus, i. e. from heaven, of streams, fed or swollen by rain, Hom.
generally, divine, bright, pure, Eur.

div1.head: Διιπετής
div1.sense: hovering in air, Hhymn.

div1.head: διιστέος
div1.sense: one must learn, Eur.

div1.head: διΐστημι
div1.sense: to set apart, to place separately, separate, Thuc., Dem.
to set one at variance with another, τινά τινος Ar., Thuc.; δ. τὴν Ἑλλάδα to divide it into fractions, Hdt.
Mid. and Pass., with aor2, perf., and plup. act., to stand apart, to be divided, Il.; θάλασσα διΐστατο the sea made way, opened, Il.; τὰ διεστεῶτα chasms, Hdt.
of persons, to stand apart, be at variance, Il., Thuc.; διέστη ἐς ξυμμαχίαν ἑκατέρων sided with one or the other party, Thuc.:—simply to differ, be different, Xen.
to part after fighting, Hdt.
to stand at certain distances or intervals, Hdt.; of soldiers, δ. κατὰ διακοσίους Thuc.
aor1 mid. is trans. to separate, Plat., Theocr.

div1.head: διϊσχυρίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to lean upon, rely on, τινι Aeschin.
to affirm confidently, τι Plat.; δ. τι εἶναι Plat.

div1.head: διιτέος
div1.sense: one must go through, Plat.

div1.head: δικάζω
div1.sense: to judge, to give judgment on a thing, decide or determine a point, Il., etc.

c. acc. cogn., δίκας δ., to adjudge a penalty, Hdt.; δ. φυγήν τινι to decree it as his punishment, Aesch.; δ. φόνον ματρός to ordain her slaughter, Eur.; δ. τοῦ ἐγκλήματος [sc. δίκην Xen.:—Pass. to be decided, Thuc.
to pass judgment on, condemn, Soph.
φόνον δ. to plead in a case of murder, Eur.
c. dat. pers. to decide between persons, judge their cause, Τρωσί τε καὶ Δαναοῖσι δικαζέτω Il.; ἐς μέσον ἀμφοτέροισι δικάσσατε Il.: —Pass. to be judged or accused, Xen.
absol. to be judge, give judgment, Il.:— to sit as judges or jurymen, Dem.

Mid. of the culprit, to plead oneʼs own case, defend oneʼs right, have oneʼs case tried, go to law, Od., etc.: —δίκην δικάζεσθαί τινι to go to law with one, Plat.; πρός τινα Thuc.; τινος or περί τινος for a thing, Dem.

div1.head: δικαιοκρισία
div1.sense: righteous judgment, NTest.

div1.head: δικαιολογέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to plead oneʼs cause before the judge, Aeschin.
in Act., οἱ δικαιολογοῦντες advocates, Luc.

div1.head: δικαιόπολις
div1.sense: strict in public faith, Pind.

div1.head: δικαιοπραγέω
div1.sense: to act honestly, Arist.

div1.head: δικαιοπράγημα
div1.sense: a just or honest act, Arist.

div1.head: δικαιοπραγία
div1.sense: just or honest dealing, Arist.

div1.head: δίκαιος
div1.note: δίκαιος, α ον and ος, ον
div1.sense: in Hom. and early writers,
of persons, observant of custom and social rule, well-ordered, civilised, Od.; so, δικαίη ζόη a regular way of living, Hdt.:—adv., δικαίως μνᾶσθαι to woo in due form, decently, Od.
observant of right, righteous, Hom., etc.:—so of actions, in accordance with right, righteous, Hom.
later usage:
of things, even, well-balanced, ἅρμα δίκαιον Xen.:— regular, exact, rigid, ὀργυιαὶ δίκαιαι Hdt.; τῷ δικαιοτάτῳ τῶν λόγων to speak quite exactly, Hdt.; πάντα δικαίως τετήρηται Dem.
right, lawful, just, τὸ δίκαιον right, opp. to τὸ ἄδικον, Hdt., etc.; also, a right, a lawful claim, Thuc., etc.:—adv. -ως, rightly, justly, Hdt., etc.
of persons, as well as things, like Lat. justus, meet, right, fitting, Aesch.; ἵππον δ. ποιεῖσθαί τινι to make a horse fit for anotherʼs use, Xen.
real, genuine, true, Dem., συγγραφεύς Luc.:—adv. -ως, really and truly, Soph.
fair, moderate, like μέτριος, Thuc.: —δικαίως with reason, Soph., Thuc.

in Prose, δίκαιός εἰμι with inf., δίκαιοί ἐστε ἰέναι you are bound to come, Hdt.; δ. εἰμι κολάζειν I have a right to punish, Ar.; δίκαιοί εἰσι ἀπιστότατοι εἶναι they have reason to be most distrustful, Thuc.; δ. ἐστιν ἀπολωλέναι dignus est qui pereat, Dem.:—we should say δίκαιόν ἐστι, which also occurs.

div1.head: δικαιοσύνη
div1.sense: righteousness, justice, Theogn., Hdt., Xen., Plat. etc.

div1.head: δικαιόω
div1.sense: to set right: Pass., δικαιωθείς proved, tested, Aesch.

to hold or deem right, think fit, demand, c. inf., Hdt., etc.; inf. omitted, as οὕτω δικαιοῦν (sc. γενέσθαι) Hdt.:— to consent, δουλεύειν Hdt.; οὐ δ. to refuse, Thuc.:—c. acc. pers. et inf. to desire one to do, Hdt.
to do a man right or justice, to judge, i. e.,
to condemn, Thuc.: to chastise, punish, Hdt.
to deem righteous, justify, NTest.

div1.head: δικαίωμα
div1.sense: an act by which wrong is set right: —a judgment, punishment, penalty, Plat.
a plea of right, Thuc.: justification, NTest.: and
an ordinance, decree, NTest.

div1.head: δικαίωσις
div1.sense: a setting right, doing justice to: punishment, Thuc.
a deeming righteous, justification, NTest.
a demand of right or as of right, a just claim, Thuc.
judgment of what is right, Thuc.

div1.head: δικαιωτήριον
div1.sense: a house of correction, Plat.

div1.head: δικανικός
div1.sense: of persons, skilled in law, versed in pleading, lawyer-like, Plat., Xen., etc.
of things, belonging to trials, judicial, Ar., Plat., etc.: like a lawyerʼs speech, tedious, Plat.

div1.head: δικάρηνος
div1.sense: two-headed, (δίς, κάρηνον) Batr., Anth.

div1.head: δικασπόλος
div1.sense: one who administers law, a judge, Hom.

div1.head: δικαστήριον
div1.sense: a court of justice, Hdt., Ar., etc.: —ὑπὸ δ. ἄγειν, ὑπάγειν τινά Hdt.; εἰς δ. ἄγειν Plat.
the court, i. e. the judges, Ar., Dem.

div1.head: δικαστής
div1.sense: a judge, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
at Athens, the δικασταί, like the Roman judices, were more like our jurymen (the presiding judge being ὁ κριτής) , Soph., etc.
δ. αἵματος an avenger, Eur.

div1.head: δικαστικός
div1.sense: of or for law or trials, practised in them, Xen.
as Subst., τὸ δ. the jurorʼs fee, at first one obol, then three obols, Ar.

div1.head: δικάστρια
div1.sense: a she-judge, Luc.

div1.head: δικεῖν
div1.sense: to throw, cast, Aesch., Eur.
to strike, Pind., Eur.

div1.head: δίκελλα
div1.sense: a mattock, a two-pronged hoe, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: δικελλίτης
div1.sense: a digger, Luc.

div1.head: δικέραιος
div1.sense: two-horned, two-pointed, Anth.

div1.head: δίκερως
div1.sense: two-horned, Hhymn.

div1.head: δίκη
div1.sense: custom, usage, αὕτη δίκη ἐστὶ βροτῶν this is the custom of mortals, Od.; ἡ γὰρ δίκη ἐστι γερόντων Od.:—acc. δίκην as adv., after the manner of, c. gen., δίκην ὕδατος Aesch., Plat.
right as dependent on custom, law, right, Hom., etc.
δίκη ἐστι, like δίκαιόν ἐστι, Aesch.: —δίκῃ duly, rightly, Il., Trag.; κατὰ δίκην Hdt.; μετὰ δίκης Plat.; πρὸς δίκης Soph.
a judgment, δίκην εἰπεῖν to give judgment, Il.: pl. righteous judgments, Hom.
after Hom., a lawsuit, properly, a private suit or action, opp. to γραφή (a public suit or indictment), Plat., etc.
the trial of the case, πρὸ δίκης Thuc.

the penalty awarded by the judge, δίκην τίνειν, ἐκτίνειν Hdt., Soph.; δίκην or δίκας διδόναι to make amends, suffer punishment, Lat. poenas dare, Hdt., Attic; δίκας δοῦναι, also, to submit to trial, Thuc.: —δίκας λαμβάνειν is sometimes = δ. διδόναι, Lat. dare poenas, Hdt., Dem.; but also like Lat. sumere poenas, to inflict punishment, take vengeance, λαβεῖν δίκην παρά τινος Dem.:—also, δίκας or δίκην ὑπέχειν to stand trial, Hdt., Soph.; δίκην παρέχειν Eur.: —δίκην ὀφλεῖν ὑπό τινος to incur penalty, Plat.; δίκην φεύγειν to be the defendant in the trial (opp. to διώκειν to prosecute), Dem.: —δίκας αἰτέειν to demand satisfaction, τινός for a thing, Hdt.; δίκην τίσασθαι, v. τίνω II: —δίκας διδόναι καὶ λαμβάνειν παρ’ ἀλλήλων to have their causes tried, of subject-states whose causes were tried in the courts of the ruling state, Hdt.

div1.head: δικηφόρος
div1.sense: bringing justice, avenging, Ζεύς Aesch.; ἡμέρα δ. the day of vengeance, Aesch.:—as Subst. an avenger, Aesch.

div1.head: δικίδιον
div1.sense: a little trial, Ar.

div1.head: δικλίς
div1.sense: double-folding, of doors or gates, in pl., Od.; rarely in sg., Theocr., Anth.

div1.head: δικογραφία
div1.sense: the composition of lawspeeches, Isocr.

div1.head: δικολόγος
div1.sense: a pleader, advocate, Plut.

div1.head: δικορραφέω
div1.sense: to get up a lawsuit, Ar.

div1.head: δικόρυμβος
div1.sense: two-pointed, two-peaked, Luc.

div1.head: δικόρυφος
div1.sense: two-peaked, of Parnassus, Eur.

div1.head: δίκρανον
div1.sense: a pitch-fork, Luc.

div1.head: δικρατής
div1.sense: co-mate in power, Soph.; δικρατεῖς λόγχαι double-slaying spears, Soph.

div1.head: δίκροος
div1.sense: forked, cloven, bifurcate, Xen.

div1.head: δίκροτος
div1.sense: double-beating, κῶπαι Eur.
of ships, double-oared or with two banks of oars, Xen.
δ. ἁμαξιτός a road for two cars, Eur.

div1.head: δικτατορία
div1.sense: the dictatorship, Plut.

div1.head: δικτάτωρ
div1.sense: the Roman dictator, Polyb.

div1.head: δικτυβολέω
div1.sense: to cast the net, Anth.

div1.head: δικτυβόλος
div1.sense: a fisherman, Anth.

div1.head: Δίκτυννα
div1.sense: Artemis as goddess of the chase, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: δικτυόκλωστος
div1.sense: woven in meshes, σπεῖραι δ. the netʼs meshy coils, Soph.

div1.head: δίκτυον
div1.sense: a casting-net, a net, Od., Aesch.: a hunting-net, Hdt., Ar.:—metaph., δ. ἄτης, Ἅιδου Aesch.

div1.head: δικτυόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be caught in a net, Babr.

div1.head: δίκτυς
div1.sense: an unknown Libyan animal, Hdt.

div1.head: δικωπία
div1.sense: a pair of sculls, Luc.

div1.head: δίκωπος
div1.sense: two-oared, σκάφος Eur.

div1.head: διλογέω
div1.sense: to say again, repeat, Xen.

div1.head: διλογία
div1.sense: repetition, Xen.

div1.head: δίλογος
div1.sense: double-tongued, doubtful, NTest.

div1.head: δίλογχος
div1.sense: double-pointed, two-fold, Aesch.

div1.head: δίλοφος
div1.sense: double-crested, of Parnassus, Soph.

div1.head: διμναῖος
div1.sense: worth or costing two minae, διμναίους ἀποτιμήσασθαι to value at two minae, Hdt.

div1.head: διμοιρία
div1.sense: a double share, Xen.: double pay, Xen.

div1.head: δίμοιρος
div1.sense: divided in two, double, Aesch.

div1.head: δίνευμα
div1.sense: a whirling round, in dancing, Xen.

div1.head: δινεύω
div1.sense: to whirl or twirl round, or spin round, Hom.: to drive round a circle, Il.:—Pass. to whirl or roll about, Hom.: of a river, to eddy, Eur.: to whirl round in the dance, Xen.
Pass., also, to roam about, Lat. versari, Od.
intr. in Act., just like Pass. to whirl about, of dancers or tumblers, Il.; of a pigeon circling in its flight, Il.; generally, to roam about, Hom.; δινεύειν βλεφάροις to look wildly about, Eur.

div1.head: δινήεις
div1.sense: whirling, eddying, Hom.
rounded, Mosch.

div1.head: δίνη
div1.sense: a whirlpool, eddy, Lat. vortex, Il., etc.
a whirlwind, Ar.
generally, a whirling, rotation, Ar., Plat.: metaph., ἀνάγκης δίναι Aesch.

div1.head: δινητός
div1.sense: whirled round, Anth.

div1.head: δῖνος
div1.sense: a whirling, rotation, Ar.
a round area, where oxen trod out the corn, a threshing-floor, Xen.
a large round goblet, Ar.

div1.head: δινώδης
div1.sense: eddying; τὰ δινώδη eddies, Plut.

div1.head: δίνω
div1.sense: to thresh out on the δῖνος (II),Hes.

div1.head: δινωτός
div1.sense: turned, rounded, Hom.; νώροπι χαλκῷ δινωτήν [sc. ἀσπίδα covered all round with brazen plates, Il.

div1.head: Διόβολος
div1.sense: hurled by Zeus, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: Διογενέτωρ
div1.sense: giving birth to Zeus, Eur.

div1.head: διογενής
div1.sense: sprung from Zeus, of kings and princes, ordained and upheld by Zeus, Hom.; of gods, Trag.

div1.head: διοδεύω
div1.sense: to travel through, c. acc., Plut.

div1.head: δίοδος
div1.sense: a way through, thoroughfare, passage, Hdt., etc.; ἄστρων δίοδοι their pathways, Aesch.; δ. αἰτεῖσθαι, to demand a passport or safe-conduct, Ar.

div1.head: Διόθεν
div1.sense: adv. sent from Zeus, by his will or favour, Il., Trag.

div1.head: διοίγνυμι
div1.sense: to open, Ar., Soph., Eur.

div1.head: δίοιδα
div1.sense: to know the difference between, to distinguish, Eur., etc.: to decide, Soph.

div1.head: διοικέω
div1.sense: properly to manage a house: then generally, to manage, control, govern, administer, τὴν πόλιν Thuc., etc.; esp. of financial matters, Dem.:—Mid. to manage after oneʼs own will and pleasure, τὰ πράγματα Dem.; perf. pass. (in same sense), Dem.
to provide, furnish, Dem.
to inhabit distinct places, Plat.:— Mid. to live apart, Xen.

div1.head: διοίκησις
div1.sense: government, administration, τῆς πόλεως Plat., etc.; esp. the treasury-department, Dem.; ὁ ἐπὶ τῆς διοικήσεως the controller, treasurer, ap. Dem.
one of the lesser Roman provinces, Cic.
as an Eccles. division, a diocese.

div1.head: διοικίζω
div1.sense: to cause to live apart, Dem.: —Pass., Xen.

div1.head: διοικισμός
div1.sense: a dispersion, Plut.

div1.head: διοικοδομέω
div1.sense: to build across, wall off, Thuc.

div1.head: διοιστέος
div1.sense: one must move round, Eur.

div1.head: διοϊστεύω
div1.sense: to shoot an arrow through, c. gen., Od.
absol., καί κεν διοϊστεύσειας thou mightest reach it with an arrow, i. e. but a bow-shot off, Od.

div1.head: διοιχνέω
div1.sense: to go through, c. acc., Aesch.
absol. to wander about, Hhymn.

div1.head: διοίχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to be quite gone by, of time, Hdt.: of persons, to be clean gone, to have perished, Lat. periisse, Soph., Eur.
to be gone through, ended, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: διοκωχή
div1.sense: a cessation, Thuc.

div1.head: διολισθάνω
div1.sense: to slip through, to give one the slip, c. acc., Ar.: absol. to slip away, Luc.

div1.head: διόλλυμι
div1.sense: to destroy utterly, bring to naught, Soph., Plat., etc.:—Pass., with fut. -ολοῦμαι, perf. -όλωλα, to perish utterly, come to naught, Trag., Thuc.
to blot out of oneʼs mind, forget, Soph.

div1.head: διομαλίζω
div1.sense: to be always evenminded, Plut.

div1.head: Διομειαλαζών
div1.sense: a braggart of the deme Diomeia, Ar.

div1.head: Διομήδειος
div1.sense: of or like Diomedes, ἡ Διομήδεια λεγομένη ἀνάγκη, i. e. absolute, fatal necessity, Plat.

div1.head: Διομήδης
div1.sense: Jove-counselled; in Hom. as prop. n. Diomedes.

div1.head: διόμνυμι
div1.sense: to swear solemnly, to declare on oath that . . , c. inf. fut., Soph.:—Mid. διόμνυμαι, fut. -ομοῦμαι, Soph., Plat., etc.; διομνύμενος on oath, Dem.

div1.head: διομολογέω
div1.sense: to make an agreement, undertake, Xen.:—Pass. to be agreed on, Plat.:—Mid. to agree mutually, to agree upon certain points, take as granted, concede, δ. τι εἶναι Plat.; περί τινος Plat.

div1.head: διομολόγησις
div1.sense: a convention, Polyb.

div1.head: διομολογητέος
div1.sense: one must concede, Plat.

div1.head: διονομάζω
div1.sense: to distinguish by a name, Plat.
Pass. to be widely known, Isocr.

div1.head: Διονυσιάζω
div1.sense: to keep the Dionysia: hence to live extravagantly, Luc.

div1.head: Διονυσιακός
div1.sense: belonging to Dionysus, Thuc., Arist.

div1.head: Διονύσια
div1.sense: sc. ἱερά, τά the feast of Dionysus or Bacchus at Athens, of which there were four: viz.
τὰ κατʼ ἀγρούς or τὰ μικρά, in Poseideon (December).
τὰ ἐν Λίμναις or τὰ Λήναια (in the suburb Λίμναι, where the Λήναιον stood), in Gamelion (January).
τὰ Ἀνθεστήρια in Anthesterion (February).
τὰ ἀστικά or τὰ κατʼ ἄστυ, also called τὰ μέγαλα or simply τὰ Διονύσια, in Elaphebolion (March), when Athens was full of strangers, and new Dramas were performed.

div1.head: Διόνυσος
div1.sense: Dionysus, Od., etc.: v. Βάκχος.

div1.head: Διόπαις
div1.sense: son of Zeus, Anth.

div1.head: διόπερ
div1.sense: διʼ ὅπερ, = διό, Thuc.

div1.head: Διοπετής
div1.sense: that fell from Zeus, Eur.

div1.head: διοπεύω
div1.sense: to be in charge of a ship, ap. Dem.

div1.head: δίοπος
div1.sense: a ruler, commander, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: διοπτεύω
div1.sense: to watch accurately, spy about, Il.: to look into, στέγος Soph.

div1.head: διοπτήρ
div1.sense: a spy, scout, Il.

div1.head: διόπτης
div1.sense: a looker through, ὦ Ζεῦ διόπτα. says Dicaeopolis, holding up a ragged garment to the light, Ar.
= διοπτήρ., Eur.

div1.head: διόπτρα
div1.sense: an instrument for measuring heights, a Jacobʼs staff, Polyb.

div1.head: διοπτρικός
div1.sense: of, belonging to the use of the διόπτρα, Strab.

div1.head: διοράω
div1.sense: to see through, see clearly, Xen.
Aor. διεῖδον to see thoroughly, discern, Ar., Plat.; διιδεῖν περί τινος Plat.

div1.head: διό
div1.sense: Conjunct., for διʼ ὅ wherefore, on which account, Lat. quapropter, quocirca, quare, Thuc., Plat., etc.

div1.head: διόργυιος
div1.sense: two fathoms long, high, Hdt.

div1.head: διορθεύω
div1.sense: to judge rightly, Eur.

div1.head: διορθόω
div1.sense: to make quite straight, set right, amend, δ. ἔριν to make up a quarrel, Eur.:—Mid. to amend for oneself, διορθοῦσθαι περί τινος to take full security for . . , Dem.

div1.head: διόρθωμα
div1.sense: a making straight, amendment, Plut.

div1.head: διόρθωσις
div1.sense: a making straight, restoration, reform, Arist.

div1.head: διορθωτής
div1.sense: a corrector, reformer, Plut.

div1.head: διορίζω
div1.sense: to draw a boundary through, divide by limits, separate, Hdt., Plat.
to distinguish, determine, define, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
to determine, declare, Soph.; c. inf. to determine one to be so and so, Dem.; with inf. omitted, μικρὸν καὶ μέγαν διώρισαν με Soph.:—Mid., with perf. pass. in mid. sense, Dem.
absol. to draw distinction, lay down definitions, Dem.:—so in Mid., Ar., etc.
to remove across the frontier, to banish, Eur., Plat.: generally, to carry abroad, Eur.; δ. πόδα to depart, Eur.

div1.head: διόρισις
div1.sense: distinction, Plat.

div1.head: διόρυγμα
div1.sense: a through-cut, canal, Thuc.

div1.head: διορύσσω
div1.sense: to dig through or across, τάφρον Od.; τοῖχον δ. τοιχωρυχέω, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: διορχέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to dance a match with one, τινί Ar.

div1.head: Διόσδοτος
div1.sense: given by Zeus, Aesch.

div1.head: Διοσημία
div1.sense: a sign from Zeus, an omen from the sky, of a sudden storm, Ar.

div1.head: Διοσκόρειον
div1.sense: the temple of the Dioscuri, Thuc.

div1.head: Διόσκοροι
div1.sense: the sons of Zeus and Leda, Castor and Pollux, Hhymn.
the constellation named from them, the Twins, Lat. Gemini, Luc.

div1.head: δῖος
div1.sense: god-like, divine, Il.; δῖα γυναικῶν noblest of women, Od.:—also worthy, trusty, the swineherd, Od.; of whole nations or cities, Hom.; of a noble horse, Il.
of things, like θεῖος, θεσπέσιος, ἱερός, divine, wondrous, Hom.
in literal sense, of or from Zeus, Aesch.

div1.head: διότι
div1.sense: Conjunct. for διὰ τοῦτο ὅτι, for the reason that, since, Hdt., etc.
indirect, wherefore, for what reason, μανθάνειν διότι Hdt.
= ὅτι, that, Hdt., Dem.

div1.head: Διοτρεφής
div1.sense: cherished by Zeus, of kings and nobles, Hom.

div1.head: διοχετεύω
div1.sense: Pass. to be watered by canals (ὀχετοί) , Strab.

div1.head: διοχλέω
div1.sense: to trouble or annoy exceedingly, Dem.

div1.head: δίπαις
div1.sense: with two children, Aesch.
δ. θρῆνος a dirge chanted by oneʼs two children, Aesch.

div1.head: διπάλαιστος
div1.sense: two palms broad, Xen.

div1.head: δίπαλτος
div1.sense: brandished with both hands, two-handed, Eur.: —δίπαλτος ἄν με φονεύοι would kill me each with two spears, Soph.

div1.head: δίπηχυς
div1.sense: two cubits long, broad, etc., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: διπλάδιος
div1.sense: double, poet. for διπλάσιος, Anth.

div1.head: διπλάζω
div1.sense: to double, Eur.
intr., τὸ δίπλαζον κακόν the twofold evil, Soph.

div1.head: δίπλαξ
div1.sense: twofold, double, in double folds, Il.
as Subst., δίπλαξ, a double-folded mantle, Hom.
in pl. ship-planks (doubled one over the one below), Aesch.

div1.head: διπλασιάζω
div1.sense: to double, Xen.

div1.head: διπλασιόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to become twofold, Thuc.

div1.head: διπλάσιος
div1.sense: twofold, double, twice as much as, twice as many as, as long as, etc., Hdt., etc.; as comp. foll. by ἤ . . , Hdt.; or c. gen. twice the size of, Hdt.
as Subst., διπλάσιον, ου, τό, as much again, Lat. duplum, Hdt.
διπλασίαν (sc. ζημίαν) , ap. Dem.
adv. -ως, doubly, Thuc., Aeschin.

div1.head: δίπλεθρος
div1.sense: two πλέθρα long or broad, Luc.

div1.head: διπλῇ
div1.sense: twice, twice over, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: διπλοΐς
div1.sense: a double cloak, like δίπλαξ, Anth.

div1.head: διπλόος
div1.note: η ον; διπλός, η ον Anth. NTest.
div1.sense: twofold, double, Lat. duplex, of a cloak, Hom.; ὅθι διπλόος ἤντετο θώρηξ where the cuirass met [the buckle] so as to be double, Il.:— παῖσον διπλῆν (sc. πληγήν) , Soph.; διπλῆ ἄκανθα spine bent double by age, Eur.; διπλῇ χερί by mutual slaughter, Soph.
in pl., = δύο, Aesch., Soph.
double-minded, treacherous, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: διπλόω
div1.sense: to double, Xen.:—Pass., of a sword, to be bent double, Plut.
to repay twofold, NTest. Hence

div1.head: δίπλωμα
div1.sense: a doubled or folded paper, a letter of recommendation, diploma, Cic., Plut.

div1.head: δίπλωσις
div1.sense: a compounding of words, Arist.

div1.head: διπόδης
div1.sense: two feet long, broad, etc., Xen.

div1.head: Διπολίεια
div1.sense: an ancient festival of Zeus at Athens, Ar.

div1.head: Διπολιώδης
div1.sense: like the Διπόλια, i. e. obsolete, out of date, Ar.

div1.head: δίπορος
div1.sense: with two roads or openings, Eur.

div1.head: διπόταμος
div1.sense: between two rivers, Eur.

div1.head: δίπους
div1.sense: two-footed, Lat. bipes, Aesch., Plat., etc.
δίπους, the jerboa, which springs from its two hind feet, like the kangaroo, Hdt.
two feet long, Lat. bipedalis, Plat.

div1.head: δίπτυχος
div1.sense: double-folded, doubled, Od.; δ. δελτίον a pair of tablets, Hdt.:—neut. pl. as adv., δίπτυχα ποιήσαντες τὴν κνῖσαν, having doubled the fat, i. e. putting one layer of fat under the thighs (μηροί) and another over them, Il.,
twofold, Lat. geminus, Eur.: and in pl. = δισσοί, two, Eur.

div1.head: δίπυλος
div1.sense: double-gated, with two entrances, Soph.
δίπυλον, ου, τό, a gate at Athens, Plut.

div1.head: δίπυρος
div1.sense: with double flame, Ar.

div1.head: δίρρυμος
div1.sense: with two poles, i. e. three horses, Aesch.

div1.head: δίσαβος
div1.sense: twice young, Anth.

div1.head: δίσευνος
div1.sense: with two wives, Anth.

div1.head: δισθανής
div1.sense: twice dead, Od.

div1.head: δισκεύω
div1.sense: Pass. to be pitched, Eur.

div1.head: δισκέω
div1.sense: to pitch the quoit (δίσκος) , play at quoits, Od.:—Pass. to be pitched, Anth.

div1.head: δίσκημα
div1.sense: a thing thrown, Eur.

div1.head: δίσκηπτρος
div1.sense: two-sceptred, Aesch.

div1.head: δισκοβόλος
div1.sense: the quoit-thrower, a famous statue by Myron, Luc.

div1.head: δίσκος
div1.sense: a sort of quoit, made of stone, Od.
anything quoit-shaped, a trencher, Anth.:— a mirror, Anth.

div1.head: δίσκουρα
div1.sense: a quoitʼs cast, as a measure of distance, Il.

div1.head: δισκοφόρος
div1.sense: bringing the discus, Luc.

div1.head: δισμύριοι
div1.sense: twenty thousand, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: -δις
div1.sense: inseparable Suffix, signifying motion to a place, like -δε, as in ἄλλυδις, οἴκαδις, χαμάδις

div1.head: Δίς
div1.sense: an old nom. for Ζεύς which appears in the oblique cases Διός, Διΐ, Δία, and Lat. Dis, Dies-piter, Djovis.

div1.head: δίς
div1.sense: twice, doubly, Lat. bis, Od., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: δισσάρχης
div1.sense: joint-ruling, Soph.

div1.head: δισσός
div1.sense: two-fold, double, Hdt.
in pl. two, Hdt., Trag., etc.
metaph. double, divided, doubtful, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: διστάζω
div1.sense: to be in doubt, hesitate, Plat.

div1.head: δίστιχος
div1.sense: of two verses, Anth.
as Subst., δίστιχον, ου, τό, a distich, Anth.

div1.head: δίστολος
div1.sense: in pairs, two together, Soph.

div1.head: δίστομος
div1.sense: double-mouthed, with two entrances, Soph.; δίστομοι ὁδοί branching roads, Soph.
of a weapon, two-edged, Eur.

div1.head: δισύλλαβος
div1.sense: of two syllables, Luc.

div1.head: δισχίλιοι
div1.sense: two thousand, Hdt.:—sg. with collective nouns, δισχιλίη ἵππος 2000 horse, Hdt.

div1.head: διτάλαντος
div1.sense: worth or weighing two talents, Hdt.: costing two talents, Dem.

div1.head: διυλίζω
div1.sense: to strain off, τι NTest.

div1.head: διυπνίζω
div1.sense: to awake from sleep, Luc.

div1.head: διυφαίνω
div1.sense: to fill up by weaving, Luc.

div1.head: διφάσιος
div1.sense: two-fold, double, Lat. bifarius, Hdt.
in pl. = δύο, Hdt.

div1.head: διφάω
div1.sense: to search after, Il., Hes.:—Ionic διφέω Anth.

div1.head: διφήτωρ
div1.sense: a searcher, χρυσοῦ after gold, Anth.

div1.head: διφθέρα
div1.sense: a prepared hide, tanned skin, piece of leather, Hdt.; opp. to δέρρις (an undressed hide), Thuc.:— διφθέραι were used for writing-material in ancient times, before papyrus came in, Hdt.
a leathern garment such as peasants wore, Ar., Plat.
a wallet, bag, Xen.
in pl. skins used as tents, Xen.

div1.head: διφθερίας
div1.sense: one clad in leather, Luc.

div1.head: διφθέρινος
div1.sense: of tanned leather, Xen.

div1.head: δίφραξ
div1.sense: a seat, chair, Theocr.

div1.head: διφρεία
div1.sense: chariot-driving, Xen.

div1.head: διφρευτής
div1.sense: a charioteer, Soph.

div1.head: διφρεύω
div1.sense: to drive a chariot, Eur.; αἴγλαν ἐδίφρευε drove his beaming car, Eur.

div1.head: διφρηλατέω
div1.sense: to drive a chariot through, τὸν οὐρανόν, of the Sun, Soph.

div1.head: διφρηλάτης
div1.sense: a charioteer, Trag.

div1.head: δίφριος
div1.sense: of a chariot: neut. pl. as adv., δίφρια συρόμενος dragged at the chariot wheels, Anth.

div1.head: δίφροντις
div1.sense: divided in mind, distraught, Aesch.

div1.head: δίφρος
div1.sense: the chariot-board, on which two could stand, the drive (ἡνίοχος) and the combatant (παραιβάτης) , Hom.
the war-chariot itself, Il.:—in Od. a travelling-chariot.
a seat, chair, stool, Hom., Attic

div1.head: διφρουλκέω
div1.sense: to draw a chariot, Anth.

div1.head: διφροφορέω
div1.sense: to carry in a chair or litter:— Pass. to travel in one, Hdt.
to carry a campstool, Ar.

div1.head: διφροφόρος
div1.sense: carrying a camp-stool; of the female μέτοικοι, who carried seats for the κανηφόροι, Ar.
carrying another upon a δίφρος, Plut.

div1.head: διφυής
div1.sense: of double form, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: διχάζω
div1.sense: to divide in two, Plat.: δ. τινὰ κατά τινος to divide one against another, NTest.

div1.head: δίχαλκον
div1.sense: a double chalcos, = 1/4 of an obol, Anth.

div1.head: δίχα
div1.sense: adv. in two, asunder, Od., etc.:—generally, apart, aloof, Hdt., etc.
metaph. in two ways, at variance or in doubt, Hom., etc.
prep. with gen. apart from, Aesch., Soph.:— differently from, unlike, Soph.; τοῦ ἑτέρου from the other, Thuc.
πόλεως δ. against the will of, Soph.
besides, except, like χωρίς, Aesch.

div1.head: διχαστής
div1.sense: a divider, Arist.

div1.head: δίχηλος
div1.sense: cloven-hoofed, Hdt., Eur.
δίχηλον, ου, τό, a forceps, pincers, Anth.

div1.head: διχῆ
div1.sense: in two, asunder, Aesch., Plat., etc.
in two ways, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: διχήρης
div1.sense: dividing the month in twain, c. gen., of the moon, Eur.

div1.head: διχθάδιος
div1.sense: twofold, double, divided, Il.

div1.head: διχθά
div1.sense: δ. δεδαίαται they are parted in twain, Od.; δ. κραδίη μέμονε my heart is divided, Il.

div1.head: διχογνωμονέω
div1.sense: to differ in opinion, Xen.

div1.head: διχογνώμων
div1.sense: divided between two opinions, Plut.

div1.head: διχόθεν
div1.sense: adv. from both sides, both ways, Aesch., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: διχοίνικος
div1.sense: holding 2 χοίνικες, near 3 pints, Ar.

div1.head: διχομηνία
div1.sense: the fullness of the moon, Plut.

div1.head: διχόμηνος
div1.sense: dividing the month, i. e. at or of the full moon, Hhymn., Plut.

div1.head: διχόμυθος
div1.sense: double-speaking, λέγειν διχόμυθα to speak ambiguously, Eur.

div1.head: διχόνοια
div1.sense: discord, disagreement, Plat.

div1.head: διχορραγής
div1.sense: broken in twain, Eur.

div1.head: διχόρροπος
div1.sense: oscillating: adv. -πως, waveringly, doubtfully, Aesch.

div1.head: διχοστασία
div1.sense: a standing apart, dissension, Hdt.: sedition, Solon, Theogn.

div1.head: διχοστατέω
div1.sense: to stand apart, disagree, Aesch.; πρός τινα Eur.

div1.head: διχοτομέω
div1.sense: to cut in two, cut in twain, Plat., NTest.

div1.head: διχότομος
div1.sense: cut in half, divided equally, Arist.

div1.head: διχόφρων
div1.sense: at variance, discordant, Aesch.

div1.head: δίχρωμος
div1.sense: two-coloured, Luc.

div1.head: διχῶς
div1.sense: adv. doubly, in two ways, Aesch.

div1.head: διψαλέος
div1.sense: thirsty, Batr.

div1.head: δίψα
div1.sense: thirst, Il., etc.; ποτοῦ for drink, Plat.

div1.head: διψάω
div1.sense: to thirst, διψάων [ᾱ] Od.; of the ground, to be thirsty, parched, Hdt.
metaph. to thirst after a thing, c. gen., Plat.: later c. acc., Anth., NTest.; c. inf. to long to do, Xen.

div1.head: δίψιος
div1.sense: thirsty, athirst, and of things, thirsty, dry, parched, Trag.

div1.head: δίψυχος
div1.sense: double-minded, NTest.

div1.head: διωβελία
div1.sense: at Athens, the allowance of two obols to each citizen during the festivals, to pay for their seats in the theatre, Xen.

div1.head: δίωγμα
div1.sense: a pursuit, chase, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: διωγμός
div1.sense: the chase, Xen.
pursuit, persecution, harassing, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: διώδυνος
div1.sense: with thrilling anguish, Soph.

div1.head: διωθέω
div1.sense: to push asunder, tear away, Il., Eur.
to thrust through, Plut.
Mid. to push asunder for oneself, force oneʼs way through, break through, c. acc., Hdt., Xen.
to push from oneself, push one another away, of seamen keeping ships from collision, Thuc.:— to drive back, repel, repulse, Hdt., Eur.:—absol. to get rid of danger, Hdt.
to reject, Lat. respuere, Hdt., Thuc.:—absol. to refuse, Hdt.

div1.head: διωθισμός
div1.sense: a pushing about, a scuffle, Plat.

div1.head: διωκτέος
div1.sense: to be pursued, Hdt., Ar.
διωκτέον, one must pursue, Plat.

div1.head: διωκτήρ
div1.sense: a pursuer, Babr.

div1.head: διώκω
div1.sense: to pursue aperson, to chase, hunt, Il., etc.:—so in Mid., διώκεσθαί τινα πεδίοιο to chase one over or across the plain, Hom.: — to be a follower of a person, attach oneself to him, Xen.
to pursue an object, seek after, Od., etc.; δ. τὰ συμβάντα to follow or wait for the event, Dem.
to drive or chase away, banish, Od., Hdt.

of the wind, to drive a ship, of rowers, to impel, speed on her way, Od.; of a chariot, to drive, Orac. ap. Hdt.; δ. πόδα to urge on, Aesch.:—then, intr. to drive, drive on, Il.: to gallop, speed, run, Aesch.

as law-term, to prosecute, bring an action against a man, ὁ διώκων the prosecutor (opp. to ὁ φεύγων the defendant), Hdt., etc.; ὁ διώκων τοῦ ψηφίσματος he who impeaches the words of the decree, Dem.; c. gen. poenae, θανάτου or περὶ θανάτου δ. τινά, Lat. capitis accusare, Xen.: but c. gen. criminis, to accuse of, to prosecute for, δ. τινὰ τυραννίδος Hdt.; δειλίας Ar.; φόνου Plat.; but, φόνον τινὸς δ. to avenge anotherʼs murder, Eur.

div1.head: διωλένιος
div1.sense: with out-stretched arms, Anth.

div1.head: διωλύγιος
div1.sense: far-sounding, enormous, immense, Plat.

div1.head: διωμοσία
div1.sense: an oath taken by both parties before the trial came on, Oratt.

div1.head: διώμοτος
div1.sense: bound by oath, Lat. juratus, c. inf., Soph.

div1.head: διώνυμος
div1.sense: with two names, or, of two persons, named together, Eur.
(διά) far-famed, Plut.

div1.head: διωξικέλευθος
div1.sense: urging on the way, Anth.

div1.head: διώξιππος
div1.sense: horse-driving, Anth.

div1.head: δίωξις
div1.sense: chase, pursuit, of persons, Thuc.
pursuit of an object, Plat.
as law-term, prosecution, Dem., etc.

div1.head: δίω
div1.sense: to run away, take to flight, flee, like δίεμαι Il.
to be afraid, δίε ποιμένι λαῶν μήτι πάθηι Il.
Causal in Mid., subj. δίωμαι, δίηται, δίωνται, opt. δίοιτο, inf. δίεσθαι, to drive away, chase, put to flight, Hom., Aesch.:—simply to drive horses, Il.
to pursue, give chase, ἐπί τινα Aesch.: δ. λάχος to pursue, discharge an office, Aesch.

div1.head: διῶρυξ
div1.sense: a trench, conduit, canal, Hdt., Thuc.; κρυπτὴ δ. an underground passage, Hdt.

div1.head: διωρυχή
div1.sense: a digging through, Dem.

div1.head: δίωσις
div1.sense: a pushing off, delaying, Arist.

div1.head: δίωτος
div1.sense: two-eared: two handled, Plat.

div1.head: δμῆσις
div1.sense: a taming, breaking, ἵππων Il.

div1.head: δμητήρ
div1.sense: a tamer, ἵππων Hhymn.:— fem., νὺξ δμητεῖρα θεῶν Il.

div1.head: δμωή
div1.sense: a female slave taken in war, Il.:— then, generally, a female slave, serving-woman, Lat. ancilla, Hom., Trag.

div1.head: δμώϊος
div1.sense: in servile condition, βρέφος Anth.

div1.head: δμώς
div1.sense: a slave taken in war, Od.:— then, generally, a slave, Od., Soph., Eur.; Epic dat. pl. δμώεσσι Od.

div1.head: δνοπαλίζω
div1.sense: to shake violently, fling down, Il.; τὰ σὰ ῥάκεα δνοπαλίξεις "wrap thy old cloak about thee, " Od.

div1.head: δνοφερός
div1.sense: dark, dusk, murky, Hom., Trag.

div1.head: δνόφος
div1.sense: darkness, dusk, gloom, Simon., Aesch.

div1.head: δοάσσατο
div1.sense: it seemed, Hom.; ὡς ἄν σοι πλήμνη δοάσσεται ἱκέσθαι (Epic subj. for -htai) till the nave appear to graze, Il.: cf. δέατο.

div1.head: δόγμα
div1.sense: that which seems to one, an opinion, dogma, Plat.
a public decree, ordinance, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: δογματίζω
div1.sense: to decree, δ. τινὰ καλήν to declare her beautiful, Anth.
in Pass., of persons, to submit to ordinances, NTest.

div1.head: δοθιήν
div1.sense: a small abscess, boil, Ar.

div1.head: δοιδυκοποιός
div1.sense: a pestle-maker, Plut.

div1.head: δοῖδυξ
div1.sense: a pestle, Ar., etc.

div1.head: δοιή
div1.sense: doubt, perplexity, ἐν δοιῇ Il.

div1.head: δοιοί
div1.sense: two, both, Il., Hes., etc.: neut. δοιά as adv. in two ways, in two points, Od.
two-fold, double, Anth.

div1.head: δοιοτόκος
div1.sense: bearing twins, Anth.

div1.head: δοιώ
div1.sense: = δοιοί, of which it is properly the dual, = δύο, indecl., Hom.

div1.head: δοκεύω
div1.sense: to keep an eye upon, watch narrowly, Il., Pind., Eur.

div1.head: δοκέω
div1.sense: = videor mihi, to think, suppose, imagine, expect, c. acc. et inf., δοκέω νικησέμεν Il.; οὔ σε δοκέω πείθεσθαι Hdt.; τεκεῖν δράκοντʼ ἔδοξεν she thought a serpent bare young ones, Aesch.; ἔδοξα ἰδεῖν, Lat. visus sum videre, methought I saw, Eur.; ἀείδειν δοκῶ I think to sing, Aesch.
absol. to have or form an opinion, περί τινος Hdt.; in parenthetic phrases, ὡς δοκῶ Trag.; πῶς δοκεῖς; how think you? Eur.
δοκῶ μοι in Attic, just like δοκεῖ μοι, as Lat. videor mihi for videtur mihi, I seem to myself, methinks, c. inf., Hdt., etc.; also, I am determined, resolved, c. inf., Ar.
c. inf., also, to seem or pretend to be doing, Lat. simulo, or with a negat. to seem or pretend not to be doing, Lat. dissimulo; ἤκουσά του λέγοντος, οὐ δοκῶν κλύειν Eur.
= videor, to seem to one, δοκέεις δέ μοι οὐκ ἀπινύσσειν Od., etc.
absol. to seem, as opp. to reality, οὐ δοκεῖν, ἀλλʼ εἶναι θέλει Aesch.
to seem good, Lat. placere, εἰ δοκεῖ σοι ταῦτα Aesch.

impers., δοκεῖ μοι much in the same sense as δοκῶ μοι (supr. I. 3), it seems to me, meseems, methinks, ὥς μοι δοκεῖ εἶναι ἄριστα Il., etc.:—in decrees and the like, ἔδοξε τῆι βουλῆι, placuit senatui, Ar., Thuc., etc.; τὸ δόξαν the decree, Hdt.; τὰ δόξαντα Soph.; παρὰ τὸ δοκοῦν ἡμῖν Thuc.:—so in Pass., δέδοκται, Lat. visum est, Hdt., Trag., etc.
acc. absol. δόξαν, when it was decreed or resolved, δόξαν αὐτοῖς ὥστε διαναυμαχεῖν (i. e. ὅτε ἔδοξεν αὐτοῖς) Thuc.; so, δεδογμένον αὐτοῖς Thuc.

to be thought or reputed so and so, ἄξιοι δοκοῦντες Thuc.; οἱ δοκοῦντες εἶναί τι men who are held to be something, men of repute, Plat.; so οἱ δοκοῦντες alone, Eur.; τὰ δοκοῦντα, opp. to τὰ μηδὲν ὄντα, Eur.; also in Pass., οἱ δεδογμένοι ἀνδροφόνοι those who have been found guilty of homicide, Dem.

div1.head: δόκημα
div1.sense: a vision, fancy, Eur.; οἱ δοκήμασιν σοφοί the wise in appearance, Eur.
opinion, expectation, Eur.

div1.head: δοκή
div1.sense: a vision, fancy, Aesch.

div1.head: δοκησίσοφος
div1.sense: wise in oneʼs own conceit, Ar.

div1.head: δόκησις
div1.sense: an opinion, belief, conceit, fancy, Hdt., Soph.; δ. ἀγνὼς λόγων ἦλθε a vague suspicion was thrown out, Soph.
an apparition, phantom, Eur.
good report, credit, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: δοκιμάζω
div1.sense: to assay or test metals, to see if they be pure, Isocr., etc.
of persons, to put to the test, make trial of, scrutinise, Hdt., Thuc.: —then, to approve, Thuc., Plat., etc.; c. inf., ἐκπονεῖν ἐδοκίμαζε he approved of their working, Xen.
at Athens, to approve as fit for an office, and in Pass. to be approved as fit, Plat., etc.; c. inf., ἱππεύειν δεδοκιμασμένος Xen.
to examine and admit boys to the class of ἔφηβοι or ἔφηβοι to the rights of manhood; and in Pass. to be so admitted, Ar., etc.; ἕως ἀνὴρ εἶναι δοκιμασθείην Dem.
c. inf. to think fit to do, or with negat. to refuse to do, NTest.

div1.head: δοκιμασία
div1.sense: an assay, examination, scrutiny:
of magistrates, to see if they fulfil the legal requirements, Plat., etc.
δ. τῶν ἐφήβων, before admission to the rights of manhood, Dem.
δ. τῶν ῥητόρων, a process to determine the right to speak in the ἐκκλησία or law-courts, Aeschin.

div1.head: δοκιμαστής
div1.sense: an assayer, scrutineer, Plat., Dem.
an approver, panegyrist, Dem.

div1.head: δοκιμεῖον
div1.sense: a test, means of testing, Plat., NTest.

div1.head: δοκιμή
div1.sense: a proof, test: tried character, NTest.

div1.head: δόκιμος
div1.sense: assayed, examined, tested, properly of metals, Dem.
generally,
of persons, approved, esteemed, notable, Lat. probus, Hdt.; δοκιμώτατος Ἑλλάδι most approved by Hellas, Eur.
of things, excellent, notable, considerable, Hdt.
adv. -μως, really, truly, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: δοκός
div1.sense: a bearing-beam, in the roof or floor of a house, Od.: generally, a balk or beam, Il., Thuc.: the bar of a gate or door, Ar.

div1.head: δολερός
div1.sense: deceitful, deceptive, treacherous, Hdt., Soph., etc.

div1.head: δολιόπους
div1.sense: stealthy of foot, Soph.

div1.head: δόλιος
div1.sense: crafty, deceitful, treacherous, Od., Trag.

div1.head: δολιόφρων
div1.sense: crafty of mind, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: δολιόω
div1.sense: to deal treacherously with one, NTest.

div1.head: δολίχαυλος
div1.sense: with a long tube or socket, Od.

div1.head: δολιχεγχής
div1.sense: with tall spear, Il.

div1.head: δολιχήρετμος
div1.sense: long-oared, of a ship, Od.; of men, using long oars, Od.

div1.head: δολιχογραφία
div1.sense: prolix writing, Anth.

div1.head: δολιχόδειρος
div1.sense: long-necked, Il.

div1.head: δολιχοδρομέω
div1.sense: to run the δόλιχος, Aeschin.

div1.head: δολιχοδρόμος
div1.sense: running the long course, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: δολιχόσκιος
div1.sense: epith. of ἔγχος, casting a long shadow; or for δολιχ-όσχιος (ὄσχος) long-shafted, Il.

div1.head: δολιχός
div1.sense: long, Hom.: neut. δολιχόν as adv., Il., Plat.

div1.head: δόλιχος
div1.sense: the long course, opp. to στάδιον, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: δολόεις
div1.sense: subtle, wily, Od.
of things, craftily contrived, Eur.

div1.head: δολομήτης
div1.sense: crafty of counsel, wily, Hom.

div1.head: δολόμυθος
div1.sense: subtle-speaking, or conveyed in crafty speech, Soph.

div1.head: δολοπλοκία
div1.sense: subtlety, craft, Theogn.

div1.head: δολοπλόκος
div1.sense: weaving wiles, Sapph., Arist.

div1.head: δολοποιός
div1.sense: treacherous, ensnaring, Soph.

div1.head: δόλος
div1.sense: properly, a bait for fish, Od.: then, any cunning contrivance for deceiving or catching, as the Trojan horse, the robe of Penelope Od.:—generally, any trick or stratagem, Il.; in pl., wiles, Il.
guile, craft, cunning, treachery, Lat. dolus, Hom., Trag.

div1.head: δολοφονέω
div1.sense: to murder by treachery, Dem.

div1.head: δολοφόνος
div1.sense: slaying by treachery, Aesch.

div1.head: δολοφραδής
div1.sense: wily-minded, Hhymn.

div1.head: δολοφρονέων
div1.sense: planning craft, wily-minded, Hom.

div1.head: δολοφροσύνη
div1.sense: craft, subtlety, wiliness, Il.

div1.head: δολόω
div1.sense: to beguile, ensnare, take by craft, Hes., Hdt., Attic
to disguise, Soph.

div1.head: δόλωμα
div1.sense: a trick, deceit, Aesch.

div1.head: δόλων
div1.sense: a secret weapon, poniard, stiletto, Plut.

div1.head: δολῶπις
div1.sense: artful-looking, treacherous, Soph.

div1.head: δόλωσις
div1.sense: a tricking, Xen.

div1.head: δομαῖος
div1.sense: for building, Anth.

div1.head: δόμονδε
div1.sense: home, homeward, Hom.; ὅνδε δόμονδε to his own house, Od.

div1.head: δόμος
div1.sense: Lat. domus:
a house, Hom., etc.: also part of a house, a room, chamber, Od.:— hence in pl. for a house, Hom., Trag.
the house of a god, a temple, Hom., Trag.
of animals, a sheep-fold, Il.: a waspsʼ or beesʼ nest, Il.
κέδρινοι δόμοι a closet or chest of cedar, Eur.
the house, i. e. the household, family, Trag.:—also oneʼs fatherʼs house, Aesch.
a layer or course of stone or bricks in a building, διὰ τριήκοντα δόμων πλίνθου at every thirtieth layer of brick, Hdt.

div1.head: δομοσφαλής
div1.sense: shaking the house, Aesch.

div1.head: δονακεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to fowl with reed and birdlime, Anth.

div1.head: δονακεύς
div1.sense: a thicket of reeds, Il.
= δόναξ, Anth.

div1.head: δονακῖτις
div1.sense: of reed, Anth.

div1.head: δονακογλύφος
div1.sense: reed-cutting, pen-making, Anth.

div1.head: δονακόεις
div1.sense: reedy, Eur.; δόλος δ., of a reed covered with birdlime, Anth.

div1.head: δονακοτρόφος
div1.sense: producing reeds, Theogn.

div1.head: δονακόχλοος
div1.sense: green with reeds, Eur.

div1.head: δόναξ
div1.etym: from δονέω, "a reed shaken by the wind, " cf. ῥίψ from ῥίπτω
div1.sense: a reed, Hom.; δόνακες καλάμοιο reed- stalks, Hhymn.
anything made of reed,
the shaft of an arrow, Il.
a shepherdʼs pipe, Aesch., Theocr.
a fishing-rod or limed twig (cf. δονακόεις) , Anth.
the bridge of the lyre, Ar.

div1.head: δονέω
div1.sense: to shake, of wind, Il.; δ. γάλα to shake it, as to make butter, Hdt.
to drive about, Lat. agitare, Od., Pind.:—Pass., ἡ Ἀσίη ἐδονέετο Asia was in commotion, Hdt.; αἰθὴρ δονεῖται Ar.

div1.head: δόνημα
div1.sense: an agitation, waving, δένδρου Luc.

div1.head: δοξάζω
div1.sense: to think, imagine, suppose, fancy, conjecture, c. acc. et inf., Aesch., etc.; inf. omitted, πῶς ταῦτʼ ἀληθῆ δοξάσω; how can I suppose this to be true? Aesch.:—Pass., δοξάζεται (sc. εἶναι) is supposed to be, Plat.
c. acc. cogn., δόξαν δοξάζειν to entertain an opinion, Plat.
absol. to hold an opinion, Soph., Thuc.
to magnify, extol, Thuc.

div1.head: δόξα
div1.sense: a notion, true or false: and so,

expectation, ἀπὸ δόξης otherwise than one expects, Hom.; παρὰ δόξαν ἤ . . Hdt.; opp. to κατὰ δόξαν, Plat., etc.; ἀπὸ δόξης πεσέειν, Lat. spe excidere, Hdt.; δόξαν παρέχειν τινί to make one expect that, c. inf., Xen.
an opinion, judgment, Pind., Attic
like δόκησις, a mere opinion, conjecture, Aesch., etc.; δόξῃ ἐπίστασθαι to imagine, suppose (but wrongly), Hdt.:—also, a fancy, vision, dream, Aesch., Eur.

the opinion which others have of one, estimation, reputation, credit, honour, glory, Lat. existimatio, Solon., Aesch., etc.; δόξαν φέρεσθαι, ἔχειν Thuc., etc.; τινός for a thing, Eur.:—rarely of ill repute, Dem.
the estimate popularly formed of a thing, Dem.
of external appearance, glory, splendour, effulgence, NTest.

div1.head: δόξασμα
div1.sense: an opinion, notion, conjecture, Thuc., etc.:— a fancy, Eur.

div1.head: δοξαστός
div1.sense: matter of opinion, conjectural, Plat.

div1.head: δοξοκοπέω
div1.sense: to court popularity, Plut.

div1.head: δοξοκοπία
div1.sense: thirst for popularity, Plut.

div1.head: δοξομανία
div1.sense: mad desire for fame, Plut.

div1.head: δοξοματαιόσοφος
div1.sense: a would-be philosopher, Anth.

div1.head: δοξόομαι
div1.sense: perf. δεδόξωμαι· Pass.:— to have the character or credit of being, c. inf., Hdt.

div1.head: δοξοσοφία
div1.sense: conceit of wisdom, Plat.

div1.head: δοξόσοφος
div1.sense: wise in oneʼs own conceit, Plat.

div1.head: δορά
div1.sense: a skin, hide, Theogn., Hdt.

div1.head: δορατισμός
div1.sense: a fighting with spears, Plut.

div1.head: δορατοπαχής
div1.sense: of a spearʼs thickness, Xen.

div1.head: δορήϊος
div1.sense: wooden, Anth.

div1.head: δοριάλωτος
div1.sense: captive of the spear, taken in war, Hdt., Eur.; Ionic δουριάλωτον λέχος, of Tecmessa, Soph.

div1.head: δορίγαμβρος
div1.sense: bride of battles, i. e. causing war by marriage, or wooed by battle, of Helen, Aesch.

div1.head: δοριθήρατος
div1.sense: taken by the spear, Eur.

div1.head: δορικανής
div1.sense: slain by the spear, Aesch.

div1.head: δορίκρανος
div1.sense: spear-headed, Aesch.

div1.head: δορίκτητος
div1.sense: won by the spear, Eur.: Hom. has Ionic fem. δουρικτητή.

div1.head: δορίληπτος
div1.sense: won by the spear, Soph., Eur., δουρίληπτος, Soph.

div1.head: δοριμανής
div1.sense: raging with the spear, Eur.

div1.head: δορίμαργος
div1.sense: raging with the spear, Aesch.

div1.head: δοριμήστωρ
div1.sense: master of the spear, Eur.

div1.head: δορίπαλτος
div1.sense: wielding the spear, ἐκ χερὸς δοριπάλτου, i. e. on the right hand, Aesch.

div1.head: δοριπετής
div1.sense: fallen by the spear, Eur.

div1.head: δορίπονος
div1.sense: toiling with the spear, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: δοριπτοίητος
div1.sense: scattered by the spear, Anth.

div1.head: δορισθενής
div1.sense: mighty with the spear, Aesch.

div1.head: δοριστέφανος
div1.sense: crowned for bravery, Anth.

div1.head: δοριτίνακτος
div1.sense: shaken by battle, Aesch.

div1.head: δορίτμητος
div1.sense: pierced by the spear, Aesch.

div1.head: δορίτολμος
div1.sense: bold in war, Anth.

div1.head: δορκάδειος
div1.sense: of an antelope, Theophr.

div1.head: δορκαλίς
div1.sense: dice made of the vertebrae of an antelope, Anth.

div1.head: δορκάς
div1.sense: a kind of deer (so called from its large bright eyes), in Greece, the roe-deer, Eur., Xen.; in Syria and Africa, the gazelle, Hdt. so, δόρξ, δορκός, Eur., etc.; ζορκάς, Hdt.

div1.head: δορός
div1.sense: a leathern bag or wallet, Od.

div1.head: δορπέω
div1.sense: to take supper, Hom.

div1.head: δορπηστός
div1.sense: supper-time, evening, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: Δορπία
div1.sense: the eve of a festival, Hdt.

div1.head: δόρπον
div1.sense: in Hom. the evening meal, whether called dinner or supper, Lat. coena:—later, generally, a meal, Hhymn.

div1.head: δορυδρέπανον
div1.sense: a kind of halbert, Plat.

div1.head: δορύξενος
div1.sense: a spear-friend, i.e., properly, one who having been captive to oneʼs spear becomes oneʼs friend; then generally, a firm friend, Aesch., Soph.: as adj., δόμοι δορύξενοι Aesch.; ἑστία Soph.

div1.head: δορυξόος
div1.sense: a maker of spears, Plut., δορυξός Ar.

div1.head: δόρυ
div1.note: , τό Εpic decl. δούρατος, -ι, pl., δούρατα, δούρασι, also δουρός, -ι, du. -ε, pl δοῦρα δούρων δούρεσσι; gen.δορός, in Attic Poets,
div1.sense: a stem, tree, Od.:—commonly a plank or beam, Hom.; δόρυ νήϊον a shipʼs plank, Hom.:— hence,
a ship is called δόρυ, like Lat. trabs, Aesch., Eur.

the shaft of a spear, Il.: then, generally, a spear, pike, Hom., etc.; εἰς δόρυ ἀφικνεῖσθαι to come within a spearʼs throw, Xen.; ἐπὶ δόρυ to the spear-side, i. e. the right hand, opp. to ἐπʼ ἀσπίδα, Xen.:—also, the pole of a standard, Xen.
metaph., δουρὶ κτεατίζειν to win wealth by the spear, il.; δορὶ ἑλεῖν Thuc.; in Trag. to express an armed force.

div1.head: δορυσσόητος
div1.sense: μόχθων δορυσσοήτων, of the toils of battle, Soph.

div1.head: δορυσσόος
div1.sense: charging with the lance, Hes., Theogn., δορυσσοῦς, Soph.

div1.head: δορυφορέω
div1.sense: to attend as a bodyguard, τινα Hdt., Thuc.: generally, to keep guard over, Dem.:—Pass. to be guarded, Dem.
δ. τινι to serve as guard, Xen.

div1.head: δορυφόρημα
div1.sense: a body of guards, Luc.

div1.head: δορυφορία
div1.sense: guard kept over, τινός Xen.

div1.head: δορυφόρος
div1.sense: spear-bearing, Aesch.
as Subst. a spearman, pikeman, Xen.
δορυφόροι, οἱ, the body-guard, of kings and tyrants, Lat. satellites, Hdt., etc.:—metaph., ἡδοναὶ δ. satellite pleasures, Plat.

div1.head: δόσις
div1.sense: a giving, Hdt., etc.
a gift, Hom., etc.

div1.head: δοτέος
div1.sense: to be given, Hdt.
δοτέον, one must give, Hdt.

div1.head: δοτήρ
div1.sense: a giver, dispenser, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: δουλαγωγέω
div1.sense: to make a slave, treat as such: metaph. to bring into subjection, NTest.

div1.head: δουλεία
div1.sense: servitude, slavery, bondage, Hdt., etc.
in collect. sense, the slaves, slave-class, Hdt.

div1.head: δούλειος
div1.sense: slavish, servile, Od., Theogn., Attic

div1.head: δούλευμα
div1.sense: a service, Eur.
a slave, Soph.

div1.head: δουλευτέος
div1.sense: one must be a slave, Eur.

div1.head: δουλεύω
div1.sense: to be a slave, τινί to one, Plat., etc.; παρά τινι Dem.; c. acc. cogn., δουλείαν δ. Xen.
to serve or be subject to, opp. to ἄρχω, Hdt., etc.; τῆι γῆι δ. to be a slave to oneʼs land, i. e. submit to indignities that one may keep it, Thuc.

div1.head: δουλικός
div1.sense: of or for a slave, servile, Xen., Plat.: adv. -κῶς, Xen.

div1.head: δούλιος
div1.sense: slavish, servile, δούλιον ἦμαρ the day of slavery, Il.: δ. φρήν a slaveʼs mind, Aesch.

div1.head: δουλοπρέπεια
div1.sense: a slavish spirit, Plat.

div1.head: δουλοπρεπής
div1.sense: befitting a slave, servile, Hdt., Xen., etc.

div1.head: δοῦλος
div1.sense: properly, a born bondman or slave, opp. to one made a slave (ἀνδράποδον) , Thuc.; then, generally, a bondman, slave, Hdt.: Hom. has only the fem. δούλη, ἡ, a bondwoman:—χρημάτων δ. slave to money, Eur.
as adj., δοῦλος, η, ον, slavish, servile, subject, Soph., etc.
τὸ δοῦλον οἱ δοῦλοι, Eur.: also = δουλεία, Eur.

div1.head: δουλοσύνη
div1.sense: slavery, slavish work, Od., Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: δουλόσυνος
div1.sense: enslaved, τινι Eur.

div1.head: δουλόω
div1.sense: to make a slave of, enslave, Hdt., Attic:—Pass. to be enslaved, Hdt., Thuc.:—Mid., with perf. pass. to make oneʼs slave, make subject to oneself, enslave, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: δούλωσις
div1.sense: enslaving, subjugation, Thuc.

div1.head: δουπέω
div1.sense: to sound heavy or dead, δούπησεν πεσών with a thud he fell, Il.; δουπεῖ χεὶρ γυναικῶν falls with heavy sound upon their breast, Eur.

div1.head: δουπήτωρ
div1.sense: a clatterer, Anth.

div1.head: δοῦπος
div1.sense: any dead, heavy sound, a thud, Il.; of the distant din of battle, the sound of footsteps, of the measured tread of infantry, the hum of a multitude, the roar of the sea, Hom.: rare in Trag.
div1.etym: The form γδουπέω, connects the word with κτύπος.

div1.head: δουράτεος
div1.sense: of planks or beams of wood, ἵππος δ. the wooden horse, Od.

div1.head: δουρηνεκής
div1.sense: a spearʼs throw off or distant, only in neut. as adv., Il.

div1.head: δουρικλειτός
div1.sense: famed for the spear, Hom.

div1.head: δουρίπηκτος
div1.sense: fixed on spears, Aesch.

div1.head: δουριτυπής
div1.sense: wood-cutting, Anth.

div1.head: δουροδόκη
div1.sense: a case or stand for spears, Od.

div1.head: δουροτόμος
div1.sense: cutting wood, Anth.

div1.head: δοχεῖον
div1.sense: a holder: μέλανος δ. an ink- horn, Anth.

div1.head: δοχή
div1.sense: a receptacle, Eur.
a reception, entertainment, NTest.

div1.head: δοχμή
div1.sense: the space contained in a handʼs breadth, the same as παλαστή, Ar.

div1.head: δόχμιος
div1.sense: across, athwart, aslant, like πλάγιος, Lat. obliquus, Il., Eur.

div1.head: δοχμόλοφος
div1.sense: with slanting, nodding plume, Aesch.

div1.head: δοχμόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to turn sideways, δοχμωθείς, of a boar turning to rip up his enemy, Hes.; so of Hermes turning to dart through the key-hole, Hhymn.

div1.head: δοχμός
div1.sense: Lat. obliquus, δοχμὼ ἀΐσσοντε rushing on slantwise, Il.

div1.head: δράγμα
div1.sense: as much as one can grasp, a handful, truss of corn, Lat. manipulus, Il.:—also a sheaf, = ἄμαλλα, Xen.
uncut corn, Anth., Luc.

div1.head: δραγματηφόρος
div1.sense: carrying sheaves, Babr.

div1.head: δραγμεύω
div1.sense: to collect the corn into sheaves, Il.

div1.head: δραγμός
div1.sense: a grasping, Eur.

div1.head: δραίνω
div1.sense: to be ready to do, Il.

div1.head: δράκαινα
div1.sense: a shedragon, Hhymn., Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: δρακόντειος
div1.sense: of a dragon, Eur., Anth.

div1.head: δρακοντολέτης
div1.sense: serpent-slayer, Anth.

div1.head: δρακοντόμαλλος
div1.sense: with snaky locks, Aesch.

div1.head: δρακοντώδης
div1.sense: snake-like, Eur.

div1.head: δράκων
div1.sense: a dragon, or serpent of huge size, a python, Hom., etc.

div1.head: δρᾶμα
div1.sense: a deed, act, Aesch., Plat.
an action represented on the stage, a drama, Ar.; δρ. διδάσκειν to bring out a play, v. διδάσκω II:—metaph. stage-effect, Plat.

div1.head: δραματουργία
div1.sense: dramatic work, a drama, Luc.

div1.head: δράμημα
div1.sense: a running, course, a race, Hdt., Trag.

div1.head: δραπετεύω
div1.sense: to run away, Xen.; τινά from one, Plat.; δραπετεύσουσι ὑπὸ ταῖς ἀσπίσιν will skulk behind their shields, Xen.

div1.head: δραπέτης
div1.note: δρᾱπέτης, ου, also δρη-, Ionic; δραπετίδης, Mosch.; δραπέτις, ιδος ἡ Anth.; δραπετίσκος, ου, ὁ, diminutive Luc.
div1.sense: a runaway, Lat. fugitivus, βασιλέος from the king, Hdt.:— a runaway slave, Hdt.
as adj., runaway, fugitive, δραπέτης κλῆρος a lot of fugitive kind, i. e. crumbling clod of earth, which could not be drawn out of the urn, Soph.

div1.head: δραπετικός
div1.sense: of or for a δραπέτης, δρ. θρίαμβος a triumph over a runaway slave, Plut.

div1.head: δρασείω
div1.sense: to have a mind to do, to be going to do, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: δράσιμος
div1.sense: τὸ δρ. activity, Aesch.

div1.head: δρασμός
div1.sense: a running away, flight, Hdt., Aesch.; in pl., Eur.

div1.head: δράσσομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
Attic to grasp, c. gen. rei, κόνιος δεδραγμένος clutching a handsful of dust, Il.; so, ἐλπίδος δεδραγμένος Soph.
to lay hold of, τί μου δέδαρξαι; Eur.; δραξάμενος φάρυγος having seized [them] by the throat, Theocr.
c. acc. rei, to take by handsful, Hdt.

div1.head: δραστέος
div1.sense: to be done, Soph.
δραστέον, one must do, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: δραστήριος
div1.sense: vigorous, active, efficacious, Aesch., Eur.: τὸ δρ. activity, energy, Thuc.
in bad sense, audacious, Eur.

div1.head: δρατός
div1.etym: metath. for δαρτός, verb. adj. of δέρω,
div1.sense: skinned, flayed, Il.

div1.head: δραχμή
div1.sense: properly, a handful, like δράγμα:—an Attic weight, a drachm, weighing about 66 1/2 grains, the Aeginetan being = 2/3 Attic.
an Attic silver coin, a drachma, worth 6 obols, i. e. 9 3/4 d., nearly = Roman denarius and Fr. franc, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: δραχμιαῖος
div1.sense: worth a drachma, to the amount of a drachma, Arist.

div1.head: δράω
div1.sense: to do, esp. to do some great thing, good or bad, cf. Lat. facinus, Attic; often opp. to πάσχω, ἄξια δράσας ἄξια πάσχων Aesch.; κακῶς δράσαντες οὐκ ἐλάσσονα πάσχουσι Aesch.; proverb., "δράσαντι παθεῖν doers must suffer, Aesch.; πεπονθότα μᾶλλον ἢ δεδρακότα things of suffering rather than of doing, Soph.; so, τὸ δρῶν the doing of a thing, Soph.:— εὖ or κακῶς δρᾶν τινα to do one a good or ill turn, Theogn., Soph.

div1.head: δρεπάνη
div1.sense: a sickle, reaping-hook, Il.: a pruning-hook, Hes.

div1.head: δρεπανηφόρος
div1.sense: bearing a scythe, ἅρμα δ. a scythed car, Xen.

div1.head: δρεπανοειδής
div1.sense: sickle-shaped, Thuc.

div1.head: δρέπανον
div1.sense: a scythe, Xen.
a curved sword, scimitar, Hdt.

div1.head: δρεπανουργός
div1.sense: a sword-maker, armourer, Ar.

div1.head: δρέπτω
div1.sense: to pluck, Epic imperf. δρέπτον, Mosch.: so in Mid., Anth.

div1.head: δρέπω
div1.sense: to pluck, cull, Lat. carpo, Hdt., Eur., etc.:—metaph. to cull flowers from a field, δρ. λειμῶνα Μουσῶν, of a poet, Ar.
Mid. to pluck for oneself, cull, Od.: metaph., δρεπόμενοι τὰ μέλη Plat.; even, αἷμα δρέψασθαι to shed it, Aesch.

div1.head: δρησμοσύνη
div1.sense: Lat. cultus, Hhymn.

div1.head: δρηστήρ
div1.sense: a labourer, working man, Od.: fem. δρήστειρα, a workwoman, Od.
(διδράσκω) a runaway, Babr.: fem. δρῆστις, Anth.

div1.head: δρηστοσύνη
div1.sense: service, Od.

div1.head: δριμύλος
div1.sense: piercing, Mosch.

div1.head: δριμύς
div1.sense: piercing, sharp, keen, Lat. acer, of a dart, Il.: metaph., δριμεῖα μάχη, δριμὺς χόλος Il.; δριμὺ μένος Od.
of things which affect the eyes or taste, pungent, acrid, as smoke, Ar.; herbs, Xen.; smell, Ar.
metaph. of persons, keen, bitter, Aesch., Ar.; also keen, shrewd, Eur.:— δριμὺ βλέπειν to look bitter, Ar.

div1.head: δριμύτης
div1.sense: pungency: metaph. keenness, vehemence, Plat.

div1.head: δρίος
div1.sense: a copse, wood, thicket, δρίος ὕλης copse-wood, Od.; δρίος ὑλῆεν Anth.:—in pl. δρία, τά, (as if from δρίον) , Hes., Soph., Eur.

div1.head: δροίτη
div1.sense: a bath, Aesch.

div1.head: δρομαῖος
div1.sense: running at full speed, swift, fleet, Soph., Eur.; δρ. κάμηλος a dromedary, Plut.

div1.head: δρομάς
div1.sense: running, Eur.; ἄμπυξ δρ. the whirling wheel, Soph.; also with a neut. Noun, Eur.
like φοιτάς, wildly roaming, frantic, Eur.

div1.head: δρομάω
div1.sense: Frequent. of δραμεῖν, to run, only in perf. δεδρόμηκα, Aeolic -ᾱκα, Sapph., Babr.

div1.head: δρομεύς
div1.sense: a runner, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: δρομικός
div1.sense: good at running, swift, fleet, Plat.; τὰ δρομικὰ τοῦ πεντάθλου the race, Xen.

div1.head: δρομοκῆρυξ
div1.sense: a runner, postman, Aeschin.

div1.head: δρόμος
div1.sense: a course, running, race, Hom. (v. τείνω) [sic; τρέχω HD] ; οὐρίῳ δρόμῳ in straight course, Soph.:—of any quick movement, e. g. flight, Aesch.:—of time, ἡμέρης δρ. a dayʼs running, i. e. the distance one can go in a day, Hdt.:— δρόμῳ at a run, Hdt., Attic
the footrace:—proverb., περὶ τοῦ παντὸς δρόμον θεῖν to run for oneʼs all, Hdt.; τὸν περὶ ψυχῆς δρόμον δραμεῖν Ar.
the length of the stadium, a course or heat in a race, Soph.
a place for running, a run for cattle, Od.

a race-course, Hdt.: a public walk, Lat. ambulatio, Eur., Plat.:—proverb., ἔξω δρόμου or ἐκτὸς δρόμου φέρεσθαι, Lat. extra oleas vagari, to get off the course, i. e. wander from the point, Aesch., Plat.; ἐκ δρόμου πεσεῖν Aesch.

div1.head: δροσερός
div1.sense: dewy, watery, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: δροσίζω
div1.sense: to bedew, besprinkle, Ar.

div1.head: δρόσος
div1.sense: dew, Lat. ros, Hdt.; in pl., Aesch., etc.
pure water, Aesch., Eur.
of other liquids, δρ. φονία, of blood, Aesch.
any thing tender, like ἕρση II, the young of animals, Aesch.

div1.head: δροσώδης
div1.sense: like dew, moist, Eur.

div1.head: Δρυάς
div1.sense: a Dryad, nymph whose life was bound up with that of her tree, Plut.; cf. Ἁμαδρυάς.

div1.head: δρύϊνος
div1.sense: oaken, Od., Eur.; δρ. πῦρ a wood fire of oak-wood, Theocr.; μέλι δρ. honey from the hollow of an oak, Anth.

div1.head: δρυμός
div1.sense: an oak-coppice; and, generally, a coppice, wood, only in pl. δρυμά, Hom.; δρυμός in Soph., Eur.

div1.head: δρυοκοίτης
div1.sense: dweller on the oak, τέττιξ Anth.

div1.head: δρυοκολάπτης
div1.sense: the woodpecker, Arist. δρυκολάπτης, in Ar.

div1.head: δρύοχοι
div1.sense: the props or trestles upon which was laid the keel (τρόπις) of a new ship, Od.: metaph., δρυόχους τιθέναι δράματος to lay the keel of a new play, Ar.; ἐκ δρυόχων from the beginning, Plat.
= δρυμά, woods, Anth.

div1.head: δρύοψ
div1.sense: a kind of woodpecker, Ar.

div1.head: δρύππα
div1.sense: Lat. druppa, an over-ripe olive, Anth.

div1.head: δρύπτω
div1.sense: to tear, strip, Il.:—Mid., δρυψαμένω παρειάς tearing each otherʼs cheeks, Od.; in sign of mourning, δρύπτεσθαι παρειάν to tear oneʼs cheek, Eur.

div1.head: δρῦς
div1.sense: originally a tree (which indeed comes from the same root), commonly the oak, Lat. quercus, Hom., etc.; sacred to Zeus, who gave his oracles from the oaks of Dodona, Od.; hence, αἱ προσήγοροι δρύες, Aesch.:—proverb οὐ γὰρ ἀπὸ δρυός ἐσσι οὐδʼ ἀπὸ πέτρης thou art no foundling from tree or rock, i.e. you have parents and a country, Od.; οὐ νῦν ἐστιν ἀπὸ δρυὸς οὐδʼ ἀπὸ πέτρης ὀαρίζειν it is no time now to talk at ease from tree or rock, Il..
of other trees, πίειρα δρῦς the resinous wood (of the pine), Soph.; of the olive Eur..
metaph. a worn-out old man, Anth.

div1.head: δρῦς
div1.sense: originally a tree (which indeed comes from the same Root), commonly the oak, Lat. quercus, Hom., etc.; sacred to Zeus, who gave his oracles from the oaks of Dodona, Od.;—hence, αἱ προσήγοροι δρύες Aesch.:—proverb., οὐ γὰρ ἀπὸ δρυός ἐσσι οὐδʼ ἀπὸ πέτρης thou art no foundling from tree or rock, i. e. thou hast parents and a country, Od.; οὐ νῦν ἐστιν ἀπὸ δρυὸς οὐδʼ ἀπὸ πέτρης ὀαρίζειν ʼtis no time now to talk at ease from tree or rock, Il.
of other trees, πίειρα δρῦς the resinous wood (of the pine), Soph.; of the olive, Eur.
metaph. a wornout old man, Anth.

div1.head: δρυτόμος
div1.sense: a wood-cutter, Il.

div1.head: δρύφακτος
div1.sense: a fence or railing, serving as the bar of the law-courts or council-chamber, Ar.; in pl., like Lat. cancelli, Ar.

div1.head: δρύψια
div1.sense: parings, Anth.

div1.head: δρωπακίζω
div1.sense: to get rid of hair by pitch-plasters, Luc.

div1.head: δυάς
div1.sense: the number two, Plat.

div1.head: δυάω
div1.sense: to plunge in misery, Epic 3rd pl. δυόωσιν Od.

div1.head: δυήπαθος
div1.sense: much-suffering, Hhymn.

div1.head: δύη
div1.sense: woe, misery, anguish, pain, Od., Trag.; δυηπαθίη, ἡ, misery, Anth.

div1.head: δύναμαι
div1.etym: decl. in pres. and imperf. like ἵσταμαι
div1.sense: Dep.

to be able, capable, strong enough to do, c. inf., Hom., etc.; but the inf. is often omitted, Ζεὺς δύναται ἅπαντα sc. ποιεῖν Od.; so also, μέγα δυνάμενος very powerful, mighty, Od.; οἱ δυνάμενοι men of power, Eur., Thuc.; δυνάμενος παρά τινι having influence with him, Hdt., etc.
to be able, i. e. to dare or bear to do a thing, οὐδὲ ποιήσειν δύναται Od.; οὐκέτι ἐδύνατο βιοτεύειν Thuc.
with ὡς and a Sup., ὡς ἐδύναντο ἀδηλότατα as secretly as they could, Thuc.; ὡς δύναμαι μάλιστα as much as I possibly can, Plat.; or simply ὡς ἐδύνατο in the best way he could, Xen.
to pass for, i. e.
of money, to be worth so much, c. acc., ὁ σίγλος δύναται ἑπτὰ ὀβολούς the shekel is worth 20 obols, Xen.
of number, to be equivalent to, τριηκόσιαι γενεαὶ δυνέαται μύρια ἔτεα Hdt.

of words, to signify, mean, Lat. valere, Hdt., etc.; ἴσον δύναται, Lat. idem valet, Hdt.; τὴν αὐτὴν δύνασθαι δουλείαν to mean the same slavery, Thuc.:—also to avail, οὐδένα καιρὸν δύναται avails to no good purpose, Eur.
impers., οὐ δύναται, c. inf., it cannot be, is not to be, Hdt.

div1.head: δύναμις
div1.sense: power, might, strength, Hom.: then, generally, strength, power, ability to do a thing, Hom.; παρὰ δύναμιν beyond oneʼs strength, Thuc.; ὑπὲρ δ. Dem.; κατὰ δ. as far as lies in one, Lat. pro virili, Hdt.
power, might, authority, Aesch., etc.
a force for war, forces, Xen.
a quantity, Lat. vis, χρημάτων δ. Hdt., etc.
a power, faculty, capacity, αἱ τοῦ σώματος δυνάμεις Plat., etc.; also of plants, etc., Xen.
the force or meaning of a word, Plat., etc.
the worth or value of money, Thuc.

div1.head: δυναμόω
div1.sense: to strengthen: Pass., NTest.

div1.head: δυναστεία
div1.sense: power, lordship, sovereignty, Soph., Thuc., etc.
an oligarchy, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: δυναστεύω
div1.sense: to hold power or lordship, be powerful, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: δυνάστης
div1.sense: a lord, master, ruler, of Zeus, Soph.; οἱ δ., Lat. optimates, Hdt.: in Aesch., the stars are λαμπροὶ δυνάσται.

div1.head: δυναστικός
div1.sense: arbitrary, Arist.

div1.head: δυνατέω
div1.sense: to be powerful, mighty, NTest.

div1.head: δυνατός
div1.sense: strong, mighty, able, esp. in body, τὸ δυνατώτατον the ablest-bodied men, Hdt.:—of ships, fit for service, Thuc.
c. inf. able to do, Hdt., etc.
powerful, Hdt.; οἱ δυνατοί the chief men of rank and influence, Thuc.

pass., of things, possible, Lat. quod fieri possit, Hdt., etc.:— δυνατόν ἐστι, c. inf., Hdt., Aesch., etc.; ὁδὸς δυνατὴ καὶ τοῖς ὑποζυγίοις πορεύεσθαι practicable, Xen.: —κατὰ τὸ δυνατόν, quantum fieri possit, Plat., etc.; so, ἐς τὸ δ. Hdt.; ὅσον δυνατόν Eur., etc.
adv. -τῶς, strongly, powerfully, Aeschin.; δ. ἔχει it is possible, Hdt.

div1.head: δυοκαίδεκα
div1.sense: twelve, Il.

div1.head: δύο
div1.etym: can be indecl., like ἄμφω, by Hom., τῶν δύο μοιράων, δύω κανόνεσσι Il.; so in Hdt. and Attic Prose; but declined in Trag.
div1.sense: two, Il., etc.;—in Poets δύο or δύω may be joined with pl. Nouns, δύο δʼ ἄνδρες Il.:— εἰς δύο two and two, Xen.; σὺν δύο two together, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: δύσαγνος
div1.sense: unchaste, Luc.

div1.head: δυσαγρέω
div1.sense: to have bad sport in fishing, Plut.

div1.head: δυσάγων
div1.sense: having seen hard service, Plut.

div1.head: δυσάδελφος
div1.sense: unhappy in oneʼs brothers, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσαής
div1.sense: ill-blowing, stormy, of winds, Hom.; Epic gen. pl. δυσ-αήων for -αέων, Od.

div1.head: δυσάθλιος
div1.sense: most miserable, Soph.

div1.head: δυσαιανής
div1.sense: most melancholy, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσαίθριος
div1.sense: not clear, murky, Eur.

div1.head: δυσαίων
div1.sense: living a hard life, most miserable, Aesch., Soph.; αἰὼν δυσαίων a life that is no life, Eur.

div1.head: δυσαλγής
div1.sense: very painful, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσάλγητος
div1.sense: hard-hearted, Soph.

div1.head: δυσάλωτος
div1.sense: hard to catch or take, ἄγρα Plat.
hard to conquer, tutAesch.; c. gen., δ. κακῶν beyond reach of ills, Soph.

div1.head: δυσάμμορος
div1.sense: most miserable, Il.

div1.head: δυσανάκλητος
div1.sense: hard to call back, Plut.

div1.head: δυσανακόμιστος
div1.sense: hard to bring back or recal, Plut.; poet. δυσαγκόμιστος, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσανάπλοος
div1.sense: hard to sail up, Strab.

div1.head: δυσανασχετέω
div1.sense: to bear ill, Lat. aegre ferre, Thuc.: to be greatly vexed, ἐπί τινι Plut.

div1.head: δυσανάτρεπτος
div1.sense: hard to overthrow, Plut.

div1.head: δυσάντητος
div1.sense: disagreeable to meet, boding of ill, Luc.

div1.head: δυσαντίβλεπτος
div1.sense: hard to look in the face, Plut.

div1.head: δυσαπάλλακτος
div1.sense: hard to get rid of, Soph.

div1.head: δυσάπιστος
div1.sense: very disobedient, Anth.

div1.head: δυσαπόδεικτος
div1.sense: hard to demonstrate, Plat.

div1.head: δυσαπόκριτος
div1.sense: hard to answer, Luc.

div1.head: δυσαπότρεπτος
div1.sense: hard to dissuade, Xen.

div1.head: δυσάρεστος
div1.sense: hard to appease, implacable, Aesch.: — ill to please, peevish, morose, Eur., Xen.
illpleased, τινι with one, Eur.: τὸ δυσάρεστον displeasure, Plut.

div1.head: δυσαριστοτόκεια
div1.sense: unhappy mother of the noblest son, Il.

div1.head: δύσαρκτος
div1.sense: hard to govern, Aesch., Plut.

div1.head: δυσαρμοστία
div1.sense: disagreement, Plut.

div1.head: δυσάρμοστος
div1.sense: ill-united, Plut.

div1.head: δυσαυλία
div1.sense: ill or hard lodging, Aesch.

div1.head: δύσαυλος
div1.sense: δ. ἔρις, an unhappy contest with the flute (αὐλός) , Anth.

div1.head: δύσαυλος
div1.sense: inhospitable, Soph.

div1.head: δυσαφαίρετος
div1.sense: hard to take away, Arist.

div1.head: δυσαχής
div1.sense: most painful, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσβάστακτος
div1.sense: grievous to bear, NTest.

div1.head: δυσβατοποιέομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to make impassable, Xen.

div1.head: δύσβατος
div1.sense: inaccessible, impassable, Xen.
trodden in sorrow, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσβάϋκτος
div1.sense: sadly wailing, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσβίοτος
div1.sense: making life wretched, πενίη Anth.

div1.head: δυσβουλία
div1.sense: ill counsel, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: δύσβωλος
div1.sense: of ill soil, unfruitful, Anth.

div1.head: δύσγαμος
div1.sense: ill-wedded, Eur.

div1.head: δυσγάργαλις
div1.sense: very ticklish, skittish, Xen.

div1.head: δυσγένεια
div1.sense: low birth, Soph., etc.
meanness, Eur.

div1.head: δυσγενής
div1.sense: low-born, Eur., etc.
lowminded, low, mean, Eur.

div1.head: δυσγεφύρωτος
div1.sense: hard to bridge over, Strab.

div1.head: δύσγνοια
div1.sense: ignorance, doubt, Eur.

div1.head: δυσγνωσία
div1.sense: difficulty of knowing, Eur.

div1.head: δυσγοήτευτος
div1.sense: hard to seduce by enchantments, Plat.

div1.head: δυσδαιμονία
div1.sense: misery, Eur.

div1.head: δυσδαίμων
div1.sense: of ill fortune, ill-fated, Trag., etc.

div1.head: δυσδάκρυτος
div1.sense: sorely wept, Aesch.
act. sorely weeping, Anth.

div1.head: δύσδαμαρ
div1.sense: ill-wived, ill-wedded, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσδιάθετος
div1.sense: hard to settle, Plut.

div1.head: δυσδιαίτητος
div1.sense: hard to decide, Plut.

div1.head: δυσδιάλυτος
div1.sense: hard to reconcile, Arist.

div1.head: δυσδιερεύνητος
div1.sense: hard to search through, Plat.

div1.head: δυσδίοδος
div1.sense: hard to pass through, Polyb.

div1.head: δύσεδρος
div1.sense: bringing evil by oneʼs abode, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσειδής
div1.sense: unshapely, ugly, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: δυσείματος
div1.sense: meanly clad, Eur.

div1.head: δυσείσβολος
div1.sense: hard to enter: Sup. -ώτατος, ον, least accessible, Thuc.

div1.head: δυσείσπλοος
div1.sense: hard to sail into, Strab.

div1.head: δυσέκθυτος
div1.sense: hard to avert by sacrifice, Plut.

div1.head: δυσέκλυτος
div1.sense: hard to undo: adv. -τως, indissolubly, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσέκνιπτος
div1.sense: hard to wash out, Plat.

div1.head: δυσεκπέρατος
div1.sense: hard to pass out from, Eur.

div1.head: δυσέκφευκτος
div1.sense: hard to escape from: adv. -τως, Anth.

div1.head: δυσέλεγκτος
div1.sense: hard to refute, Luc.

div1.head: Δυσελένα
div1.sense: ill-starred Helen, Eur.

div1.head: δύσελπις
div1.sense: hardly hoping, desponding, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: δυσέλπιστος
div1.sense: = δύσελπις, Plut.
unhoped for, ἐκ δυσελπίστων, unexpectedly, Xen.

div1.head: δυσέμβατος
div1.sense: hard to walk on, Thuc.

div1.head: δυσέμβολος
div1.sense: hard to enter, inaccessible, Xen.

div1.head: δυσεντερία
div1.sense: dysentery, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: δυσέντευκτος
div1.sense: hard to speak with, Theophr.

div1.head: δυσεξαπάτητος
div1.sense: hard to deceive, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: δυσέξαπτος
div1.sense: hard to loose from bonds, Plut.

div1.head: δυσεξαρίθμητος
div1.sense: hard to enumerate, Polyb.

div1.head: δυσεξέλεγκτος
