div1.sense: hard to refute, Plat.

div1.head: δυσεξέλικτος
div1.sense: hard to unfold, Plut.

div1.head: δυσεξερεύνητος
div1.sense: hard to investigate, Arist.

div1.head: δυσεξημέρωτος
div1.sense: hard to tame, Plut.

div1.head: δυσεξήνυστος
div1.sense: indissoluble, Eur.

div1.head: δυσέξοδος
div1.sense: hard to get out of, Arist.

div1.head: δυσεπιβούλευτος
div1.sense: hard to attack secretly, Xen.

div1.head: δυσέραστος
div1.sense: unfavourable to love, Anth.

div1.head: δυσεργία
div1.sense: difficulty in acting, Plut.

div1.head: δύσεργος
div1.sense: unfit for work, Plut.

div1.head: δυσέρημος
div1.sense: very lonely, desolate, Anth.

div1.head: δύσερις
div1.sense: very quarrelsome, contentious, Plat.
act. producing unhappy strife, Plut.

div1.head: δυσέριστος
div1.sense: shed in unholy strife, Soph.

div1.head: δυσερμήνευτος
div1.sense: hard to interpret, NTest.

div1.head: δύσερως
div1.sense: sick in love with, τινος Eur., Thuc.
hardly loving, stony-hearted, Theocr.

div1.head: δυσευνήτωρ
div1.sense: an ill bedfellow, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσεύρετος
div1.sense: hard to find out, Aesch.
hard to find or get, Xen.
hard to find oneʼs way through, impenetrable, Eur.

div1.head: δύσζηλος
div1.sense: exceeding jealous, Od., Plut.:—adv., δυσζήλως ἔχειν πρός τινα Plut.

div1.head: δυσζήτητος
div1.sense: hard to seek or track, Xen.

div1.head: δύσζωος
div1.sense: wretched, Anth.

div1.head: δυσήκεστος
div1.sense: hard to heal or cure, Anth.

div1.head: δυσήκοος
div1.sense: hard of hearing, Anth.

div1.head: δυσηλεγής
div1.sense: laying one on a hard bed, of death, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: δυσήλιος
div1.sense: sunless, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: δυσηνιόχητος
div1.sense: ungovernable, Luc.

div1.head: δυσηχής
div1.sense: ill-sounding, hateful, Il.

div1.head: δυσθαλπής
div1.sense: hard to warm: chilly, Il.

div1.head: δυσθανατέω
div1.sense: to die hard, die a lingering death, Hdt.: to struggle against death, Plat.

div1.head: δυσθάνατος
div1.sense: bringing a hard death, Eur.

div1.head: δυσθανής
div1.sense: having died a hard death, Anth.

div1.head: δυσθέατος
div1.sense: ill to look on, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: δύσθεος
div1.sense: godless, ungodly, Aesch.; hateful to the gods, Soph.

div1.head: δυσθεράπευτος
div1.sense: hard to cure, Soph.

div1.head: δυσθετέω
div1.sense: Usu. mid., δυσθετέομαι, to be much vexed, Xen.

div1.head: δυσθήρατος
div1.sense: hard to catch, Plut.

div1.head: δυσθρήνητος
div1.sense: loud-wailing, most mournful, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: δύσθροος
div1.sense: ill-sounding, Aesch. to be dispirited, to despond, Hhymn.

div1.head: δυσθυμέω
div1.sense: Mid. to be melancholy, angry, Eur.

div1.head: δυσθυμία
div1.sense: despondency, despair, Eur., Plat., etc.

div1.head: δύσθυμος
div1.sense: desponding, melancholy, repentant, Soph., etc.: τὸ δύσθυμον δυσθυμία, Plut. adv., -μως, comp. -ότερον, Plat.

div1.head: δυσίατος
div1.sense: hard to heal, incurable, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: δυσιερέω
div1.sense: to have bad omens in a sacrifice, Plut.

div1.head: δυσιθάλασσος
div1.sense: dipped in the sea, Anth.

div1.head: δύσιππος
div1.sense: hard to ride in; τὰ δ. parts unfit for cavalry-service, Xen., Plut.

div1.head: δύσις
div1.sense: a setting of the sun or stars, Aesch., etc.
the quarter in which the sun sets, the west, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: δυσκάθαρτος
div1.sense: hard to satisfy by purification or atonement, Soph., Ar.

div1.head: δυσκάθεκτος
div1.sense: hard to hold in, ἵπποι Xen.

div1.head: δύσκαπνος
div1.sense: noisome from smoke, smoky, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσκαρτέρητος
div1.sense: hard to endure, Plut.

div1.head: δυσκαταμάθητος
div1.sense: hard to learn or understand, Isocr. adv., -τως ἔχειν Isocr.

div1.head: δυσκατάπαυστος
div1.sense: hard to check, restless, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: δυσκατάπρακτος
div1.sense: hard to effect, Xen.

div1.head: δυσκατάστατος
div1.sense: hard to restore or rally, Xen.

div1.head: δυσκαταφρόνητος
div1.sense: not to be despised, Xen.

div1.head: δυσκέλαδος
div1.sense: ill-sounding, shrieking, discordant, Il., Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: δυσκηδής
div1.sense: full of misery, Od.

div1.head: δύσκηλος
div1.sense: past remedy, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσκίνητος
div1.sense: hard to move, Plat.:— immovable, resolute, Plut.: inexorable, Anth.

div1.head: δυσκλεής
div1.sense: infamous, shameful, Il., Aesch., Xen. adv. -εῶς, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: δύσκλεια
div1.sense: ill-fame, an ill name, infamy, Eur., Thuc.; ἐπὶ δυσκλείᾳ tending to disgrace him, Soph.

div1.head: δυσκοινώνητος
div1.sense: unsocial, Plat.

div1.head: δυσκολαίνω
div1.sense: to be peevish or discontented,Ar.: to shew displeasure, Xen.

div1.head: δυσκολία
div1.sense: discontent, peevishness, Ar., Plat.
of things, difficulty, Dem.

div1.head: δυσκόλλητος
div1.sense: ill-glued or fastened, loose, Luc.

div1.head: δυσκολόκαμπτος
div1.sense: hard to bend: δ. καμπή an intricate flourish in singing, Ar.

div1.head: δυσκολόκοιτος
div1.sense: making bed uneasy, Ar.

div1.head: δύσκολος
div1.sense: of persons, properly, hard to satisfy with food; then, generally, hard to please, discontented, fretful, peevish, Eur., Ar., etc.:—adv., δυσκόλως ἔχειν, διακεῖσθαι to be peevish, Plat.
of things, troublesome, harassing, Plat.; generally, unpleasant, Dem.:— δύσκολόν ἐστι it is difficult, NTest.:—adv. -λως, hardly, with difficulty, NTest.

div1.head: δύσκολπος
div1.sense: with ill-formed womb, Anth.

div1.head: δυσκόμιστος
div1.sense: hard to bear, intolerable, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: δυσκρασία
div1.sense: bad temperament, Lat. intemperies, of the air, Plut.

div1.head: δύσκρατος
div1.sense: of bad temperament, Strab.

div1.head: δύσκριτος
div1.sense: hard to discern or interpret, Aesch., Soph.: δύσκριτόν ἐστι, c. inf., Plat. adv. -τως, doubtfully, darkly, Aesch.; δ. ἔχειν to be in doubt, Ar.

div1.head: δυσκύμαντος
div1.sense: arising from the stormy sea, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσκωφέω
div1.sense: to be stone-deaf, Anth.

div1.head: δύσλεκτος
div1.sense: hard to tell, Lat. infandus, Aesch.

div1.head: δύσληπτος
div1.sense: hard to catch, Luc.

div1.head: δυσλόγιστος
div1.sense: ill-calculating, Soph.

div1.head: δύσλοφος
div1.sense: hard for the neck, hard to bear, Theogn., Aesch.
impatient of the yoke: adv., impatiently, Eur.

div1.head: δύσλυτος
div1.sense: indissoluble, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: δυσμαθέω
div1.sense: to be slow at recognising, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσμαθής
div1.sense: hard to learn, Aesch.; δ. ἰδεῖν hard to know at sight, Eur.: τὸ δυσμαθές difficulty of knowing Eur.
act. slow at learning, Plat.:—adv., δυσμαθῶς ἔχειν to be so, Plat.

div1.head: δυσμαθία
div1.sense: slowness at learning, Plat.

div1.head: δυσμαχέω
div1.sense: to fight in vain against, or, to fight an unholy fight with, τινί Soph.

div1.head: δυσμαχητέος
div1.sense: one must fight desperately with, Soph.

div1.head: δύσμαχος
div1.sense: hard to fight with, unconquerable, Aesch., Eur., etc.: generally, difficult, Aesch. to bear ill-will, τινί against another, Eur., Dem.

div1.head: δυσμένεια
div1.sense: ill-will, enmity, Soph., Eur., etc.

div1.head: δυσμενέων
div1.etym: a participial form only in masc.
div1.sense: bearing ill-will, hostile, Od.

div1.head: δυσμενής
div1.sense: full of ill-will, hostile, Il., Hdt., Trag.; rarely c. gen., ἄνδρα δ. χθονός an enemy of the land, Soph.
rarely of things, Soph., Xen.

div1.head: δυσμεταχείριστος
div1.sense: hard to manage: hard to attack, Hdt.

div1.head: δύσμηνις
div1.sense: wrathful, Anth.

div1.head: δυσμήνιτος
div1.sense: visited by heavy wrath, Anth.

div1.head: δυσμή
div1.etym: = δύσις, mostly in pl., Soph., etc.;
div1.sense: ἐπὶ δυσμῇσιν at the point of setting, Hdt.
the quarter of sunset, the west, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: δυσμήτηρ
div1.sense: not a mother, Od.

div1.head: δυσμηχανέω
div1.sense: to be at loss how to do, c. inf., Aesch.

div1.head: δυσμίμητος
div1.sense: hard to imitate, Luc.

div1.head: δυσμορία
div1.sense: a hard fate, Anth.

div1.head: δύσμορος
div1.sense: ill-fated, ill-starred, Il., Soph.:—adv. -ρως, with ill fortune, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσμορφία
div1.sense: badness of form, ugliness, Hdt.

div1.head: δύσμορφος
div1.sense: misshapen, ill-favoured, ἐσθής Eur.

div1.head: δύσμουσος
div1.sense: unmusical, Anth.

div1.head: δυσνίκητος
div1.sense: hard to conquer, Plut.

div1.head: δύσνιπτος
div1.sense: hard to wash out, Soph.

div1.head: δυσνοέω
div1.sense: to be ill-affected, τινι Plut.

div1.head: δύσνοια
div1.sense: disaffection, ill-will, malevolence, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: δυσνομία
div1.sense: lawlessness, a bad constitution, Solon.

div1.head: δύσνομος
div1.sense: lawless, unrighteous, Anth.

div1.head: δύσνοστος
div1.sense: δύσ-νοστος νόστος, a return that is no return, Eur.

div1.head: δύσνοος
div1.sense: ill-affected, disaffected, τινι Soph., Eur., etc.

div1.head: δυσνύμφευτος
div1.sense: unpleasing to marry, Anth.

div1.head: δύσνυμφος
div1.sense: ill-wedded or ill-betrothed, Eur.

div1.head: δυσξύμβολος
div1.sense: hard to deal with, driving a hard bargain, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: δυσξύνετος
div1.sense: hard to understand, unintelligible, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: δύσογκος
div1.sense: over heavy, burdensome, Plut.

div1.head: δυσοδέω
div1.sense: to make bad way, get on slowly, Plut.

div1.head: δυσοδοπαίπαλος
div1.sense: difficult and rugged, Aesch.

div1.head: δύσοδος
div1.sense: hard to pass, scarce passable, Thuc.

div1.head: δυσοίζω
div1.sense: to be distressed, to fear, Eur.:— δυσοίζω φόβῳ to tremble with fear at a thing, c. acc., Aesch.
div1.etym: οἴζω is formed from οἶ oh! as οἰμώζω from οἴμοι.

div1.head: δυσοίκητος
div1.sense: bad to dwell in, Xen.

div1.head: δύσοιστος
div1.sense: hard to bear, insufferable, Aesch., Soph. fut. mid. of δύω.

div1.head: δύσομβρος
div1.sense: stormy, wintry, Soph.

div1.head: δυσόμιλος
div1.sense: hard to live with, bringing evil in oneʼs company, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσόμματος
div1.sense: scarce-seeing, purblind, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσόρατος
div1.sense: hard to see, Xen.

div1.head: δύσοργος
div1.sense: quick to anger, Soph.

div1.head: δύσορμος
div1.sense: with bad anchorage, Aesch.:— τὰ δύσορμα rough ground, where one can scarce get footing, Xen.
act., πνοαὶ δ. that detained the fleet in harbour, Aesch.

div1.head: δύσορνις
div1.sense: ill-omened, boding ill, Aesch., Eur.:— with ill auspices, Plut.

div1.head: δυσόρφναιος
div1.sense: dusky, Eur.

div1.head: δυσοσμία
div1.sense: an ill smell, ill savour, Soph.

div1.head: δύσοσμος
div1.sense: ill-smelling, stinking, Hdt.
bad for scent, in hunting, Xen.

div1.head: δυσούριστος
div1.sense: driven by a too favourable wind, fatally favourable, Soph.

div1.head: δυσπάθεια
div1.sense: firmness in resisting, Plut.

div1.head: δυσπαθέω
div1.sense: to suffer a hard fate, Mosch.
to be impatient, ἐπί τινι, πρός τι Plut.

div1.head: δυσπαθής
div1.sense: impatient of suffering, Plut.: hardly feeling, impassive, Luc.

div1.head: δυσπάλαιστος
div1.sense: hard to wrestle with, Aesch., Eur., Xen.

div1.head: δυσπάλαμος
div1.sense: hard to conquer, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσπαλής
div1.sense: hard to wrestle with, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσπαράβλητος
div1.sense: incomparable, Plut.

div1.head: δυσπαραίτητος
div1.sense: hard to move by prayer, inexorable, Aesch., Plut.

div1.head: δυσπαρακόμιστος
div1.sense: hard to carry along, difficult, Polyb.

div1.head: δυσπαραμύθητος
div1.sense: hard to appease, Plut.

div1.head: δυσπάρευνος
div1.sense: ill-mated, Soph.

div1.head: δυσπαρήγορος
div1.sense: hard to appease, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσπάρθενος
div1.sense: unhappy maiden, Anth.

div1.head: Δύσπαρις
div1.sense: unhappy Paris, ill-starred Paris, Il.; cf. Δυσελένα.

div1.head: δυσπάριτος
div1.sense: hard to pass, Xen.

div1.head: δυσ-
div1.sense: insepar. Prefix, like un- or mis- (in un-lucky, mis-chance), destroying the good sense of a word, or increasing its bad sense.

div1.head: δυσπειθής
div1.sense: hardly obeying, self-willed, intractable, Xen.:—adv., δυσπειθῶς ἔχειν Plut.

div1.head: δύσπεμπτος
div1.sense: hard to send away, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσπέμφελος
div1.etym: perh. from same Root as πέμφιξ
div1.sense: of the sea, rough and stormy, Il., Hes.:—metaph, rude, uncourteous, Hes.

div1.head: δυσπενθής
div1.sense: bringing sore affliction, direful, Pind.

div1.head: δυσπέρατος
div1.sense: hard to get through, Eur.

div1.head: δυσπερίληπτος
div1.sense: hard to encompass, Arist.

div1.head: δυσπετής
div1.sense: falling out ill, most difficult, Soph. adv. δυσπετῶς, Ionic -έως, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσπήμαντος
div1.sense: full of grievous evil, disastrous, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσπινής
div1.sense: squalid, Soph.

div1.head: δύσπλανος
div1.sense: wandering in misery, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσπλοΐα
div1.sense: difficulty of sailing, Anth.

div1.head: δύσπλοος
div1.sense: bad for sailing, Anth.

div1.head: δύσπνοια
div1.sense: difficulty of breathing, Xen.

div1.head: δύσπνοος
div1.sense: scant of breath, Soph.
δ. πνοαί contrary winds, Soph.

div1.head: δυσπολέμητος
div1.sense: hard to war with, Dem.

div1.head: δυσπόλεμος
div1.sense: unlucky in war, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσπολιόρκητος
div1.sense: hard to take by siege, Xen.

div1.head: δυσπονής
div1.sense: toilsome, Od.

div1.head: δυσπόνητος
div1.sense: bringing toil and trouble, Aesch.
laborious, Soph.

div1.head: δύσπονος
div1.sense: toilsome, Soph.

div1.head: δυσπόρευτος
div1.sense: hard to pass, Xen.

div1.head: δυσπορία
div1.sense: difficulty of passing, Xen.

div1.head: δυσπόριστος
div1.sense: gotten with much labour: τὸ δ. difficulty of getting, Plut.

div1.head: δύσπορος
div1.sense: hard to pass, scarce passable, Xen.

div1.head: δύσποτμος
div1.sense: unlucky, ill-starred, unhappy, wretched, Trag.; δ. εὐχαί i. e. curses, Aesch.; comp. δυσποτμώτερος Eur. adv. -μως, Aesch.

div1.head: δύσποτος
div1.sense: unpalatable, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσπραγέω
div1.sense: to be unlucky, Aesch., Plut.

div1.head: δυσπραξία
div1.sense: ill success, ill luck, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: δυσπρεπής
div1.sense: base, undignified, Eur.

div1.head: δυσπρόσβατος
div1.sense: hard to approach, Thuc.

div1.head: δυσπρόσιτος
div1.sense: difficult of access, Eur.

div1.head: δυσπρόσμαχος
div1.sense: hard to attack, Plut.

div1.head: δυσπρόσοδος
div1.sense: hard to get at, difficult of access, Thuc.; of men, unsocial, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: δυσπρόσοιστος
div1.sense: hard to approach, Soph.

div1.head: δυσπρόσοπτος
div1.sense: hard to look on, horrid to behold, Soph.

div1.head: δυσπροσπέλαστος
div1.sense: hard to get at, Plut.

div1.head: δυσπρόσωπος
div1.sense: of ill aspect, Plut.

div1.head: δυσραγής
div1.sense: hard to break, Luc.

div1.head: δύσριγος
div1.sense: impatient of cold, Hdt.

div1.head: δυσσέβεια
div1.sense: impiety, ungodliness, Trag.
a charge of impiety, Soph.

div1.head: δυσσεβέω
div1.sense: to think or act ungodly, Trag.

div1.head: δυσσεβής
div1.sense: ungodly, impious, profane, Trag.

div1.head: δύσσοος
div1.sense: hard to save, ruined, Theocr.

div1.head: δυσσύνοπτος
div1.sense: hard to get a view of, Polyb.

div1.head: δυστάλας
div1.sense: most miserable, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: δυστέκμαρτος
div1.sense: hard to make out from the given signs, hard to trace, inexplicable, Trag.

div1.head: δύστεκνος
div1.sense: unfortunate in children, Soph.

div1.head: δυστερπής
div1.sense: ill-pleasing, Aesch.

div1.head: δύστηνος
div1.sense: wretched, unhappy, unfortunate, disastrous, mostly of persons, Hom., Trag.; δυστήνων δέ τε παῖδες ἐμῷ μένει ἀντιόωσιν unhappy are they whose sons encounter me, Il.
of things, Trag., Ar.: Sup. adv., δυστανοτάτως Eur.
after Hom., in moral sense, wretched, like Lat. miser (a wretch), Soph.
div1.etym: Prob. for δύσστηνος; but the origin of -στηνος is uncertain.

div1.head: δυστήρητος
div1.sense: hard to keep, Plut.

div1.head: δυστλήμων
div1.sense: suffering hard things, Hhymn.

div1.head: δύστλητος
div1.sense: hard to bear, Aesch.

div1.head: δυστοκεύς
div1.sense: an unhappy parent, Anth.

div1.head: δυστοκέω
div1.sense: to be in sore travail, of women:— metaph., δυστοκεῖ πόλις Ar.

div1.head: δυστομέω
div1.sense: to speak evil of, τινά τι Soph.

div1.head: δύστομος
div1.sense: bad of mouth: hardmouthed, Anth.

div1.head: δύστονος
div1.sense: lamentable, Aesch.

div1.head: δυστόπαστος
div1.sense: hard to guess, Eur.

div1.head: δυστόχαστος
div1.sense: hard to hit, Plut.

div1.head: δυστράπεζος
div1.sense: fed on horrid food, Eur.

div1.head: δυστράπελος
div1.sense: hard to deal with, intractable, stubborn, Soph.:—adv. -λως, awkwardly, Xen.

div1.head: δύστροπος
div1.sense: hard to turn, intractable, Eur., Dem.

div1.head: δυστυχέω
div1.sense: to be unlucky, unhappy, unfortunate, Hdt., Attic; τινι in a thing, Eur.; περί τινος Eur.; ἔν τινι Ar.; also, πάντα δυστυχεῖν Eur.

div1.head: δυστύχημα
div1.sense: a piece of ill luck, a failure, Plat.

div1.head: δυστυχής
div1.sense: unlucky, unfortunate, Trag., etc.; τὰ δυστυχῆ δυστυχίαι, Aesch.:—adv. -χῶς, Aesch.
ill-starred, harbinger of ill, Aesch.

div1.head: δυστυχία
div1.sense: ill luck, ill fortune, Eur., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: δυσυπόστατος
div1.sense: hard to withstand, Plut.

div1.head: δυσφαής
div1.sense: scarce visible, Plut.

div1.head: δύσφατος
div1.sense: hard to speak, unutterable, Lat. nefandus, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσφημέω
div1.sense: to use ill words, esp. words of ill omen, Trag.
trans. to speak ill of, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: δυσφημία
div1.sense: ill language, words of ill omen, Soph.

div1.head: δύσφημος
div1.sense: of ill omen, boding, Hes., Eur.
slanderous, Theogn.

div1.head: δυσφιλής
div1.sense: hateful, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: δυσφορέω
div1.sense: to bear with pain, bear ill, Lat. aegre ferre: intr. to be impatient, angry, vexed, Hdt., Soph.; τινι at a thing, Aesch., Eur.; ἐπί τινι Aesch.

div1.head: δυσφόρητος
div1.sense: hard to bear, Eur.

div1.head: δυσφόρμιγξ
div1.sense: unsuited to the lyre, Eur.

div1.head: δύσφορος
div1.sense: hard to bear, heavy, Xen.

mostly of sufferings, hard to bear, grievous, Trag.; δύσφοροι γνῶμαι false, blinding fancies, Soph.; τὰ δύσφορα our troubles, sorrows, Soph.:— δύσφορόν ἐστι Xen.:—adv., δυσφόρως ἔχειν to be hard to bear, Soph.
of food, oppressive, Xen.
(from Pass.) moving with difficulty, slow of motion, Xen.

div1.head: δυσφρόνη
div1.sense: = δυσφροσύνη: in pl. troubles, Hes.

div1.head: δυσφρόνως
div1.sense: rashly, Aesch.

div1.head: δυσφροσύνη
div1.sense: anxiety, care, Hes., in Epic gen. pl. δυσφροσυνάων.

div1.head: δύσφρων
div1.sense: sad at heart, sorrowful, melancholy, Trag.
ill-disposed, malignant, Aesch., Eur.
= ἄφρων, insensate, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: δυσφύλακτος
div1.sense: hard to keep off or prevent, Eur.

div1.head: δυσχείμερος
div1.sense: suffering from hard winters, very wintry, freezing, Il., Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: δυσχείρωμα
div1.sense: a thing hard to be subdued, a hard conquest, Soph.

div1.head: δυσχείρωτος
div1.sense: hard to subdue, Hdt., Dem.

div1.head: δυσχεραίνω
div1.sense: to be unable to endure a thing, bear with an ill grace, Lat. aegre ferre, c. acc., Plat.; c. acc. et part. to be annoyed at his doing, Aeschin.
intr. to feel annoyance, to be discontented, displeased, vexed, τινός for or because of a thing, Plat., etc.; τινί at a thing, Dem.:—Pass. to be hateful, Plut.
c. inf. to scorn to do a thing, Plat.
Causal, to cause vexation, ῥήματα τέρψαντα ἢ δυσχεράναντʼ Soph.
δ. ἐν τοῖς λόγοις to make difficulties in argument, to be captious, Plat.

div1.head: δυσχέρεια
div1.sense: of things, annoyance or disgust caused by a thing, Soph.
difficulty in doing a thing, Plat.
of persons, peevishness, ill temper: loathing, nausea, Plat., Theophr.

div1.head: δυσχερής
div1.sense: hard to take in hand or manage, of things, annoying, vexatious, discomfortable, Trag.: τὸ δυσχερές, δυσχέρεια, Eur.; δυσχερὲς ποιεῖσθαί τι, Lat. aegre ferre, Thuc.; τὰ δυσχερῆ difficulties, Dem.
of arguments, contradictory, captious, Plat., etc.
of persons, ill tempered, unfriendly, hateful, τινι to one, Soph., Eur., etc.; δ. περί τι fastidious, Plat.
adv., δυσχερῶς ἔχειν to be annoyed, Plat.

div1.head: δύσχιμος
div1.sense: wintry, troublesome, dangerous, fearful, Lat. horridus, Trag.

div1.head: δυσχλαινία
div1.sense: mean clothing, Eur.

div1.head: δύσχορτος
div1.sense: with little grass, ill off for food, Eur.

div1.head: δυσχρηστέω
div1.sense: to be in difficulty or distress, Polyb.

div1.head: δύσχρηστος
div1.sense: hard to use, nearly useless, Xen.; intractable, Xen.:—adv. -τως ἔχειν to be in distress, Plut.

div1.head: δυσχωρία
div1.sense: difficult, rough ground, Xen.

div1.head: δυσώδης
div1.sense: ill-smelling, Hdt., Soph., Thuc.

div1.head: δυσώδινος
div1.sense: causing grievous pangs, Anth.

div1.head: δυσωνέω
div1.sense: to beat down the price, cheapen, Anth.

trans.i: one who beats down the price.

div1.head: δυσώνυμος
div1.sense: bearing an ill name, ill-omened, Hom., Soph., etc.; esp. bearing a name of ill omen, such as Αἴας, Soph.

div1.head: δυσωπέω
div1.sense: to put out of countenance, put to shame, τινά Luc.: absol. to be importunate, Plut.
in good authors only:—Pass. to be put out of countenance, to be troubled, Plat.; of animals, to be shy, timid, Xen.
to be ashamed of, τι Plut.

div1.head: δυσωρέομαι
div1.sense: to keep painful watch, Il.

div1.head: δύτης
div1.sense: a diver, Hdt.

div1.head: δυωδεκάβοιος
div1.sense: worth twelve beeves, Il.

div1.head: δυωδεκάμηνος
div1.sense: twelve months old, Hes.

div1.head: δυωδεκάμοιρος
div1.sense: divided into twelve parts, Anth.

div1.head: δυώδεκα
div1.sense: δύο καὶ δέκα, twelve, in all genders, Lat. duo-decim, Hom., etc.

div1.head: δυώδεκα
div1.sense: twelve, in all genders, Lat. duo-decim, Hom., etc.

div1.head: δυωκαιεικοσίμετρος
div1.sense: holding 22 measures, Il.

div1.head: δυωκαιεικοσίπηχυς
div1.sense: 22 cubits long, Il.

div1.head: δύω
div1.sense: Causal in fut. and aor1, to strip off clothes, etc., Od. (in compd. ἐξ-έδῡσα).

non causal forms such as the stems δύω and δύ_νω: of Places or Countries, to enter, make oneʼs way into, τείχεα δύω (aor2 subj.) Il.; ἔδυ νέφεα plunged into the clouds, of a star, Il.; δῦτε θαλάσσης κόλπον plunge into the lap of Ocean, Il.; δύσεο μνηστῆρας go in to them, Od.: also with a prep., δύσομαι εἰς Ἀΐδαο Od.; δύσετʼ ἁλὸς κατὰ κῦμα Il.; ὑπὸ κῦμα ἔδυσαν Il.; δύσκεν εἰς Αἴαντα he got himself unto Ajax, i. e. got behind his shield, Il.

of the sun and stars, to sink into [the sea, v. supr.], to set, ἠέλιος μὲν ἔδυ Il.; Βοώτης ὀψὲ δύων late- setting Bootes, Od.; πρὸ δύντος ἡλίου Hdt.:—metaph., βίου δύντος αὐγαί Aesch.; ἔδυ δόμος the house sank, Aesch.
of clothes and armour, to get into, put on, Il.; metaph., εἰ μὴ σύγε δύσεαι ἀλκήν if thou wilt not put on strength (cf. ἐπιειμένος ἀλκήν):—ἀμφʼ ὤμοισιν ἐδύσετο τεύχεα Il.; ὤμοιϊν τεύχεα δῡθι Il.
of sufferings, passions, and the like, to enter, come over or upon, κάματος γυῖα δέδυκε Il.; ἄχος ἔδυνεν ἦτορ, etc., Il.; δῦ μιν Ἄρης the spirit of war filled him, Il.

div1.head: δωδεκάγναμπτος
div1.sense: bent twelve times, δωδεκ. τέρμα the post (in the race-course) that has been doubled twelve times, Pind.

div1.head: δωδεκάδαρχος
div1.sense: a leader of twelve, Xen.

div1.head: δωδεκάδραχμος
div1.sense: sold at 12 drachmae, Dem.

div1.head: δωδεκάδωρος
div1.sense: twelve palms long, Anth.

div1.head: δωδεκάεθλος
div1.sense: conqueror in 12 contests, Anth.

div1.head: δωδεκαετής
div1.sense: 2 years old, Plut.

div1.head: δωδεκάκις
div1.sense: adv. twelve times, Ar.

div1.head: δωδεκάλινος
div1.sense: of twelve threads, Xen.

div1.head: δωδεκαμήχανος
div1.sense: knowing twelve arts or tricks, Ar.

div1.head: δωδεκάπαις
div1.sense: with twelve children, Anth.

div1.head: δωδεκάπαλαι
div1.sense: twelve times long ago, ever so long ago, Ar.

div1.head: δωδεκάπηχυς
div1.sense: twelve cubits long, Hdt.

div1.head: δωδεκάπολις
div1.sense: formed of twelve united states, Hdt.

div1.head: δώδεκα
div1.sense: twelve, Hom., etc.: v. δυώδεκα.

div1.head: δωδεκάσκαλμος
div1.sense: twelve-oared, Plut.

div1.head: δωδεκάσκυτος
div1.sense: of twelve pieces of leather, Plat.

div1.head: δωδεκάς
div1.sense: the number twelve, Anth.

div1.head: δωδεκαταῖος
div1.sense: on the twelfth day, Plat.
twelve days old, Hes. (in Epic form duwd-) .

div1.head: δωδέκατος
div1.sense: the twelfth, Hom., etc.: Epic δυωδ-, Hom.

div1.head: δωδεκαφόρος
div1.sense: bearing twelve times a year, Luc.

div1.head: δωδεκάφυλος
div1.sense: of twelve tribes, τὸ δ. the twelve tribes of Israel, NTest.

div1.head: δωδεκέτης
div1.sense: twelve years old, Plut.:—fem. δωδεκέτις, Anth.

div1.head: Δωδωναῖος
div1.sense: of Dodona, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: Δωδώνη
div1.sense: Dodona, in Epirus, the seat of the most ancient oracle of Zeus, Hom., etc.
div1.etym: Soph. uses the heterocl. forms Δωδῶνος, -ῶνι, -ῶνα (as if from Δωδών).

div1.head: δῶμα
div1.sense: a house, Hom., Trag.: part of a house, the chief room, hall, Hom.:—hence in pl. for a single house, Od., Trag.
a house, household, family, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: δωμάτιον
div1.sense: a chamber, bed-chamber, Plat.

div1.head: δωματῖτις
div1.sense: fem. adj. of the house, Aesch.

div1.head: δωματοφθορέω
div1.sense: to ruin the house, Aesch.

div1.head: δωμάω
div1.sense: to build: Mid. to cause to be built, Anth.

div1.head: δωρεά
div1.sense: a gift, present, esp. a free gift, bounty, Lat. beneficium, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
acc. δωρεάν as adv., as a free gift, freely, Lat. gratis, Hdt.
to no purpose, in vain, NTest.

div1.head: δωρέω
div1.sense: to give, present, Hes., Pind.:— Pass., aor1 ἐδωρήθην, to be given or presented, Hdt.; of persons, to be presented with a thing, Soph.

also as Mid., Il.; δωρέεσθαί τί τινι to present a thing to one, Lat. donare aliquid alicui, Hdt., Aesch., etc.; also, δ. τινά τινι to present one with a thing, Lat. donare aliquem aliquo, Aesch.; δ. τινά to make him presents, Hdt.

div1.head: δώρημα
div1.sense: that which is given, a gift, present, Hdt., Trag.

div1.head: δωρητήρ
div1.sense: a giver, Anth.

div1.head: δωρητός
div1.sense: of persons, open to gifts or presents, Il.
of things, freely given, Soph., Plut.

div1.head: Δωριεύς
div1.sense: a Dorian, descendant of Dorus: pl. Δωριεῖς, Attic -ῆς, οἱ, the Dorians, Od., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: Δωρίζω
div1.sense: to imitate the Dorians in life, dialect, or music, to speak Doric Greek, Theocr.

div1.head: Δωρικός
div1.sense: Doric, Hdt., Trag., etc.

div1.head: Δώριος
div1.sense: Dorian, Pind., Arist.

div1.head: Δωρίς
div1.sense: fem. adj. Dorian, Hdt., Thuc.: hence,
Δωρὶς νᾶσος the Dorian island, i. e. Peloponnesus, Pind., Soph.
(with or without γῆ) Doris, in Northern Greece, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
Δ. κόρα a Dorian damsel, Eur.

div1.head: Δωριστί
div1.sense: in Dorian fashion: ἡ Δ. ἁρμονία the Dorian mode or measure in music, Plat., etc.

div1.head: δωροδοκέω
div1.sense: to accept as a present, esp. to take as a bribe, ἀργύριον, χρυσόν Hdt., Plat.
absol. to take bribes, Hdt., Ar.
Pass.,
of persons, to have a bribe given one, δεδωροδόκηνται Dem.
of the bribe, τὰ δωροδοκηθέντα the bribes received, Aeschin.

div1.head: δωροδόκημα
div1.sense: acceptance of a bribe, corruption, Dem.

div1.head: δωροδοκία
div1.sense: a taking of bribes, openness to bribery, Oratt.

div1.head: δωροδοκιστί
div1.sense: in bribe-fashion, Ar., with a play on Δωριστί,

div1.head: δωροδόκος
div1.sense: taking presents or bribes, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: δωροδότης
div1.sense: a giver of presents, a giver, Anth.

div1.head: δῶρον
div1.sense: a gift, present, Hom.: a votive gift, Il.:— δῶρά τινος the gifts of, i. e. given by, him, δῶρα θεῶν Hom.; δῶρʼ Ἀφροδίτης, i. e. personal charms, Il.; c. gen. rei, ὕπνου δ. the blessing of sleep, Il.
δῶρα, presents given by way of bribe, Dem., etc.; δώρων ἑλεῖν τινα to convict him of receiving presents, Ar.
the breadth of the hand, the palm, as a measure of length; v. ἑκκαιδεκάδωρος.

div1.head: δωροφάγος
div1.sense: greedy of presents, Hes.

div1.head: δωροφορέω
div1.sense: to bring presents, τινί Plat.: to give as presents or bribes, τί τινι Ar.

div1.head: δωροφόρος
div1.sense: bringing presents, Pind., Anth.

div1.head: δωσίδικος
div1.sense: giving oneself up to justice, abiding by the law, Hdt.

div1.head: δώς
div1.sense: Lat. dos, = δόσις, Hes.

div1.head: Δώσων
div1.sense: fut. part. of δίδωμι, always going to give: Δώσων as a name of Antigonus II, promiser, Plut.

div1.head: δωτήρ
div1.sense: a giver, Od., Hes.:—so δώτης, ου, Hes.

div1.head: δωτινάζω
div1.sense: to receive or collect presents, Hdt.

div1.head: δωτίνη
div1.sense: a gift, present, Hom., Hdt.

div1.head: Δωτώ
div1.sense: giver, a Nereid, Il., Hes.
